loans.name: Celeste Del Rocio

texts.es:
Celeste del Rocío tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales menores, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, fideo, leche condimentos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Celeste del Rocío is 20 years old, single, doesn't have any children, and lives in her parents' house in the district of Morropon, a community with a warm climate whose people work in agriculture, trade and raising small animals, located in the province of the same name, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She works selling basic pantry items such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, beans, milk, and seasonings, among other things. Her business is located in her home and she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 600 nuevos soles to purchase a greater quantity of products to stock her business and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic pantry items to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle to increase his milk production

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, es soltero, actualmente viven en la casa de su padres, se dedica a transportar verduras en su camión desde del municipio hasta la capital, tiene ya 4 años de estar viajando, también se dedica a comprar y a vender verduras, Juan José necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 7,000.00 para darle mantenimiento y comprar de repuestos para el camión, el sueño de Juan José es construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Juan Jose is 23 years old and lives in the town of Solola, in the Solola state.  He is single and currently living in the home of his parents.  His occupation is transporting vegetables in his truck from the town to the capital.

He has been transporting goods for four years.  He is also engaged in buying and selling vegetables.

Juan Jose needs a loan in the amount of Q. 7,000.00 for maintenance and purchase of spare parts for the truck.  Juan Jose's dream is to build his own home.

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Elvinia Gissel

texts.es:
Elvinia Gissel es una joven de 22 años, soltera, originaria del municipio de El Jicaral, habita en la comarca Las Mojarras, un caserío ubicado tierra adentro a la orilla de un inmenso río llamado El Tamarindo que en época de invierno crece y les dificulta la pasada a los pobladores dejándolos muchas veces incomunicados para hacer sus gestiones en el departamento de León.
Elvinia estudia una carrera de ciencias de la educación y se desempeña como profesora de primaria desde hace varios años, ya que su sueño desde pequeña fue ser maestra el cual se ha cumplido solamente le hace falta tener su título universitario para ser remunerada  de la mejor manera.
De lunes a viernes imparte clases a sus niños y el sábado viaja a la ciudad de León a la universidad, por este motivo porque su salario es bajo está solicitando a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le apoyen financiando un crédito para pagar la universidad y el transporte, ya que cada día cuesta más el pasaje hacia León.
Con fe espera que le financien para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Elvinia Gissel is a 22-year-old young woman, single, and from the municipality of El Jicaral. She lives in the Las Mojarras region, a village located inland from the immense El Tamarindo river that in the winter grows and makes it difficult for the townspeople to cross, frequently leaving them out of communication to do their business in the León department. 

Elvinia is majoring in education science and has been working as a primary school teacher for several years, since her dream from when she was young was to be a teacher, which she has realized. She is only lacking a university degree to be paid better.
 
From Monday to Friday, she teaches classes to her children and Saturday she travels to the city of León to the university.  Because her salary is low, she is asking the Kiva lenders through Ceprodel to support her by financing a loan to pay university tuition and transportation, since every day the price rises for the trip to León.

With faith she hopes that they will finance her to carry out her investment.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and transportation.

loans.name: Mobeliza

texts.en:
Mobeliza is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for ten years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mobeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 36 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juvy would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Robelia

texts.en:
Robelia is 70 years old and widowed with six children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Shehas been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Robelia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cresenciano

texts.es:
Cresenciano tiene 49 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el Caserío Chaupe, una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maíz, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cresenciano is 49 years old, lives with his spouse and their two children in Chaupe village, a rural area in the Querocotillo district, a community with a varied climate, whose population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in Cutervo province which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works in agriculture, specifically in corn cultivation. His business is located at his home. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer for his crop and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

Milagros has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and married and she works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 28 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable seeds and fertilizers for her business. She has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leah would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables seeds and fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Gleceria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Gleceria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Enna Judith

texts.es: Enna una sonriente mujer de 26 años de edad dedica a la venta de tamales con lo que muy orgullosamente ha mantenido a su pequeño hijo, su único lema es mejorar cada día, por ello sabe perfectamente que debe aumentar sus ventas y para producir más necesita mayor capital de trabajo, razón por la cual acude a una entidad para solicitar una ayuda crediticia la cual invertirá en capital de trabajo  para repartir sus tamales y sonrisas en todo el sector.
texts.en:
Enna is a smiling 26 year old who sells tamales.  She is proud that she has been able to support his infant son by doing this.

Her only motto is to improve every day.  She knows she must increase sales and needs to produce more working capital.

For this reason, she has gone to a bank to apply for a loan.  With this loan, she will have working capital for making her tamales and spreading smiles across the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her tamales.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Marina una trabajadora, luchadora que junto con su esposo se dedicaron a cuidar fincas específicamente las que tenían cría de peces, al mudarse vieron en el sector la oportunidad de tener su propio negocio realizando la actividad que tantos años le había dado de comer pero ya como administradores, aprovechando la zona, sus zonas naturales y la abundancia de agua, quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de peces y alimento para poder abarcar los pedidos de los clientes pues sus buenos productos han despertado el interés de ellos y le han pedido en mayores cantidades lo que los tiene muy contentos pues tendrán mayores ingresos para su hogar y sus 3 hijos brindándoles mejores condiciones, estudios y una vivienda digna. Se proyecta tener un pedido de peces pero en miles en cuanto a cantidades pues sabe que tiene la capacidad y los clientes para llegar a esta meta
texts.en: Marina is a hard-wrking and determined woman who, with her husband, works taking care of farms, specifically those that raise fish. When they moved, they saw in this region the opportunity to have their own business doing the job that for many years they had fed fish but now as managers, taking advantage of the region with its natural areas and abundance of water.  She wants to ask for a loan to purchase fish and feed to be able to fill her customers' orders, since her good products have awakened their interest and they have ordered in higher quantities which makes them very happy since they will have more income for their home and their three children, offering them better conditions, schooling, and a dignified life.  They plan to have a fish order in the thousands since they know that they have the capacity and the customers to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase fish to fill her customers' orders, also to purchase food for their feeding and healthy growth

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a 35-year-old woman who is married to Lambertus, a 37-year-old man. From their marriage, they have been blessed with a daughter, namely Anggriani, age 13, a second grade student of Junior High School. 

Mariana is a housewife while her husband is a fisherman. As a housewife, Mariana only focuses on taking care of her husband and daughter. Every day she wakes up early morning to do her daily activity as a housewife. Her husband goes to catch fish on the sea every day by using a small boat and trawl net. 

Because the boat has been used for years, her husband plans to replace the damaged wood on the boat body. By seeing the condition of boat, Mariana was thinking to get a loan. She then applied for an individual loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on piece of wood and to buy a new trawl net as well.

loans.use: to buy pieces of wood and a new trawl net as well.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos. María es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño lavable para el cual necesita materiales como: hierro, arena, cemento, grava, ladrillo, etc.
texts.en: María is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their four children. María is a very hard-working woman who works providing domestic service. With the desire to improve her living conditions, she decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in the construction of a washable bathroom for which she will need materials such as iron, sand, cement, stone, brick, etc.

loans.use: to purchase iron, sand, cement, stone, brick, etc. to build a washable bathroom.

loans.name: Celia Beatriz

texts.es:
Celia Beatriz tiene 47 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de bazar y belleza (cremas de belleza, cosméticos, aguas tonificantes), sus clientes en la mayoría son mujeres, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de productos de bisutería, así como insumos para confección de sus productos y stock de mercadería que le permita ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
47- year old Celia Beatriz lives in Zaña District, a farming, business, and cattle raising community located in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on Peru's north coast.

Celia Beatriz sells general merchandise and beauty products (lotions, cosmetics, skin toner). For the most part her customers are women. She is seeking a loan of 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy knick knacks as well as supplies to make certain merchandise. She also wants to stock her store with other items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: Buy knickknacks and expand her store

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 50 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, bread, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Nida has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, bread, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 42 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edith Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda es una chica muy alegre y perseverante, Fernanda se dedica desde hace 4 años a su negocio de venta de ropa, comenta que su esposo no le apoyava en la iniciativa de poner este negocio, pero Fernanda siguio adelante en emprendimiento, ella solicito el primer credito en Fodemi e inicio con su negocio en el que actualmente  le va muy bien y  su esposo ya le apoya, Fernanda tiene 25 años y tiene un hijo de 4 años que ya asiste a la escuela, Fernanda esta estudiando a distancia, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercaderia en ropa para excivirlo en su negocio en el que paga arriendo, Fernanda aspira veriar sus productos para que aumente su clientela y de estos ingersos cubrir los gastos que tiene en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a very happy and persistent girl.  She has made a living selling clothes for 4 years.  She says that her husband wouldn’t support her initiative to start this business, but Fernanda asked for her first loan from Fodemi and went ahead with the business venture.  It is going well for her and her husband now supports her.  

Fernanda is 25 and she has a 4-year-old son who is now going to school.  She is studying through a distance-learning program.  She will use the loan to buy clothing goods to display in her business that she leases.  Fernana aspires to diversify her products in order to increase her clientele and to be able to cover the cost of her education through this income.

loans.use: to buy clothing goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy specialized food for her chickens

loans.name: Illimani - 27 Group

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer de 35 años de edad soltera y madre de 2 hijos
Su vida la ocupa trabajando para mantener a sus hijos, los niños estudian en la escuela primaria y son buenos alumnos, se ocupan de jugar futbol todo su tiempo libre.
Norma incentiva a sus hijos y les da todos sus gustos, compra guantes, balones y camisetas estampadas con sus equipos favoritos; “ Mis hijos son buenos estudiantes muy responsables y muy buenos hijos, por eso me esfuerzo al máximo para que no les falte nada y algún día puedan cumplir sus sueños”, comenta Norma.
Norma trabaja vendiendo comida rápida como; hot dog, hamburguesa y pollo frito en la calle, tiene un carrito con una pequeña cocina instalada a gas de garrafa.
Durante el día se ocupa de preparar la comida para que este lista acabando la tarde antes de que baje el sol ella abre su puesto callejero para la atención al público y se queda en el lugar hasta acabar por completo toda la comida que preparó, luego debe limpiar toda su cocina y transportarla a un garaje de autos cercano donde lo guarda, su trabajo no descansa ningún día de la semana.
Ella piensa que es  momento de expandir su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida para el bienestar de sus hijos, su plan consiste en alquilar un ambiente para utilizarlo como restaurante de comida rápida.
Por ese motivo Norma solicita un préstamo para alquilar un ambiente y utilizarlo como restaurante de comida rápida.
texts.en:
Norma is a 35-year old woman, single, and the mother of two children. She spends her time raising her two children who attend primary school where they are good students. They play football in any spare moment they have. Norma encourages her children in this activity and buys whatever they need: gloves, balls, and shirts with the names of their favorite teams. "My children are good students, and responsible too. For that reason I work hard so they lack for nothing and one day will fulfill their dreams," she says.

Norma sells fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, and fried chicken in the streets. She has a small cart with a propane gas stove. During the day she is busy preparing the food so that it is ready for the evening. Before the sun goes down she opens up her business so her customers know that she is about to start selling her wares. She remains there until she has sold all the food she prepared. Then she has to clean the stove and take it to a nearby garage for safe storage. She works every day of the week.

Norma thinks the time is ripe to expand her business and improve the quality of life of her children. Her plan is to rent a space for a fast food restaurant. This is why she is seeking a loan.

loans.use: Rent a space to use as a fast food restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets, cement, and sand

loans.name: Kely Daniela

texts.es: La señora kely de 19 años de edad, no tiene hijos que dependan de sus ingresos, vive en la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en un barrio rural, con un grado de instrucción que alcanzó un nivel primario, no termino el colegio por falta de recursos económicos, es muy responsable a nivel laboral. Recientemente ingreso a trabajar a una empresa de servicio de limpieza, donde le pagan muy poco para subsistir en el mes, por esa razón continua en la actividad del servicio de gastronomía por las noches, con una experiencia de 2 años, ella elabora  hamburguesas, refrescos, salchipapa, trancapecho, pollo frito, personalmente se encarga de comercializar sus productos, el presente crédito que solicita es para comprar mesas, sillas, y hacer un mantenimiento a su carrito hamburguesero, para así poder vender más y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Kely is 19 years old and has no children who are dependent on her income. She lives in a rural neighborhood in the western section of the city of Cochabamba. Kely was able to complete her primary level education, but she was not able to go on to high school because of a lack of financial resources. However, she is very responsible in her work.

She recently started working for a company that provides cleaning services, but her very low pay is not enough to live on for a month. For this reason, she continues to provide food service at night and has two years of experience. She prepares hamburgers, soft drinks, sausages and potatoes, steak sandwiches, and fried chicken. Kely is personally responsible for buying her products.

The current loan she is requesting will be used to buy tables and chairs, as well as pay for maintenance to her hamburger cart. This will enable her to sell more and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs, as well as pay for maintenance to her hamburger cart.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, sin carga familiar, vive en casa propia en El Caserío San Jacinto, una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, comida y crianza de animales menores, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz, cerveza y otros alimentos destinados para llevar a cabo su negocio y atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 53 years old and single with no dependents.  She lives in her own house in El Caserío San Jacinto, a rural zone of the district of La Matanza, located in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.  The population there makes a living in agriculture, trade, and ranching.

She makes a living selling traditional corn liquor and food and raising small animals.  She has been doing this for 3 years, and she has a considerable number of clients.  She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,5000 Peruvian soles to buy corn, beer, and other food to carry out her business and serve her clients.

loans.use: to buy corn and beer to supply her business

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, hija  y su suegro. Ella trabaja como ordenanza desde hace tres años y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Genoveva solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared en la cocina para lo cual comprará cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro.
texts.en: Genoveva is 58 and she lives in her own house together with her life partner, daughter, and father-in-law.  She has worked as an administrative assistant for 3 years, and that is how she makes a living and sustains her household.  Genoveva is asking for this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron for the construction of a kitchen wall.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron for the construction of a kitchen wall

loans.name: Heric Hernany

texts.es:
Heric, ha prosperado con su negocio por la buena inversión de los créditos anteriores, se ha mantenido elaborando la venta de tamales, atoles y elotes, sus ganancias son utilizadas para pagar su crédito y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
Nuevamente solicita un préstamo para adquirir la materia prima con la que continuara funcionando su negocio y generándole ingresos, comprara elotes, manteca, aceite, leña y gas propano, su productividad aumentara y mantendrá satisfechos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Heric has prospered in his business as a result of good investments with his previous loans. He continues to prepare and sell tamales, “atole” (a traditional beverage), and corn on the cob. His earnings are used to repay his loan and to improve his family’s circumstances.

He is requesting a new loan so that he can acquire supplies that help his business continue to function and generate income. Heric will buy corn on the cob, lard, oil, firewood, and propane gas. His productivity will increase and he will be able to keep his customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy corn on the cob, lard, oil, firewood, and propane gas.

loans.name: Fredesbindo

texts.es:
Fredesbindo tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y servicios recreativos, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, cuyes, siembra de caña y alfalfa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fredesbindo is 56 years old; he lives with his wife and daughter in the District of Zaña, a community dedicated to agriculture, trade, and livestock. The community is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, in the north coast of Peru. 

He makes a living a selling prepared meals and recreational services. Additionally, he also raises dairy cattle, guinea pigs, plants sugar cane and alfalfa. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 PEN to purchase a variety of inputs for the preparation of the meals that he offers to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of inputs to prepare meals

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor pedro vive con sus dos hijos pequeños, su concubina lo abandono hace  3 años atrás, desde entonces vive como padre soltero cuidando a sus pequeños, es una persona muy responsable que quiere mucho a sus hijos,  trabaja en su terreno propio donde cultiva yuca, naranja y otros estacionales ya que su terreno se encuentra en una zona apta para la producción, su larga experiencia en el manejo de los cultivos agrícolas le permite conocer los riesgos a los que se somete y realizar un buen manejo para así obtener productos de excelente calidad que generen buenos ingresos, ahora solicita un crédito para compra de insumos y material para la implementación del cultivo de palmito que es apto para esa zona, ello incrementara considerablemente sus ingresos lo que le permitirá  mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus pequeños hijos
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro lives with his two young children. His partner abandoned them three years ago. Since then, he has lived as a single father who must care for his little ones. Pedro is a very responsible person who loves his children dearly. He works on his own land where he cultivates cassava, oranges, and other seasonal crops. His land is located in an area that is suitable for production.

Due to his extensive experience in handling farm crops, Pedro knows the risks that are involved and how to manage them well so that he can obtain excellent quality products that generate a good income. He is now requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies and materials for cultivating young palm trees (for harvesting hearts of palm) that are suitable for this area. This will increase his income considerably so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his young children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for cultivating young palm trees.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is married with 2 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Pagadian. Josie is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to buy 4 sacks of fertilizers. Josie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Josie hopes to become a vegetable supplier in their barangay.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 39 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Juditha has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa works hard to support her family. Josefa is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

Josefa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Josefa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Anunsacion

texts.en:
Anunsacion is 64 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Anunsacion works very hard to provide for them.

Anunsacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

Anunsacion has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Anunsacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Dyline

texts.en:
Dyline is 33 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Dyline has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica is 26 years old and married with four children who are in school. Erica works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc.

Erica has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Erica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, egg, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 39 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc. 

Ailyn has been in this business for 6 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 26 years old.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like net and other fishing materials.

Analiza has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señorita Mariana, tiene 47 años de edad, está  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan para salir adelante.
Doña Mariana  instala un pequeño local en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad, allí vende ceviches de pescado.  También a vende ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ya son muchos años que tiene estos negocios con los cuales le permite salir adelante.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque sus ganancias le sirvieron para cubrir ciertos gastos que tuvo ya que su papá enfermo y gracias a lo que su negocio le da pudo llevarlo al médico y comprar medicinas. Este crédito es para comprar pescado, sodas y otros víveres que ella necesita para preparar los ceviches. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the canton “24 de Mayo” meets the loan group “Nuevos Horizontes de 24 de Mayo” (New Horizons of May 24th). This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hardworking people who engage in agriculture and raising animals. 

Here lives Mrs. Mariana, who is 47 years old, single, and lives in her parents' house. She has been with the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because the loans have helped her move forward. 

Doña Mariana has a small store on a busy city street where she sells "ceviche" (fish dish). She also sells clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). It has been some years since she has had these businesses, which have allowed her to get ahead.

She is repeating the loan because her profits helped her cover certain expenses that she had to make because her dad got sick, and thanks to her business she was able to take him to the doctor and purchase medicines. 

This loan is to purchase fish, sodas, and other groceries that she needs to make the ceviche. Her dream is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy fish, fizzy drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for the tuition of her son Reynold. Reynold is studying at Isabela State University, taking up a BS in Education. Their source of income is farming and hog raising. His parents’ income is usually spent for their daily expenditures and feeding the hogs. They are struggling financially and that’s why he is studying hard so that after he graduates, he can help his parents.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her son

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita works hard to support her family. Cristita has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

Cristita has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old and is married. She has three children, one of whom is in school. Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Gina requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 48 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Irma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 
She has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. Irma has been running her general store for six years and also earns an income from boarding house rentals. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer

loans.name: Monserrate Guadalupe

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 22, 19, 16 y 12 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es panadero.
Doña Monserrate y su familia tienen una panadería donde preparan y venden pan de varias clases también venden víveres, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que ellos en la noche preparan la masa del pan que al otro día hornean. Tienen más de 20 años su negocio y siempre les a ido bien.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que así es como ella sale adelante, siempre sus ganancias le sirven para darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Este crédito es para comprar harina, huevos y varios ingredientes  para preparar el pan así como víveres para la venta. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez mejora más su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes De 24 De Mayo credit group meets in the canton of 24 De Mayo.  It is known for its beautiful landscapes and hardworking people who make a living farming and raising animals.  Monserrate lives here. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children (ages 22,19,16, and 12) from this relationship. The two youngest are students in school. Her husband is a baker. 

Monserrate and her family have a bakery where they bake and sell different types of bread and sell food supplies. They work every day from 5:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes later since they prepare the dough at night to be baked the next day. They have more than 20 years of experience in this line of work which has helped them to be successful. 

She is asking for another loan since that is how she can move forwards, and her profits always go to giving a good education to her children.  This loan will go to buying flour, eggs, and other ingredients to make bread, as well as food supplies to sell. Monserrate has been in the Credit Group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans help her business every time. Her goals are to continue forward with her business and for it to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, food supplies, and other ingredients

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Purificacion has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own printing business for more than twenty years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her needs, especially for her child. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her child with better education. 

To improve service and profit, Purificacion would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional supplies and printing materials. With a PHP 10,000 loan, she could purchase more items like like paper, ink, and other stuff that are needed in manufacturing different printed materials. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Purificacion hopes to be able to save for family and dreams of expanding her printing business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials like paper, ink, and other supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Llane

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Llane works hard to support her family. She has a hardware business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

Llane is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock for her hardware store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. Llane hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her hardware store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Delia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell, such as chips, eggs, noodles, soap, soft drinks, etc.

Delia has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, such as chips, eggs, noodles, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 44 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erna is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Erna has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilvet

texts.en:
Vilvet is 43 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Vilvet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. Vilvet has been running her general store for three years and she also earns additional income from selling rice. She aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is applying for a second loan to support his studies through graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“So far I have progressed very well in my studies. Kiva has given me the opportunity to stay in school and also assisted me with my daily traveling expenses. I’m looking forward to graduating and becoming a better person in future.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is from Calauagan, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is married with five children. To supplement the earnings of her husband, who is a farmer, Lucita decided to engage in a hog-raising business. She usually earns PHP 2,000 for every hog she raises. However, with those earnings, she can’t pay the tuition fees for her child. Her son Christopher is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science degree in criminology at Isabela State University. Lucita is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders through ASKI. This loan will be of great assistance because it will have a great impact on her child’s future.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она ответственная мать 4 детей. Заррина и ее муж стараются обеспечить своих детей со всеми необходимыми средствами. Ее муж мясник. Заррина более 3 лет занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Она шьет как женскую одежду, так и мужскую одежду. Она шьет аккуратно и старается предоставлять свои услуги на высшем уровне. Заррина хочет развевать бизнес и таким образом получить больше дохода, так как для обеспечения 4 детей требуется достаточно средства. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2600 сомони для покупки ткани для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarrina is a conscientious and hardworking woman and a responsible mother of four children. She and her husband try to provide their children with everything that they need. Her husband is a butcher and Zarrina has been working as a seamstress for more than three years, sewing both women's and men's clothing. She sews well and offers her services at the highest level. Zarrina wants to develop her business and increase her revenue, since caring for four children is expensive. She is asking for a loan of 2,600 somoni to buy fabric to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabric to increase her working capital

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es una persona trabajadora que está ofreciendo sus servicios de auxiliar auditoria en un supermercado.
Con el sueldo que gana puede pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y también puede ayudar a su familia. Ella está esforzándose por ser una profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de la universidad, como materiales y fotocopias. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en: Rebeca is a hard-working person who works as an auditing assistant in a supermarket. With her salary, she pays university tuition and also helps her family. She is striving to be a professional so she can help other people. She is asking for this loan in order to cover university costs such as materials and photocopies. She is very thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: Cover university expenses such as materials and photocopies.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosita works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell charcoal business.  

Rosita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, canned goods, etc for her restaurant business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann has been in this business for one year now.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of used clothes to sell.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maria works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Maria is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and married with nine children.  With four children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell, such as chips, eggs, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell, such as chips, eggs, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 52 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

Myrna has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell charcoal business.  

Vilma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Dineo

texts.en:
Dineo is applying for a second loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“My studies have progressed well as I am able to come to school with no problems due to not having to worry about transport money. I can fully concentrate on my studies now. Kiva is the best thing that ever happened to me, as without it I would have been kicked out of school, as I couldn’t afford to pay school fees.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“Ever since I received the loan from Kiva, it has made a huge difference towards my studies. I have been able to buy a train tag, which enables me to get to school on time every day. I am studying hard and doing well on my studies.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Kagiso

texts.en:
Kagiso is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“My studies have been progressing very well since I had the opportunity to earn the KIVA loan, as it’s been helping me with transport costs and also my studies. It is now easier for me to focus and my marks have improved.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Lethiwe

texts.en:
Lethiwe is applying for a second loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“Since my first loan I can see that I am getting closer to achieving my goals, because Kiva helps me a lot. I wish that Kiva will continue to help me to pay for my fees so that I will be able to reach my goals.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 41 years old and a resident of SWP Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two kids, one of which is in college. She owns a "sari-sari store" (small grocery store) that forms part of their house, and her neighbors are their clients. 

Since she has a college student to support, she has decided to improve their small business to support their children. So she has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of milk, sugar, coffee and canned goods to sell. Aside from the financial assistance, she also received add-on benefits like insurance, savings, etc. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of milk, sugar, coffee, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Karla Yolanda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo aquí se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Karla, tiene 34 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 4 años que estudian en escuela.
Doña Karla es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y base de  su esfuerzo, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en un local que arrienda en el centro de la ciudad, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y ciertas bebidas, le encanta su negocio ya que  gana lo suficiente para el sustento diario de ella y sus pequeños y también está al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos, lleva más de 13 años con su tienda con la cual sale adelante sola.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Esta desde el inicio  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos para mejorar su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños son tener un local propio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes de 24 de Mayo credit group meets in the canton of 24 de Mayo.  This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and hardworking people who make a living farming and raising animals.  

Karla lives here.  She is 34 and separated, and from that relationship she has two 7 and 4-year-old children who are in school.  Karla is a woman who likes to get ahead through her efforts.  She has a grocery store on a site that she leases in the city center where she sells many kinds of basic necessities as well as certain drinks.  She likes her business since she makes enough money to provide daily sustenance to herself and her little ones, and she can also keep up with the needs of her children.  She has had her store for 13 years and it allows her to move forwards on her own.

This loan is for buying food supplies to stock her store.  She has been in this credit group since the beginning and she likes it since the loans that she recieves help her to improve her business and her life.  Her dream is to own her own  business site and give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Menchie has been in this business for five years; she earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mary Alice

texts.en:
Mary Alice is 42 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mary Alice has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from jeep transport and a boarding house.

Mary Alice aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beverly is 32 years old, and has one child who is in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Beverly requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Beverly has been in this business for three years. In the future, Beverly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 42 years old and married with seven children. She has been running a general store for two years, and also earns an income from food vending. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs the general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Leny has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Idilio

texts.es:
Idilio es un joven que quiere emprender en la vida, con una aspiración de ser excelente profesional con la máxima capacidad. Es independiente, y comenta que desea culminar sus estudios y así poder después ejercer con la máxima profesionalidad todo lo que aprendió.
El está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en: Idilio is a youth who wants to set off in life. He hopes to become a professional of great ability. He is independent and comments that he'd like to finish his studies and then put into practice all that he has learned with the up-most professionalism.  He is studying Business Administration and is requesting this loan to invest in paying his university tuition.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma vive con sus padres en Chaco, trabaja como auxiliar administrativo desde hace un año, y también está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad.
Ella es una persona que se está esforzando mucho por salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su esfuerzo. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma seguir luchando por cumplir su meta.
texts.en: Norma lives with her parents in Chaco. She has been working as an administration assistant for the past year. She is also studying Accounting. She is a person who has put in a lot of effort to get ahead and to help her loved ones through her labor. She is requesting this loan to invest in paying her university tuition so that she can continue to strive for her goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció pero de esa relación tienen seis hijos mayores e independientes.
Doña Mariana es una mujer muy luchadora que trabaja muy duro para salir adelante sola, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas, jugos y bolos, los fines de semana instala un pequeño local en las afueras de su casa para vender estas ricas empanadas que son el deleite de sus clientes.  También tiene un pequeño galpón en el cual cría pollos, esto le dejan muy buenas ganancias que las utiliza para su sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar las empanadas así como frutas, sodas  y alimento para los pollos. Esta desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es tener buena salud.
texts.en: In the county 24 De Mayo, the community bank Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo meets. This area is known for its beautiful landscape and it hardworking people who work in agricultural and animal husbandry. Mariana lives in this place. She is 62 years old. Several years ago, her beloved husband died. From this relationship, she has six grown children who are independent. Mariana is a hard-working woman who works very hard to get ahead on her own. She sells empanadas, juice, and plantain snacks. On the weekend, she she sets up a small stand outside her house to sell delicious empanadas that delight her clients. She also has a small chicken coop in which she raises chickens, which enable her to earn enough money to sustain herself. This loan is to buy ingredients for empanadas such as fruit, soda, and food for the chickens. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans her a lot. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fruits, sodas, and food for her chickens.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family; she is married, and has a buy and sell fruit business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of bananas to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutchel is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. 

Rutchel is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy more recycled materials to sell for her recycled materials business.

Rutchel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Elecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elecia works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Elecia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her cafeteria business.

Elecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Niza is 47 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like cream, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

Niza has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like cream, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Rosalie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Rosalie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 35 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ruby has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 10 years, and also earns an income from buy and sell bamboo.

Ruby aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is applying for a second loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“The loan has been very helpful with my expenses, which is good as I’ve been able to come to school on time, and get good attendance. I now get all my school materials on time, making studying easier and I’m getting good grades.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
A Daisy desde pequeña sus padres le inculcaron el estudio de tal manera que hasta ahora continua estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo para poder cubrir sus gastos universitarios y también ayudar a sus padres en lo que le pueda. 
Sus objetivos principales son recibir el titulo de contadora y luego como auditora forense.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación y manutención, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Since she was a child, Daisy’s parents have instilled in her the importance of study so that even now she continues studying and working at the same time to meet college expenses and also help her parents with what she can.  Her main goals are to earn her degree in accounting, then forensic auditing.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her degree as well as room and board, in order to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her degree as well as room and board.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Donalyn is a 2nd year BS Political Science student in Isabela State University. Her mother, Marites, is a fish and vegetable vendor while her father is an automotive repair personnel. She has nine siblings and that’s why their family’s income is sometimes not enough for all of them. For that reason, her mother Marites is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from KIVA lenders through ASKI to pay for her tuition fees. Donalyn is hopeful that the lenders will approve her mother’s requested loan for it will definitely pave the way for her to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee of Donalyn.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.es:
El Sr. Emanuel trabaja en un taller de costura, y gracias a su trabajo puede estudiar la carrera de Informática y hoy ya está cursando el segundo año.
Emanuel es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser un buen profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide esta ayuda para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y así poder cubrir el gasto que tiene, está muy agradecido por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Emanuel works at a sewing workshop. Thanks to his job, he is able to study Information technology, and he is now on his second year of studies.

Emanuel is a very responsible person. He is dedicated to his studies and to his family. He wants to become a great professional, keep studying and serve people.

He is requesting this help to pay for college fees, and in this way, cover his expenses. He is really thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Ketty María

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ketty, tiene 47 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 25, 20 y 19 años, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Ketty es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante a base de su esfuerzo para darles lo mejor a su familia, ella tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad en el cual vende todo tipo de lubricantes para carros, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 hora en el cual cierra su negocio para ir a descansar, su negocio es muy concurrido pues está ubicado muy cerca de un taller de mecánica razón por lo cual todos los días sus ventas son muy buenas, ya son dos años que lleva con este negocio con el cual ella sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar aceites y lubricantes. Lleva 4 años  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son mejorar más su negocio.
texts.en:
En the county "24 De Mayo,"  the community bank "Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo" meets.  This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry. 

Ketty lives in this place. She is 47 years old. She is divorced, but she has three children who are 25, 20, and 19 years old from this relationship. Two of them live in her house. Ketty is a woman who would like to get ahead so she can better provide for her family. She has a store in the center of the city in which she sells all types of automobile lubricants. She works every day from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at which times she closes her business in order to relax. Her business is very busy since it is located near a mechanic's workshop, which is why her sales are very good. She has had the business for two years, which is how she gets ahead. 

Her loan is to buy oils and lubricants. She has been in the community bank for four years and she likes it because the loans enable her to support her business. Her dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy oil and lubricants

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, milk, etc.

Nelia has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Edilma Ernestina

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Edilma, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 10 hijos, 8 mayores y dos de 16 y 15  años de edad, uno de ellos estudia  en colegio. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Edilma es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en casa donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también colas y helados, a ella le gusta tener su tienda bien surtida y brindarles la mejor atención a sus clientes que siempre le compran ya que allí ellos encuentran todo lo que necesitan, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  Tiene más de 3 años  su tienda y le encanta porque allí se distrae y se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son aumentar su tienda.
texts.en:
En the county "24 De Mayo,"  the community bank "Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo" meets.  This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry. 

Edilma lives in this place. She is 49 years old and has a long-time relationship from which she has 10 children, 8 of whom are adults and 2 who are 16 and 15 years old. One of them is in high school. Her husband is a mason. Edilma is a woman who likes to work and helps her husband and family get ahead through her efforts. She has a grocery store in her homes where she sells all types of basic goods as well as soda and ice cream. She likes to maintain a well-stocked store and attend to her clients who always buy from her since they can find all that they need there. She works every day from 6:00 AM-8:00 PM and sometimes even later. She has had the store for more than 3 years and she loves it because it distracts her and she earns a living from it. 

This loan is to stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, and other basic goods. She has been in the community bank for two years and she likes the support she gets from it. Her dream is to expand her store. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son aumentar su tienda.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Organizadas están en el 8vo. Ciclo con 16 integrantes, todas son mujeres que están luchando por poder salir adelante y dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudieron tener. Las integrantes formaron un grupo bastante unido, con la plena convicción de trabajar todas juntas, apoyándose.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria, quien se dedica a la cría de animales, es una señora muy creativa y con ganas de superarse desde su propia casa y con la ayuda de sus hijos va afianzándose en su emprendimiento.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de más animales de corral para la cría y venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The group is called "Mujeres Organizadas". They are in the 8th loan cycle, with 16 members, all of them women who are striving to move forward and to offer their loved ones everything they could not have. The members formed a very tight-knit group with the deep conviction of working all together, supporting each other. One of the members is Maria, who works raising animals. She is a very creative lady, with desire to advance from her own house, and with the help from her children she is strengthening her enterprise. She is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing more farmyard animals for sale, and in this way to keep working on her business venture as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: To buy farmyard animals for raising and selling.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 51 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Thelma has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and a general store.

Thelma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rafael
