texts.es: Rafael de 34 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de confitería, tienda a tienda; bombones, galletas y dulces en general reparte, hace 13 años diariamente, trabajando desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, incluyendo muchas veces días hábiles y festivos.  Su meta es ampliar su cobertura espacial y contratar vendedores, pero su infraestructura no es suficiente, para almacenar los artículos. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará dulcería en general en un mayor volumen, para ampliar un poco su capacidad de ingresos y poco a poco superar los desafíos de la infraestructura limitada  con la que cuenta.
texts.en: Rafael is 34 years old and he works selling sweets form store to store. He has been distributing chocolate, biscuits and sweets in general every day for 13 years. He works from 6 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon, many times including  business days and holidays. His goal is to expand his market area and contract sellers but his infrastructure is not sufficient to store the goods. Currently he is requesting a loan from Kiva with which he will buy sweets in general in greater volume to expand his capacity to generate revenue and little by little overcome the challenges he has with his limited infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy sweets in general in greater volume.

loans.name: Ezzel

texts.en: Ezzel is 19 years old and is currently studying at Kings College of the Philippines, taking up a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. She is now in her third year and she wants to continue and finish her studies so that she will be able to find a good job someday. Due to the high cost of school fees, her parents could not afford to finance all of her schooling. Therefore, Ezzel needs to access financial assistance from KIVA through ASKI in the amount of PHP 20,000.00 to pay for her tuition fees and miscellaneous fees in school. She is hoping that she will avail her loan request to be able to continue her studies and help her parents in their financial needs. Through patience and strong determination, she believes that someday she will achieve her goals and become financially stable.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees and miscellaneous fees in school.

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Sur, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and buying and selling charcoal. Lilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Raquela

texts.en:
Raquela is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Raquela is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Raquela has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Raquela requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Raquela has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Raquela would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Tshepo

texts.en:
Tshepo is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“Since my first loan, I am less stressed about how I am going to get to school, via public transport. I am thankful for the opportunity and hope that it can continue so that I can complete school and be on time for my studies.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte actuellement des femmes qui en plus de vivre ensemble dans le même village, gagnent en expérience dans leur activité respective car comprenant de mieux en mieux le programme cela favorisé par le fait que le village habite un grand « Louma » marché hebdomadaire. La solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont un  garçon et deux filles âgés de 10 à 15 ans. C’est une dame très dynamique, elle est vendeuse de beignets et boulettes à base de poissons qu’elle prépare à la maison pour la vente au marché. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans et a une bonne maîtrise de sa clientèle.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter de la farine pour 25 Kg, de l’huile pour un bidon de 10 litre, du sucre et divers ingrédients pour la préparation de beignets et boulettes pour la vente.

 Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer très activement à la gestion des charges familiales (scolarité des enfants, habillement et santé), d’une part et d’autre part accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was created on May 16, 2011 at the launch of the local banc villageois. It is composed of women who, in addition to living in the same village, keep gaining more experience in their respective businesses thanks to a better understanding of the loan program, which is made known thanks to the fact that the village hosts a weekly "Loma" market.  The relations among group members are marked by solidarity and mutual help. The group members mainly work as vendors.

Mrs. Mariama (the one seated on the far right raising her left hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of three children ranging from ten to 15 years of age: one boy and two girls. She is a very energetic woman selling fritters and fishcakes she cooks at home for resale at the market. She has been in this business over five years and knows her customer base well.
With this new loan, she plans to buy 25 kg [55 lbs] of flour, a 10-liter [2.6 gal] jug of vegetable oil, sugar and various ingredients needed to cook fritters and fishcakes for resale. Thanks to her revenues, she plans to take an active part in providing for household needs (the children's school fees, clothing and healthcare) and use the rest to grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy 25 kg [55 lbs] of flour, a 10-liter [2.6 gal] jug of vegetable oil, sugar and various ingredients for cooking fritters and fishcakes for sale.

loans.name: Adam

texts.es:
El Sr. Adan trabaja en un taller de costura, a la vez está estudiando la carrera de Marketing que cursa el 2 año.
Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, quiere ser un profesional útil a la sociedad y a sí mismo.
Adan está pidiendo este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le serpa de mucha ayuda para poder cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Adan works at a sewing workshop. At the same time, he studies marketing. He is now in his second year of studies. 

He is a very responsible person, who is dedicated to his studies and to his family. He wishes to become a professional able to help the society and himself. 

Adan is requesting this loan to pay for the college fees. This will be of great help to accomplish his goal.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty está en el ciclo número 8 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien es una persona muy luchadora, y emprendedora, que se dedica a la venta de leche y de queso, es por medio de este humilde trabajo que ella se está esforzando por poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones. 
También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes siempre las están capacitando.
La Sra. Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche y queso, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The group  Kuna Aty is in cycle number 8 of the Committee of Women Businessowners program where they all work and help one another to get ahead. One of the members is Maria, who is a strong and enterprising person who works selling milk and cheese.  It is through this humble work that she is struggling to give her family a dignified life without hardships. 

She also credits the work of her advisers who are always training them. Maria is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of milk and cheese and with this she will be able to continue making sales, fighting for a better future.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese to sell.

loans.name: Minbaroy

texts.ru: Минбарой женщина с прекрасной душой. Она родилась в 1967 году. Минбарой замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Минбарой занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур уже более 4 лет. Ее сын помогает ей введению бизнеса. Они выращивают хлопок и пшеницу на 4 га земли. Она имеет своих постоянных покупателей. Минбарой данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она серьёзно больна и должна купить лекарства. Минбарой запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Minbaroy is a beautiful soul. She was born in 1967. She is married and   the mother of two. Her children are already adults. For four years, Minbaroy has been growing farm produce. Her son helps her in her business. They grow cotton and wheat on four ha [10 acres] of land. She has her regular customers. 
At present Minbaroy needs financial support since she is ill and needs to buy medicine. Minbaroy is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,000 TJS to buy medicine. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Lucy Meychin

texts.es: LUCY: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 26 años de edad, soltera. Con el objetivo de mejorar la vivienda de su mamá, solicita financiamiento para cambiar madera y comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construirle a la casa de su mamá de concreto y apoyarle en los gastos médicos y que mejore de salud.
texts.en:
Lucy: she is from Puerto Cabezas, is 26 years old and single. With the objective of improving her mom’s house, she is requesting this loan to change the wood and buy construction materials: wood, nails, and pay for the labor.

Her dream is to build a concrete house for her mom, and support her with her medical expenses to improve her health.

loans.use: to change the wood of her stilt house.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kuña Kyrey está en su ciclo 7, donde forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Miguela, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que está mejorando poco a poco a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo. Miguela se dedica a la venta ambulante de chipas, que es un alimento típico paraguayo, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group called Kuna Kyrey is in its seventh cycle. The program focuses on eliminating poverty while attempting to learn the situation of each one of the women. One of the members is Miguela, who in her last  survey reported a poverty level within the third level, but is improving little by little thanks to her effort and continuous work. 

Miguela works as a traveling chipas saleswoman. Chipas are a typical Paraguyan food. Through this work she helps her family and her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of chipas and in this way she will be able to continue her sales, fighting to help her family.

loans.use: to buy chipas [cheese bread] to sell.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Ana, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación como un medio de poder conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuentra y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Angela tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por su familia y sus seres queridos, está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida e ir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, enlatados, lácteos, panificados y demás productos, para que así pueda seguir luchando por mejorar.
Angela quiere capacitarse y seguir creciendo, es por ello que siempre trabaja de una manera entusiasta y sin cansancio.
texts.en:
This group is named Santa Ana. They are going through a weeding-out process as a way of being able to know each person's situation and getting her to be able to work.

Angela has a well stocked store that she works in every day, from the early hours. She is a sacrificing woman who fights for her family and her loved ones. She is fighting to improve her living conditions and go on growing.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various products for her store, such as vegetables, fruits, canned foods, dairy products, breads, and other items, so that she can continue fighting to improve.

Angela wants to train herself and continue growing. This is why she always works enthusiastically and without tiring.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, canned foods, dairy products, breads, and other items to stock the shelves.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Virgen de las Mercedes es un grupo muy unido, que gracias al trabajo unido de todas, y por medio de las capacitaciones están pudiendo salir adelante y mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Una personas que se destaca por ser entusiasta, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora es la señora Daisy, quien es vendedora de ropas, comenta que aunque tenga mucha competencia se está esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante, ya que por medio de sus ventas es que ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por poder mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Virgen de las Mercedes is a very unified group, which, thanks to the joint work of all the members and as a result of the training, is able to get ahead and improve their poverty situation.

One person who is characterized as being enthusiastic, hardworking, and, above all, a fighter, is Daisy. She is a clothing vendor. She says that although she is very competent, she is pushing herself to be able to grow and get ahead because it is through her sales that she helps her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pants, etc., in order to continue with her sales, fighting to be able to improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Caacupe; está en su ciclo número 3  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dominga, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la Venta de Comidas en su domicilio también venta de bebidas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de las comidas, como carne, pan para hamburguesas, bebidas en general, entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Virgen de Caacupe is in its third cycle of the women's committee program. In this program, everyone works and helps each other get ahead.

One of the members is Dominga, who has been improving her situation through her effort, continued work, and the application of the key behaviors of a successful woman. The work she does is selling meals from her home as well as selling beverages. She is also responsible for carrying out the work of the consultants who are continuously monitoring training.

The lady is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for making meals such as meat, hamburger buns, drinks in general, and other items. This will help her carry out her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase meat, hamburger buns, drinks in general, and other items.

loans.name: Yataity Del Norte Group

texts.es:
El comité Yataity del Norte se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, donde todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, y que les permitirá poder ayudar a sus familias.
Alfreda es integrante de este grupo, es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora, que trabaja por su familia y por sus seres queridos. Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, que con mucho sacrificio viene haciendo desde hace ya un buen tiempo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, ya que por medio de ello podrá seguir con la cría de sus animales, y de esa forma poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Yataity del Norte group is comprised of several neighbors in the city of Santani, where all the group members carry out their own independent activities. This allows them to be able to help their families.

Alfreda is a member of this group. She is a very enterprising and fighting woman who works for her family and for her loved ones. She raises and sells barn animals. With great sacrifice, she has been doing this for a good while.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase balanced nutrition for her animals. With this, she will be able to continue raising her animals, and in this way, be able to go on improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase balanced nutrition for animals.

loans.name: Tiego

texts.en:
Tiego is applying for a second loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“The first loan has helped me a lot because I am able to come to school every day due to having money for transport. Now my studies are up-to-date, unlike before when I didn’t have money to get to school and I had to miss classes.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres trabajadoras se llama este grupo, que tiene 17 integrantes cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Marina es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que a través de su esfuerzo ha salido adelante, ella se dedica a la manicura, y también al pedicuro, además de eso comenta que también vende bebidas varias, y por medio de esto ayuda a su familia, teniendo los ingresos que necesitan para el día a día sin privaciones.
Marina pide este préstamo ya que necesita comprar nuevos insumos para el servicio que da, como ser esmaltes, alicates, acetonas, cortaúñas y demás, ya que así podrá seguir trabajando, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mujeres Trabajadoras (Hardworking Women) is the name of this group that has 17 members. Each member puts forth her best effort to be able to get ahead and give her family all they need for a life lacking nothing.

Marina is a very hardworking and fighting woman. Thanks to her effort, she has gotten ahead. She does manicures and pedicures. She says that she also sells a variety of beverages. With this, she is helping her family by having the income they need for the day-to-day without any deficits.

Marina is requesting this loan because she needs to buy new supplies for the service she provides, such as nail polishes, tweezers, acetone, nail clippers, etc. This way, she will be able to continue working and fighting to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase nail polishes, tweezers, acetone, nail clippers, etc.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino de 37 años de edad, es agricultor, debido a los escasos recursos económicos en que ha vivido le fué imposible terminar sus estudios, con mucho sacrificio a penas pudo cursar cuarto grado, está casado y su esposa es quien le ayuda arduamente para sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos, ellos están estudiando en la escuela actualmente.

Sabino aprendió la agricultura a la edad de 13 años, este trabajo se lo enseño su padre para que se defendiera en la vida y fuese su fuente de ingreso, es muy emprendedor y entusiasta, se levanta muy temprano para ir al campo a trabajar, actualmente tiene sembrado milpa y espera tener buenos resultados.

Utilizará el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, sulfato, abono, entre otros  para fortalecer su cultivo.

El sueño a un futuro es ampliar  su negocio para tener mas ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sabino, 37, is a farmer.  He didn't have the economic resources to finish school.  With a lot of sacrifice, he was barely able to finish fourth grade.  He's married and his wife helps him arduously to get their four children ahead.  Their children are currently in school.

Sabino learned agriculture at the age of 13.  His father taught him this work so he could hold his own in life, and it was his source of income.  He's very enterprising and enthusiastic.  He gets up very early to go to the field to work.  Currently he has a cornfield planted and he hopes to have good results.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, sulfate, soil amendments, and other things to strengthen his crop.

His dream for the future is to expand his business so he earns more profit and to improve his quality of life and his family's.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda, age 44, is from Northern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and raising four children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously.

Hilda is now trying to expand her pig business. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase animal feed and additional piglets. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. She wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 44 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with three children.

To earn a living, Emelda sells fruits and vegetables. She earns about PHP 12,000 a month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to stock her fruit stand. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she would like to have her own fruit store in town.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 27 años de edad es agricultor, estudio hasta bachillerato,  debido a los bajos recursos económicos le fue imposible estudiar una carrera universitaria, ahora está casado y tiene un bebé de 3 meses, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también le ayuda con la agricultura.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde los 14 años, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo para que se defendiera en la vida, a él se le hace difícil conseguir otro trabajo debido al nivel académico que tiene y es por eso que la agricultura es su fuente de ingreso,  su esposa es quien le ayuda mucho en este trabajo.

Él utilizara el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como: sulfato,  formula, abono,  veneno para la plaga, entre otros, que serán los que le ayudaran a obtener mejores resultados en la cosecha que ya tiene sembrada.

El sueño  de Juan es ayudarle a su hijo para que estudié una carrera universitaria y tenga mayores oportunidades de trabajo, asi mismo mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia ya que son de muy bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Juan is 27 years old and is a farmer. He studied through high school, and due to low financial resources it was impossible for him to study for a university degree. Now he is married and has a 3-month-old baby, and his wife is dedicated to the housework and also helps him with the farming. 

Juan has made a living in farming for 14 years. His parents taught him this work so he could provide for himself in life. It has always been hard for him to get another job because of the level of education he has, and that is why farming is his source of income. His wife is the one who helps him a lot in this work.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as sulfate, fertilizer, pesticides, and other things that will help him obtain greater results in the harvest of the crops he has already planted. Juan's dream is to help his son so that he can study for a university degree and have greater opportunities for work, and at the same time improve the quality of life for his family that has minimal financial resources.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as sulfate, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Tahet

texts.en: Tahet is a single man and has no children. He is living in the Baku region with his family; his parents and sister. Tahet is a car mechanic, so he rents an auto repair shop and there he services cars. He repairs them, changes tires, repairs the interior, paints cars, etc. He learned this profession from his uncle and he has already been in this business for a year. Today Tahet needs a loan in the amount of 700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy spare parts for cars, different colors of paint, etc. He says thanks to the Kiva organization for help. In the future Tahet wants to repair his shop to develop his business. In his personal life he wants to get married and have children.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts for cars, different colors of paint, etc.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 59 years old, married and a resident of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. His wife is a housewife who works with him at their sari-sari store. They are blessed with three children.

He was able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of his family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which he became a member of in April, 2008. He availed himself of four loans and paid them religiously. Now, he is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP to finance the additional stock. The loan is for him to purchase cases of soft drinks and bags of rice for his sari-sari store. He is looking forward to expanding his sari-sari into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks and bags of rice

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: In 2006, Virginia learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Virginia tried her luck on starting a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Virginia borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help boost her farming income. Virginia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc. for her store.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Wiseman

texts.en:
Wiseman is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“The first loan has really helped me as I have been able to attend school every day, with enough money to get there and buy lunch. I’m very thankful to Kiva for improving my life.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is applying for a second loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“My first loan has helped me so much, because since I took the first loan, my school fees have decreased and the stipend helps me with transport. This has meant that even when my mom was not able to help me with transport money, I have been able to attend school.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда с детства мечтала организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной бизнес-леди. Ей 21 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 1 не совершеннолетнего ребенка. Умеда после развода вернулась в родительский дом. Она теперь хочет организовать свой бизнес и таким образом обеспечить себя и своего ребенка. Умеда планирует организовать бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она будет торговать на местном рынке. Ее мать обещала ей помогать введению бизнеса. Умеда запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки детской одежды, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umeda has dreamed of starting her own business and becoming a successful entrepreneur since she was a child.  She is 21 years old, divorced, and is raising one child who has yet to come of age.  After her divorce, Umeda moved back into her parents' home.  She is hoping to start her own business to be able to provide for herself and her child; namely, she plans on selling children's clothing at a local marketplace.  With this goal in mind, she enrolled in a course titled "Achieve Success" sponsored by an association for businesswomen and received a certificate upon completion.   Her mother has promised to help her get her business up and running; in addition, Umeda is seeking a loan of 6000 somoni to buy children's clothing for her store.  She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy children's clothes for starting a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with two children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Tukuran, Philippines. Delia is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

She has requested a loan to buy five bags of fertilizers. Delia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Delia hopes to become a vegetable supplier in her place.

loans.use: To buy five bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and married with four children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Thelma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arapathon

texts.ru: Арапатхон 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Арапатхон среднее образование, более 25 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, также дополнительно торгует женской одеждой на местном крупном рынке. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Арапатхон, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 1,70 ГА собственного земельного надела, на котором она ежегодно выращивает хлопок для реализации. Также есть 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Арапатхон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота с целью дальнейшего разведения и реализации. Арапатхон  намерена развить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в постройку дома для сына.
texts.en: Arapathon is 50, married, and has three children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and has farmed crops and livestock for more than 25 years.  She also sells children's clothing at a bustling marketplace nearby to earn some extra money on the side.  Thanks to her persistence and goal-oriented nature, Arapathon currently has six sheep, as well as a 1.70 hectare plot of land of her own where she grows and harvests cotton each year, and her monthly income is nearly 12,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Arapathon is seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai-Tushum & Partners to buy livestock for breeding and eventual resale.  She is intent on expanding her business as it will inevitably bolster her family's finances, and plans on using some of this additional money to help build a home for her son.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Pugu Group

texts.en:
Ummy is a businesswoman supporting her family by managing a shop selling cosmetics. She has been in this enterprise for six years now. Ummy is working hard and is responsible for her family's lives, and cosmetics is the only business she is looking to to raise the family income. She is in her 30s with three schooling kids. Ummy is not married. She is at her business from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good return per month. 

She is requesting a 14th loan via Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to improve her shop by purchasing the new cosmetics which previously she didn't have. She earned extra income, which she used to save and cover home, food and school fees. She believes she will grow more with her business and become an international business person. With her new loan request, she will buy kids' clothes to resell. 

Ummy will share this loan with her loan group, "PUGU," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy kids' clothes to resell.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Умеда планирует организовать свой бизнес и таким образом помочь своему мужу по обеспечению семьи. Она хочет организовать бизнес по производству и продажи кондитерских изделий. Умеда с такой целью участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки муки, сахара и т.п. для организации нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umeda is a hardworking 26-year-old who is married and has two children.  She is planning on setting up a new pastry shop to be able to help her husband provide for their family.  With this goal in mind, she enrolled in a course titled "Achieve Success" sponsored by an association for businesswomen and received a certificate upon completion.  She is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni to buy flour, sugar and the like for her new business, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar etc. for setting up a new business

loans.name: Medel

texts.en:
Medel is 57 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Medel has an eatery business. She earns about 15,000 pesos a month doing this type of work. 

Medel has requested a loan to buy kitchen utensils for her carenderia (eatery). Medel has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Medel would like to have a restaurant someday.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her carenderia (eatery).

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en: Domingga is 52 years old and lives in Bangkal, Ozamiz. She is married and has four adult children. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, but she earns an income as well. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 26 years old with one child. With one child in school, Elvie works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a buying and selling of nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 44 years old and has five children. Yolanda is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Yolanda has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es: Doña Ana, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, y reside en un sector que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace 9 años inicio su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz, las cuales vende en su casa. Ella compra el maíz, lo cocina, hace las tortillas.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 6,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para reconstruir la galera donde tiene la hornilla y comprar maíz para la elaboración de tortillas y vender. Su plan es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old. She is married and has two children. They live in a sector which is within the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She has always been a saleswoman. Nine years ago she launched her own business, making and selling corn tortillas, which she sells out of her home. She purchases corn, cooks it and then prepares the tortillas. 

The loan Ana has requested is for 6,000 lempiras and will be used to rebuild the patio where her oven sits; and to purchase corn to make her tortillas. Her plan is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to rebuild the galley which houses her oven, and to purchase corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy new fishing net for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As the married parent of seven children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Letecia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business buying and selling bananas.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es:
Secundino tiene 49 años de edad, esta casado y es agricultor, vive solamente con su esposa ya que no pudieron procrear hijos. sin embargo, son una pareja muy unida y juntos han logrado salir adelante. Secundino desempeña el oficio agricola, lo aprendio de su padre y quien le enseño todo acerca de la siembra de granos basicos.

Secundino tambien se ha dedicado a la crianza de pollos de engorde, pero el negocio no le funciono porque años atras los materiales y el alimento para sus pollos tenian un alto costo, el cual no lograban cubrir sus pocos ingresos y no era muy rentable.

Entonces se dio cuenta que una pariente obtenia buenos ingresos de una pequeña tienda y tomo la idea de comenzar su propio negocio ofreciendo productos basicos para el hogar y asi fue como de broma en broma se hizo de un buen número de clientes y su negocio empezo a crecer en ganancias y decidio invertir con nuevos productos. 

El credito lo necesita para volver a invertir en productos para su tienda, como arroz, frijoles, sal, azúcar, detergentes, aceite, pan, etc. Secundino busca ayudar a la gente ofreciendo sus productos con precios mas bajos. Su sueño es poner una granja de gallina ponedora.
texts.en:
Secundino, 49, is married and is a farmer.  He only lives with his wife because they could not have any children. However, they are a very united couple and together they have managed to move forward. Secundino works in agriculture, a trade he learnt from his father, who taught him everything about growing basic grains.

He also raises chickens to fatten them up.  However, this business hasn't worked very well because the material and food he needs has always been very expensive.  As a result, he could never cover his costs and make a profit.

Then, he realized that a relative of his made good profit from a small store, so he decided to use the same idea and open up a small business offering basic household products.  With his good sense of humor he won over a few customers and his business started to grow.  As he made profits, he reinvested in new products. 

The loan he needs is to buy more products for his store such as rice, frijoles, salt, sugar, detergents, oil, bread, etc.  He needs this aid so that he can offer his products at competitive prices. His dream is to start a hen laying farm.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa de 22 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta cuarto grado ya que por problemas económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios, ahora Rosa esta acompañada y es madre de un pequeño de ocho meses de edad. Su compañero de vida se dedica a la siembra de maíz (agricultura), mientras que Rosa se dedica a la venta de pan por los alrededores de la comunidad, trabajo que lo aprendió de su madre desde hace ocho años, para hornear el pan Rosa y su mamá lo hacen en el horario de 6:00 am a las 5:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de dos vacas lecheras, con las cuales podrá obtener un ingreso mas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Rosa sueña con tener un terrenito y construir una vivienda, ampliar el negocio de panadería y pagar su crédito sin ninguna dificultad para seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Rosa, 22, is a housewife.  She studied up to fourth grade but had to stop due to financial hardship.  Now she is married and has a child who is eight months old. Her husband works in agriculture and sows corn, while Rosa sells bread in the local neighborhood.  She learnt this trade from her mother when she was eight years old.  With her mother, she bakes the bread in the oven from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm.

The loan she is asking for from Credicampo is so that she can buy two dairy cows, which she hopes to use to gain an income for her family and provide them with a better standard of living.

Her dream is to have a small plot of land and build her own home. She would also like to expand the bread making business and pay off her loan so he can continue working with the loan institution without problems in the future.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José es un señor de 63 años de edad, es agricultor, por recursos económicos de sus padres él no pudo estudiar, esta acompañado y es padre de tres hijos de 47, 42, y 41 años de edad de los cuales ya ni uno dependen de él; porque ya cada quien tiene su hogar con su familia, su compañera de vida se dedica al comercio en pequeño mientras que José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 47 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre quien toda su vida se dedico a la siembra de maíz (agricultura), para trasladarse a su trabajo José camina dos kilómetros y trabaja en el horario de 3:00 am a 1:30 pm todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de dos vacas para producir mas leche y así podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos para el bienestar de su esposa y de él.

El sueño de José es poder construir una vivienda digna, llegar a tener una granja de diferentes animales y comprar un carro para trabajar.
texts.en:
Jose, 63, is a farmer.  He wasn't able to study when he was young due to his parents' financial situation.  He is married and is the father of three children who are now 47, 42 and 41.  None  of his children depend on him financially as each one has their family and own home.  

His wife has a small store while Jose has worked in agriculture for 47 years.  He learnt the trade from his father who worked all his life sowing corn.  Jose walks two kilometers every day to get to work and works from 3:00 am until 01:30 pm every day.

The loan he is asking Credicampo for is to buy two cows to produce more milk so he can gain a bit more income to improve the standard of living for him and his wife.

He dreams of being able to build a decent home, having a farm with different animals and buying a car for work.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, con quien tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece a la comunidad de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. El realizaba trabajos de carpintería y albañilería y en busca de más ingresos decidió con su esposa establecer una pequeña pulpería para vender productos alimenticios como refrescos, manteca, azúcar, harina, arroz, jabón, papel higiénico, huevos, pan, dulces, churros y otros. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo por 17,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir de más productos como carnes, refrescos, churros, manteca, azúcar, granos básicos, y otros abarrotes que necesita para incrementar el inventario y lograr tener un negocio más grande de la aldea.
texts.en:
Antonio, 30, lives with his wife and they have got two children.  They live in a small village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. 

He does carpentry and building jobs.  In addition, in order to generate more income, he and his wife have set up a small grocery store where they sell basic food such as soft drinks, butter, sugar, flour, eggs, bread, sweets, churros and rice; as well as other products like soap and toilet roll. 

He has asked for a loan of 17,000 lempiras in his third loan cycle.  He will use this money to buy more products such as meat, drinks, churros, butter, sugar, basic grains and other groceries that he needs to increase their inventory and turn their business into the biggest in the area.

loans.use: to buy a selection of grocery products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell; she will also buy two coolers in order to sell fish in the streets.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional computer and spare parts for her computers.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer and spare parts for her computers

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal sales business for 5 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Carlos, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado, tiene una hija con su esposa y reside en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá.  Carlos lleva 10 años de dedicarse a su propio cultivo de café, el siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad ayudando a su padre. Cultiva café el cual vende en el mercado local de la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo en forma grupal por 10,000 lempiras con el propósito de comprar abono y brindar mejor asistencia al cultivo de café y sacar mejor producción. Tiene como plan aumentar su área de cultivo y darle buena asistencia para obtener más producción.
El pertenece al grupo San Antonio, que lo integran cuatro personas, todos se dedican al cultivo de café, viven en la misma zona y solicitan un préstamo grupal por 26,000 lempiras para dar asistencia y abonar la finca. En la foto esta Carlos a la izquierda, Constantino, Jose y Pablo a la derecha.
texts.en:
Carlos, 30, is married and has a daughter.  He lives in a small village in Intibuca.  He has been growing his own coffee for ten years, helping his father. He grows coffee which he sells in the local market. He has asked for a loan of 10,000 lempiras so that he can buy compost and look after his crops better, which will mean more produce. 

He plans to expand his area of cultivation and look after his crops so they yield more.

He belongs to the San Antonio group, made up of four people.  All of them work growing coffee.  They live in the same area and as a group they are asking for a total amount of 26,000 lempiras so they can plant and look after their crops. In the photo Carlos is on the left.  Then from left to right you can see Constantino, Jose and Pablo.

loans.use: to buy compost so he can look after his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Vikie

texts.en: Vikie is 34 years old, married and lives in Aloran. In order to earn a living she runs a store in their neighborhood. With a desire to earn more, she decided to expand her store. Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her inventory. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, biscuits, coffee and milk to sell. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, coffee and milk to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. Josefina is widowed and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetable, spices, etc. .

Josefina has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetable, spices, etc.

loans.name: Coritza Aracely

texts.es: Doña Coritza, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y  vive junto a dos de sus hijos,reside en una aldea del Municipio de Omoa, Cortes. La mayor parte de Sus ingresos dependen de la venta de productos de primera necesidad para el consumo diario, como el arroz, sal, manteca, azúcar, frijoles, y golosinas, lácteo, embutidos, refrescos, jugos,  etc. Esta pulpería la ha venido surtiendo poco a poco de donde obtiene los ingresos que necesita para la manutención de su familia. El préstamos que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 21,000 Lempiras para la compra de productos de consumo diario como lácteos, embutidos, carnes, granos, refrescos, verduras, jugos etc. con esta inversión piensa incrementar las ventas. Su propósito es seguir trabajando para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Coritza is a 38-year-old single mom who lives with two of her children in a village in the Omoa Municipality, in Cortes. Most of her income comes from the sales of staple necessities such as rice, salt, lard, sugar, beans, candy, dairy products, sausages, soda, juices, etc. She has managed to stock her grocery store little by little and the income from the store is what supports her family. She is requesting a fourth loan of 21,000 Lempiras to buy staple consumables such as dairy products, sausages, meat, grains, soda, vegetables and juice etc. With this investment she hopes to increase her sales. Her aim is to keep working to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple consumables such as dairy products, sausages, meat, grains, vegetables, juices, etc to stock up and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise and renovate her stall.

loans.name: José Amilcar

texts.es:
José tiene 63 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° año de educación Básica, hoy en día está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, todos sus hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares, y en casa solo pasa un nieto que no depende de José pero les hace compañía.
  

José se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que desempeña desde que tenía 12 años, aprendió con su 
papá, José siembra granos básicos como maíz , frijol, ajonjolí y sandía, el 
lugar donde trabaja le queda a unos seis kilómetros de distancia por lo que viaja cada dos días, trabaja 6 horas diarias y un jornalero le ayuda en las actividades agrícolas.
 

Él solicita este crédito para invertir en la preparación de dos hectáreas de tierra para sembrar ajonjolí, empezará a chapodar y rastrear la tierra.
   
José sueña con seguir trabajando en  la agricultura y cosechar para el consumo de la familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 63, has a third grade education.  He and his wife, who takes care of the household, have adult children who live independently with their own families.  An independent grandson lives with Jose and his wife to keep them company.

Jose has worked in agriculture for 12 years and learned the trade from his father.  He grows basic grains such as corn, beans, sesame and watermelon.  His cropland is six kilometers from home so he goes there every two days and works six hours.  He has a hired worker who helps with the agricultural activity.

He is requesting a loan to prepare two acres of land to plant sesame.  He will begin by pruning the fields and plowing the soil.

Jose's goal is to continue growing crops and harvesting for family consumption.

loans.use: To prepare his land to plant sesame.

loans.name: Zanele

texts.en:
Zanele is applying for a second loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“My studies have progressed very well because Kiva has helped me to pay for my studies as well as with money for transport. I no longer have problems with coming to school and attend every day because I have transport money every day.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lidia de 32 años es la propietaria de un restaurante el cual inició sus operaciones en el año 2012. Toda su experiencia empezó  desde muy pequeña cuando debió trabajar en restaurantes y creó la idea cuando comprendió lo rentable que resultaban, por eso tomó sus ahorros y dio apertura a su propio restaurante. . En su restaurante ofrece almuerzos, y meriendas a domicilio y desde su local. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, comprándole insumos a mayoristas que ofrecen los mejores precios y esto hace que sea más competitiva y pueda vender alimentos a empresas y principalmente a sus vecinos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará abarrotes, sillas y mesas, con este crédito contará con un capital base, que le permitirá trabajar aun mas holgada.
texts.en:
Lidia, 32, owns a restaurant which she began in 2012.  Her experience in the sector comes from when she was very young and worked in restaurants.  She came up with the idea when she realized how profitable the business was so she saved and opened her own restaurant.

The restaurant serves lunches and dinners and also has a delivery service.  She works on both a cash and credit basis and buys supplies from wholesalers who offer the best prices.  This makes her more competitive and able to sell food to companies and, mainly, her neighbors.

She is currently applying for a CrediKiva loan to buy groceries, tables and chairs.  The loan will serve as working capital so she will not have to be so concerned about money.

loans.use: To buy groceries, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Doña Elsa, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Ella tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, vende mercadería como ser ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Esta actividad la realiza hace 10 años de manera ambulante. Para mantener su negocio ha obtenido varios préstamos y actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 lempiras para comprar ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisas, ropa  interior y ropa para niños, con el fin de incrementar las ventas y los ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida de la familia y mejorar el negocio.
texts.en: Elsa is 52 years old and is a single mother of two children. She lives in the Azacualpa Municipality in Santa Barbara. She earns a living by selling women's, men's, and children's clothes. She has been doing this as a street vendor for the last 10 years. To keep her business going, she has used several loans and she is currently requesting another for 10,000 lempiras to buy clothes such as blouses, pants, underwear, and children's clothes. She hopes to increase her sales and her income to improve her family's quality of life and improve the business.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as blouses, pants, shirts, underwear and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Flerie

texts.en:
Flerie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling bamboo.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell for her business buying and selling charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zanele

texts.en:
Zanele is applying for a second loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“My first loan has helped me a lot because before I used to struggle a lot with transport money, which made me not come to school, but now everything is better. It has also helped reduce the amount that I owe the school.”

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Siboniso

texts.en:
Siboniso is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“Ever since I received the first loan, my studies have improved as I am able to always make it to school, so that I can study and complete my degree. Being at school enables me to concentrate on my school work, which is important to me.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Romeo De Jesús

texts.es:
Romeo tiene 67 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su pareja se dedica a las labores del hogar, tiene 3 hijos por lo tanto son 4 personas que dependen de el.


Romeo actualmente se dedica a trabajar en estructura metálicas, tiene 25 años de hacer esto y lo aprendió de su padre, además tiene tiempo para trabajar en la agricultura, por tener el taller en su casa no sale, sino que se levanta muy temprano para poder hacer lo que tiene programado para ese día.


El dinero del préstamo sera utilizado para la siembra de maíz y el alquiler del terreno, pues en estos días comenzará a trabajar en la agricultura ya que en invierno es poco el trabajo en el taller de estructura metálicas.


Los sueños de Romeo son tener ganado de repasto lo que le generaría un ingreso adicional que le serviría a su familia para seguir adelante, así tener mas grande el taller y confía en Dios y en los prestamos pues le darán el impulso que necesita.
texts.en:
Romeo, 67, has scarce economic resources and was unable to get an education.  His wife takes care of the household and they have three children; so there are four dependents under his care.

He currently works with metal structures and has been in business for 25 years, having learned the trade from his father.  He also has time to work in agriculture.  Since he works from home he does not have to go out to work but gets up very early to do everything he has scheduled for the day.

The loan will be used to rent land and plant corn since there is not much metal structure activity in the winter time.  Romeo's dream is to begin livestock farming with grazing cattle to earn extra income for his family.  This would allow him to expand his workshop.  He prays the loans will give him the impulse he needs.

loans.use: To rent land and plant corn.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years of age and a resident of Brgy. Guayabal, Cauayan City, Isabela. Besides being a mother to her six children, Grace also works in their electrical shop business with her husband, who is an electrician.

As a mother, she wants her children to finish a college education. Therefore she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from KIVA lenders through ASKI to pay for the tuition fees and allowances of Boniedick.

Her son, Boniedick, pictured above, is aged 18 and wants to take up Political Science at Isabela State University, Cauayan City, Isabela, for he believes that he can reach her goal someday if he follows this course. He also wants to help his parents to develop their business to earn more income.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fees and allowances of Boniedick.

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
Maria siempre sintió gusto por la comercialización desde muy temprana edad, este gusto se manifestó gracias a su padre quien le inculco el amor por las ventas.
A medida que fue creciendo, Maria quiso ser independiente y conseguir sus propios ingresos, fue así como monto una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en el municipio de La Dorada.
Hoy en día su tienda es humilde y no tiene muchos productos para vender, pero poco a poco está transformando y renovando su negocio; ella desea tener un aliento económico para realizar la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, adicionalmente desea comprar frutas y verduras para mejorar la oferta en su establecimiento.
Es una joven muy reconocida en el sector gracias a su atención y vocación de servicio que la han hecho perdurar en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Maria has always enjoyed sales from a very early age.  She is thankful that her parents were the ones who instilled in her a love for commerce.  As she was growing up, Maria wanted to be independent and earn her own income.  So she decided to open a grocery store in the town of La Dorada.

Her store is a modest one and does not offer a wide variety of products; but little by little she has transformed and renovated the business.  She wants to be able to finance the purchase of a variety of staple goods and also buy fruit and vegetables so she can offer more goods.

Maria is very well known in the sector thanks to her customer service and dedication which have allowed her to stay in business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of staple goods, and fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is thankful that she reached out to PMPC for her capital needs. She was able to start her rice retailing business and to take out several loans, which she has religiously paid back. 

Now she has applied for another loan to purchase bags of rice for retail sale. She hopes to increase her income by expanding her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice for retail sale

loans.name: Glowyn Joy

texts.en:
Despite financial hardship, Glowyn Joy is determined to finish her studies in college. She is 19 years old and is taking up a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology at Nueva Vizcaya State University. Her mother runs a small retail store within their community while her father cultivates their farmland. 

Due to insufficient income, her parents are not able to pay all her school fees. Therefore Glowyn Joy is asking for an educational loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for her tuition fees, school uniform and books. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help to her, and will enable her to pursue her studies. 

She hopes that someday she will achieve her goals and be successful.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees, school uniform and books

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more spices, canned goods and other groceries. She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as the above. 

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices, canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a business direct selling herbal products and personal collection items in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
The women of Tumaini are from Bukavu, Eastern DR Congo. They have been part of Wezesha Project for almost two years and this loan will be their 5th loan and their first at the maximum loan size of $400USD per member. 

In a country with and average annual income of just $319USD, this represents a significant opportunity to expand their businesses and better support their families through the profits. As with all Wezesha Project loans, it must be used only for their businesses. As with most businesses in Bukavu, these women are sellers. They buy products from neighbouring Rwanda, or larger markets in town and resell them in their areas to make a profit. The women of Tumaini sell things like poultry, sugar, charcoal, bread, and other staples. 

Judith will use the loan to buy flats of eggs and live chickens for sale. Because this is a consumer market, the ability to buy in larger quantities means a better price, and a better price means more profit. Judith is married but her husband is unemployed. This leaves her to be the only income earner for her household of 8 including her 6 children. With the proceeds from her work she plans to repay the loan, pay school fees for her 5 school age children, and have more money for food and things around the house.

Help ERDO empower the women of Tumaini to support their families by funding their loans so they can grow their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and live chickens for sale at the market.

loans.name: Tushirikiane Group

texts.en:
The members of Tushirikiane are receiving their 6th loan from ERDO's Wezesha Project. Each group member will be receiving a loan of $400USD to invest in their businesses. In a country where the average annual income is $316USD this represents a significant opportunity.

Rebeka is using her loan to purchase a large load firewood from the countryside and paying for the transport back to the city to sell at the local market. Buying in this volume gives her a far lower price which allows her to make a profit in the city.

Rebeka is married with 3 children. She says this loan will help her to grow her business and with the profits, feed and clothe her family, as well as pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wood for cooking to sell.

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.en:
The woman of Shukrani are from Bukavu Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. This is their 6th loan with Wezesha Project. They started at $50USD each and have worked their way up to $400USD each. This loan will be used to expand their businesses and from the profits they make, used to repay the loans and use money to pay for things such as school fees, medical bills, and rent. This loan will empower these women to make a better life for their families.

Vumilia is a married mother of 3. She is using her loan to purchase 200 smoked fish for sale at the local market. She says sells this product because unlike fresh fish, it lasts longer. Vumilia said that her loans have helped her buy everything that her family needs and this new loan will continue to improve their life.

loans.use: to buy 200 smoked fish to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.en:
The women of group Ushindi are from the city of Bukavu, Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. This loan is their 6th as a part of Wezesha Project and have a strong repayment record. Each group member will receive a loan of $400USD to invest in their businesses.

Nsimire is using her loan to purchase 25 large sacks of charcoal and the transport back to Bukavu. Selling in this volume makes her a strong businesswoman in the city, almost like a wholesaler. Buying in this volume brings down the transport costs per sack, meaning she can make more profit. This is good because Nsimire is the sole income earner for her 8 children. She is married, but like most in Eastern DRC her husband is unemployed. This loan will allow Nsimire to support her family.

Join ERDO in empowering these women to help themselves and their families by funding this loan.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and transport to Bukavu for sale.

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en:
Group Faraja is from the city of Bukavu, Eastern DR Congo and this is their 5th loan with Wezesha Project. Each member will receive $400USD to invest in their individual businesses.

Mwavita's business is selling fresh fish. Since Bukavu is located on Lake Kivu, she can purchase fresh fish on a regular basis. Mwavita is the married and has 6 children. With the proceeds from this loan she plans to pay rent for her house and school fees for her children, things that were difficult to do before Wezesha Project.

Help ERDO empower these women and their families by funding their loan today.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mariama Idrissa's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte actuellement des femmes qui en plus de vivre ensemble dans le même village, gagnent en expérience dans leur activité respective car comprenant de mieux en mieux le programme cela favorisé par le fait que le village habite un grand « Louma » marché hebdomadaire. La solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 51 ans, est mariée et mère de 07enfants dont 05 filles et 02 garçons. Elle mène diverses activités en passant de la restauration de la vente d’huile de palme. Cette activité de commerce, elle la pratique devant son restaurant se trouvant dans le marché. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus d’une vingtaine d’année.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter 02 bidons d’huile de palme de 20 litres à raison de 900 F CFA le litre, 03 sacs de riz , de l’huile pour un bidon de 10 litres et divers bouillons en vu de faciliter la préparation des repas.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’apporter son soutien à la fois à ses enfants en âges de scolarisation, en plus de satisfaire leur besoins en habillement, en nourriture et sanitaire et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was established on May 16, 2011 during the inauguration of their banc villageois. They are women who, in addition to living together in the same village, have gained experience in their respective businesses by participating in the program. The fact that their village is home to the large Louma weekly market helps. The group is bound by solidarity and support, and they all engage in small-scale commerce.

Mariama (who is seated on the far right with her her left hand raised) is the featured borrower for this group. She is 51 years old, married, and a mother of seven children, of whom five are girls and two are boys. She engages in various activities, from running a restaurant to the selling of palm oil. She sells palm oil in front of her restaurant, which is located in the market. She does well with this business, which she has done for over twenty years.

With this new loan, she plans to buy two 20-liter drums of palm oil at 900 francs CFA per liter, three sacs of rice, a 10-liter drum of oil, and different kinds of bullion, which will be used to make meals. 

Earnings will help to support [her and her family's needs], at a time when her children are school-aged: housing, food, sanitation. She will also strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, oil, and different kinds of bouillon

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es un hombre de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos.
Su vida la ocupa como sastre, cortando tela y planchando ropa. Ya lleva más de 10 años en esta labor, cuando era niño nunca se imaginó que viviria de la tela, siempre le gustó la camisa blanca y combinar telas y colores, todo pasó de ser un pasatiempos a ser el trabajo de toda su vida; “primero fui ayudante de sastre me ocupaba de coser los botones, planchaba y me ocupaba de buscar las telas, en un abrir y cerrar de ojos ya pasaron más de 10 años…” comenta.
Bernardo es un emprendedor, tiene el deseo de crear una empresa y dejarla a sus hijos para que sigan sus pasos, también tiene necesidades como; la compra de telas, botones he hilos, que son parte de sus quehaceres diarios.
Su sueño es consolidar su negocio para el bienestar  de su familia, es por ese motivo que Bernardo solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de costura.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a 28-year-old man who lives with his partner and has two children. His life stays busy due to his work as a tailor, which includes cutting fabric and ironing clothes. He has been in this line of work for more than 10 years. As a boy, he never imagined working with fabric. However, he always liked white shirts and combining them with other fabrics and colors. What started out as a hobby would turn into his vocation for his entire life. “I started out as a tailor’s assistant and was responsible for sewing buttons, ironing, and searching for fabrics. In a blink of an eye, I realized that I’ve already spent more than 10 years doing this type of work,” says Bernardo.

He is an entrepreneur who has the drive to start his own business so that his children can follow in his footsteps. Bernardo also needs to acquire fabric, buttons, and thread since these items are part of his daily routine. His dream is to formalize his business for the welfare of his family. For this reason, Bernardo is requesting a loan in order to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maimouna Seyni's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. A ce jour le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles font aussi de la fabrication de savon traditionnel et de la culture sous pluie. 

Madame Maïmouna (assise au milieu en tunique vert et blanc avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de quatre enfants dont une fille et trois garçons. Elle gère une boutique dans son village où elle vend divers produits de consommation courante (riz, huile, sucre, thé, savon, détergent en poudre, bouillions et autres). Elle s’approvisionne au marché central régional en gros et demi gros pour la revente au détail dans son village. Elle jouit d’une très grande expérience dans ce domaine.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique par l’achat de sacs de sucre, de riz et divers autres produits de consommation courante.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales et surtout à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
