This group was established on May 17, 2011 during the inauguration of their banc villageois. To date, the group has included mostly women who have a solid experience in small-scale commerce, which is their principal activity. Some of the women also make traditional soap or engage in rain-fed agriculture. They all live in the same village, and share solidarity and support with each other.

Maimouna (who is seated in the middle of the photo, wearing a green and white tunic and has her right hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is married and a mother of four children, of whom one is a girl and three are boys. Maimouna runs a shop in her village where she sells various consumer goods (rice, oil, sugar, tea, soap, powder detergent, bullion, and other goods). She procures her goods from the central regional market at wholesale or half-wholesale and re-sells them at retail in her village.

She does well with this business. This new loan will be used to reinforce her stock by buying sacs of sugar, rice, and other consumer goods.

Earnings will allow her to actively support her family's needs, especially her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy sacs of sugar, rice, and other consumer goods

loans.name: Mariama Boubacar's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 17 Septembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son septième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit comme, accompagné d’activité de maraichage durant l’hivernage.

Madame Mariama (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants  exclusivement des filles. Elle est vendeuse de denrée alimentaire (riz, huile, sucre) et divers autres produits de consommation courante (savon, détergent) qu’elle achète par paquet pour la revente par détail dans son village et environ.

 Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter du thé vert deux à trois paquets, du sucre un sac et divers bouillions pour assaisonnement en vu de la revente au détail. 

Les bénéfices réalisés, lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de scolarisation et sanitaires de ses enfants et ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
This group was established on September 17, 2011 during the inauguration of their banc villageois. This group has just started their seventh cycle and is made up of women who live in the same village. They share a good understanding of each other and a good spirit. The group members all engage in small-scale commerce, along with garden farming during the rainy season. 

Mariama (who is standing on the first right in the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is 39 years old, married, and a mother of three children, who are all girls. 

Mariama sells food products (rice, oil, sugar) and other consumer goods (soap, detergent), which she buys and sells at retail in her village and surrounds. This new loan will serve to buy two or three packs of green tea, a sac of sugar, and different kinds of seasoned stock, which she will resell.

Earnings will allow her to meet her children's school and health needs, as well as her own needs.

loans.use: to buy green tea, a sac of sugar, and different kinds of stock

loans.name: Luz Dary Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora luz es una mujer polifacética ya que se dedica a varias actividades.
Primero que todo aprendió arreglar y embellecer uñas con solo ver, luego paso a vender objetos y ropa a través de catálogos, por ultimo decidió montar un almacén de variedades en su propia casa.
Todas estas actividades las aprendió de manera empírica y hasta ahora ha podido obtener buenos ingresos para sostener a sus hijos.
Ella solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa para dama y caballero, así podrá aumentar su inventario y su variedad de productos.
Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio a través de este crédito y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz is a multi-faceted woman who engages in various activities. First of all, she learned how to repair and embellish nails just by looking at them. She also spends time selling merchandise and clothes through catalogs. As of late, she decided to open a variety store in her home.

Luz learned all of these business activities through trial and error. Until now, she has been able to generate a good income in order to support her children. Luz is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of women’s and men’s clothing in order to increase her inventory and her variety of products. She hopes to give her business a boost with this loan so that she can have a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men’s clothing to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 17 Septembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son septième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit comme, accompagné d’activité de maraichage durant l’hivernage.

Madame Kadiatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 24 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 garçon et 02 filles. Elle tient une table au village où elle vend diverses denrées alimentaires sucre, thé vert, bouillons culinaires et divers aux produits. Elle s’approvisionne tous les lundis au marché hebdomadaire de la zone pour ensuite revendre au détail dans son village.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter du sucre,  du thé par paquet de 10 et  le reste  pour deux variétés de grosse de cigarette de 20 paquets. 

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle compte accompagner son mari dans le développement des ses activités génératrices de revenu et consolider son épargne.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was set up and inaugurated on 17th September 2011. This group has just commenced its seventh loan cycle and is made up of women who all live in the same village. They all get on very well together and there is a good group spirit. Their principal activity is small-scale trading as well as market gardening during the winter season.

Kadiatou, who is sittling on the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the star borrower of the group. She is 24 years old, married and mother to three children: one boy and two girls. She has a table in the village where she sells a variety of groceries: sugar, green tea, stock cubes and other diverse products. She gets her supplies every Mondaly at the weekly market in the area and then resells on a retail basis in her village.

With this new loan she is planning to buy sugar and tea by packets of ten; she will use the rest to buy two varieties of cartons of 20 packs of cigarettes.  

With the profits she makes she plans to help her husband develop his income-generating activites and build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar and tea (in packets of ten) and then use the balance to buy two varieties of cartons of packets of 20 cigarettes.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 60 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Visitacion has been raising pigs for 41 years now, and has borrowed 38 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 54-year-old, hardworking woman who has been handling a cloth trading business for the past 25 years. She purchases cloth wholesale and sells it in the market, where she has a strong client base. Along with cloth trading, she is also very skilled at embroidery and sells embroidered cloth in her area. 

She is a mother of 5 children and longs to provide a good life for them. Sughran is in her 7th loan cycle and has an admirable creditworthiness. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more cloth to sell. 

Sughran aspires to run a training centre where she can teach embroidery skills to the girls of her village so that they can earn and support their families as she does.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a hardworking woman from Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta. 

She sells a variety of items to earn a living. As a microfinance member, she has been able to take out several loans. Recently she has applied for a loan to purchase plastic wares and other merchandise to sell. 

Alice hopes to improve their living conditions and that her children will have good careers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase plastic wares and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nove

texts.en:
Nove is 38 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Nove is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rizan

texts.en:
Rizan is a 32-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
  
Rizan has an internet café business in the Philippines. She requested a 45,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her internet café.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rizan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her internet cafe

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leah is 33 years old and her two children are in school.

Leah has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Leah has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Salustia

texts.en:
Salustia is 65 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Salustia has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits.

Salustia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rogelou

texts.en:
Rogelou, 32 years old, is married and a resident of Oroquieta. Rogelou joined Paglaum MPC to avail herself of the various programs and services of PMPC. 

She has now applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase sugar, coffee, noodles to sell. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, a she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, noodles to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 35 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Mary Joy has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is 66 years old and married with three children.

Felicita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Felicita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Felicita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 55 years old and married with eleven children, two of whom are in school. Alita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Alita has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Alita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a thirty-nine-year-old married man with ten children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows cocoa. From the savings of cocoa he set-up a motorcycle transport business which now he operates to cater for his daily obligations. 

He hopes to improve on his family's standard of living though price changes, bad weather and bad debtors affect his plans. He intends to use the loan to buy and sell cocoa ahead of the peak season.

loans.use: to buy and sell cocoa ahead of the peak season.

loans.name: Olga Yaneth

texts.es:
Olga de 48 años de edad, es originaria de esa comunidad, construyó su casa en el  mismo terreno de donde viven sus padres, estudió hasta el bachillerato. El esposo trabaja  conduciendo buses interdepartamentales.

El negocio lo inicio desde hace 9 años con el apoyo económico que le dieron los padres de ella. Vende bebidas carbonatadas y productos de primera necesidad. Abre su negocio a las 5:00 am y cierra a las 10:00 pm, está situada en un lugar estratégico, sobre la calle principal de la comunidad y frente a la casa donde más de 30 personas descreman leche y que después de hacerlo se llevan esta leche para sus respectivas casas a terminar de procesar.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de un freezer  o congelador por $700.00, un refrigerador por $500.00 y el resto ($300.00) lo invertirá en  carnes, embutidos y productos de primera necesidad, especialmente artículos que no oferta.

Su deseo es ampliar los inventarios de su tienda, construir un área para realizar venta de pupusas y meriendas.
texts.en:
Olga, 48 years old, is a native of this community, built her house on the property where her parents live, and studied through high school. Her husband works driving inter-city buses.

She started her business 9 years ago with financial support from her parents. She sells ​​carbonated drinks and staples. She opens her business at 5:00 am and closes it at 10:00 pm. It is located in a strategic location on the main street of the community and outside the house where more than 30 people de-cream milk and that they later take home to finish processing.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of a freezer  for $ 700.00, a refrigerator for $ 500.00 and the remainder ($ 300.00) will be invested in meats, cold cuts and staples, especially items that she does not currently offer.

Her goal is to expand her store inventory, and build an area for selling pupusas and snacks.

loans.use: buy a freezer for $ 700.00, a refrigerator for $ 500.00 and the remainder ($ 300.00) she will invest in meats, cold cuts and staples, especially ones that she currently does not offer.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 47 años de edad, es un padre de familia ejemplar como menciona su esposa con quien vive desde hace 25 años,  él no tuvo ningún estudio académico. Actualmente,  sola una hija vive con ellos y 2 nietos ya que sus otros hijos han emigrado a otro país. 

Él es una persona responsable y trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado a su familia adelante, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, además por temporada el siembra sandillas, el terreno donde  siembra le queda a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa, en el trabajo su esposa le ayuda y cuando sus hijos estaban con él también le ayudaban.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar el alquiler de la tierra para el cultivo, ya que él tiene planeado cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y necesita preparar la tierra, pagar mozos para en la tercera semana de julio estar sembrando el maíz, así con tiempo arreglar los cercos del terreno y limpiar la tierra.  

José quiere seguir luchando para siempre seguir adelante y poder inculcarle a sus nietos valores que les ayuden a salir adelante y que sean unas personas de bien para la sociedad, además poder seguir trabajando y luchando para su esposa y sus nietos.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and, according to his wife of 25 years, an exemplary father. José did not go to school. José has just one daughter who lives at home, and two grandchildren. José’s other children emigrated to another country.

José is hard-working and responsible. With a lot of effort he has helped his family to get ahead. José makes a living growing basic grains and, depending on the season, watermelons. The land that José works is one kilometre from his house. He works with help from his wife and, when they are at home, his children.

José is applying for this loan in order to pay rent on land for growing crops. (José plans to grow corn on 21,000 square metres of land and needs to prepare the land and pay for labourers to sow the corn in the third week of July. Before this he also wants to fix the fence round the land and clean the earth).

José wants to continue fighting in order to prosper and to teach his grandchildren values that will help them to get ahead and become good people for society. José wants to continue working and fighting for his wife and grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay rent on land for growing crops. (José plans to grow corn on 21,000 square metres of land and needs to prepare the land and pay for labourers to sow the corn in the third week of July. Before this he wants to fix the fence round the land and clean the earth).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and cement.

loans.name: Shamimu

texts.en:
Shamimu is a 27-year-female. She is married with two children, one who is attending school. She is a palm oil seller, working for 11 hours 7 days a week and her additional income is from farming. 

She wants the money to buy palm oil to sell and hopes to expand her business in the future. Shamimu is a hardworking person however she is faced with a challenge of competition.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a rice milling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Eva is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling.

loans.name: Eldina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Eldina to improve her business. She has a kiosk and sewing business where many people come to buy every day.

She will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, long pants, shorts, sewing supplies, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, and salt. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2003. She feels so comfortable to run her own business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Eldina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also for helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, long pants, shorts, sewing supplies, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Cesarina

texts.es:
Cesarina de 26 años de edad, realizo sus estudios hasta quinto año de medicina general en una universidad de la capital, su esposo trabaja como secretario en la alcaldía municipal desde el 2012,  tienen una hija de 6 meses de nacida solo ellos tres viven en su casa.

Cesarina trabaja en la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos tiene 5 años de realizar este trabajo, todo comenzó cuando ella estudiaba para cancelar los gastos de los estudios, ella vendía perfumes por catálogo, bolsos para señoritas entre otras cosas. Las ventas las realiza con sus amistades y la mayoría con las clientes que visita la sala de belleza de su suegra, sus horario de trabajo es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm.


El dinero lo utilizaran para comprar ropa, bolsos para señoritas, zapatos y perfumenes, el dinero servirá como capital de inversión en el negocio.    

Su sueño principal es terminar sus estudios de medicina, pero de igual forma crecer en el negocio para costear los gastos que genere sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cesarina is 26 years old and has completed up to fifth year of her medicine studies at a university in the capital city. Cesarina’s husband has been a secretary at the local town hall since 2012. The couple has a six-month-old daughter. The three members of the family live together.

Cesarina has been working selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics for five years. This started when Cesarina started studying. She worked to pay the costs of her studies: Cesarina sold perfumes out of catalogues, as well as ladies’ bags and other items. Cesarina sells to friends but mostly to customers who come to her mother-in-law’s beauty salon. Cesarina works from 8am until 4pm.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, ladies' bags, shoes and perfumes; this loan will serve as capital to invest in her business.

Cesarina’s biggest dream is to finish her medical degree. She also wants to expand her business to continue covering the costs of her studies.

loans.use: to buy clothes, ladies' bags, shoes and perfumes; this loan will serve as capital to invest in her business.

loans.name: Pedro Asuncion

texts.es: Pedro tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su adre y sus hijos. Pedro se gana la viada mediante la fabricación de zapatos de forma artesanal y es así como con mucho esfuerzo logra llevar el sustento a su familia. Pedro ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora de su vivienda. Desea enladrillar el piso y poner nuevas puertas en la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo de piso y puertas.
texts.en: Pedro is 55 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his life partner, his mother, and his children. Pedro makes a living making handmade shoes. With this work and a lot of effort, Pedro is able to support his family. Pedro has taken the decision to apply for this loan from “FUSAI” in order to invest in improving his home. Pedro wants to lay a floor and install new doors. Pedro will use this loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, floor bricks and doors.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, floor bricks and doors; these items will be used to lay a floor and change the doors in the house.

loans.name: Irma Mariela

texts.es:
Irma de 24 años de edad,  estudió hasta noveno grado, la falta de motivación la llevó a no seguir la escuela, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, ambos son los responsable de la manutención de sus hijos por lo que los ingresos van a una misma causa, y nadie mas vive con ellos.


Ella tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado, vende pan horneado, una señora lo hace e Irma lo vende, está en un punto céntrico donde circula bastante gente, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la actividad, para llegar el lugar de trabajo hace un recorrido de un kilómetro, nadie más se involucra en el negocio y su horario de ventas es de 8 am a  3 pm.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materia prima para la elaboración y venta de pan, ya que además que vende el pan de la otra señora, Irma también hace su propia venta.

Los sueños que tiene son crecer en las ventas y obtener mejores ingresos, con lo que podrá cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Irma is 24 years old. She completed up to ninth grade at school but, with no motivation, she stopped attending. Irma has a partner, who makes a living in farming. The couple are responsible for looking after their children and so their incomes go into doing this. Nobody else lives with the family.

Irma has a stall at the market. There she sells bread. One woman bakes the bread and Irma sells it. The stall is in a central place in the market with a lot of passers-by. Irma has been doing this work for four years. Irma must travel one kilometre to arrive at her work. There are no other employees at the business. Irma sells the bread from 8am until 3pm.

Irma needs this loan in order to buy supplies for making and selling bread. As well as selling bread prepared by another woman. Irma also makes her own bread to sell.

Irma’s dreams are to increase sales and earn a better income. With it, she will be able to pay for her and her family’s necessities.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling bread.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaias tiene 32 años de edad y es ayudante de albañil. Él es muy trabajador, responsable y honesto. Trabaja muy duro para ganarse el sustento diario y apoyar a su familia. Isaias solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, ladrillo, arena, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Isaías, 32, is a construction assistant.  He's very hardworking, responsible, and honest, and he works very hard to earn a daily living to support his family.

Isaías is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in building a cistern.  He needs cement, bricks, sand, and other materials.

He hopes to be able to get the loan so he can proceed with construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. She is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Edison Arley

texts.es: Ediso es un joven de 24 años de edad el esta casado  tienen una hija de 4 años de edad  que ya asite a la escuela, Edison juntamente con su esposa son colombianos que viven 4 años en Ecuador, Edison se dedica a trabajar al jornal y juntamente con su esposa  tambien se dedica a vender productos de plastico, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de plastico para ofrecerlos en un pequeño espacio  del local de una amiga y tambien los ofrece de manera ambulante, Edison espera mejorar su negocio e incrementarlo y que esto le permita arrendar un local para ofrecer sus productos y que su esposa trabaje a tiempo completo en este negocio.
texts.en:
Edison is a young man who is 24 years of age. He is married and has a four-year-old daughter who is in school. Edison and his wife are Colombian and have been living in Ecuador for four years. He works as a day laborer, but he and his wife also sell plastic goods. This loan will be invested in the purchase of plastic goods that he can offer from a small retail space owned by a friend. Edison will also sell his goods as a street vendor.

He hopes to improve and increase his business, which would allow him to rent a shop where he can offer his products. His wife works full-time at the business.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods to sell.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is applying for a second loan to support his studies through to graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“Being able to come to school every day with the help of the Kiva loan has been great for me as a student. I have also really found the stipend useful. I am grateful for the help that Kiva has given me and my fellow students.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Eillen

texts.en:
Eillen is 44 years old and married with three children.

Eillen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as shampoo, snack foods, spices and other groceries.

Eillen has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Eillen aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as shampoo, snack foods, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 41 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Salvacion has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 17 years and also earns an income from buy and selling bamboo and food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en:
Nesa is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nesa is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nesa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Nesa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nesa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lebu

texts.en:
Lebu is applying for a second loan to support her studies through to graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“I am very pleased to say that my studies have improved since my first loan. This is because I have been able to attend school everyday, so I have completed and passed all my allocated courses on time. I also know that my fees are paid.”

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Shamilla

texts.en:
Shamilla is applying for a second loan to support her studies through to graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“I am very pleased and thankful for the previous Kiva loan that I received, as it has helped to reduce the burden about how I would pay off my school fees. Since I received the loan, I have been able to concentrate on my studies and receive exceptional grades.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica has mastered her selling skills at her rice retailing business. A widow at 61, she finds it difficult to feed and support her family. But with strong determination, she has been able to withstand all the difficulties. She is thankful that PMPC is behind her on her capital needs. Recently, her need of  45,000 PHP to purchase more bags of rice to sell was answered. She wants to expand her inventory and be able to earn more for the family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from rice retailing.  Evangeline is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Yedida

texts.en: Yedida is a 56-year-old woman. She has a retail shop that sells general merchandise. She started the business to earn a living and cater for the family. She hopes to expand her business to new markets however she is challenged by competition and price fluctuations. She is a hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as plasticware, lamps and omo to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as plasticware, lamps and omo to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a thirty-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. When Judith learnt that her salary savings could not run her needs, she opted to start a mini supermarket to supplement her income generation for her family's welfare. It has improved her decision making and she's happy to see her family's standard of living improved, as well. She wishes to educate her children; however. competition is high in the business. She wants a loan to buy commodities put in her super market like sugar  and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy commodities put in her supermarket like sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Nthabiseng

texts.en:
Nthabiseng is applying for a second loan to support her studies through to graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“When I received my first loan, it helped me a lot with the continuation of my studies. I now don’t worry about finance but can focus on achieving high marks in my studies. Thank you, Kiva!”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Ramarumo

texts.en:
Ramarumo is applying for a second loan to support his studies through to graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“Since the loan, I have been able to come to school without any distractions relating to transport. Also, because Kiva is paying a significant portion of my school fees, I am extremely grateful for all that Kiva is doing for me.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.en:
Felismina is 35 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $600.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as beer, noodles, bread, cigarettes and fish. She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 9 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, noodles, bread, cigarettes and fish to sell

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel, 30 years old, lives in Talic, Oroquieta with her family. Her husband earns a meager income and Liezel wants to help raise income for the family. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her retail business. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now she is applying for 6,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her store. She hopes that her business will continue and some day she will be able to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean, 33 years old, lives in Oroquieta. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari store. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now she applies for 14,900 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and some day become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is 26 years old and has two children. With one child in school, April works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

April has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Cynthia works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. 

Cynthia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase dry goods to sell for her buy and sell dry goods business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

Cynthia hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 47 years old, and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Elsie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsie has been raising pigs for three years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell for her nipa roofing business.

Ester has been in this business for 5 years. Ester also earns income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a business buying and selling cashew nuts in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en: Rocelyn earns a living through her retailing business. She sells a variety of items and lingerie. She finds it easy to sell the chosen items. She is seeking financial assistance from PMPC and was able to make good sales from her previous loans. Now, she has applied for a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase inventories of ready-to-wear clothing to sell. She hopes to maintain her membership status with the cooperative.

loans.use: to restock inventories of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn sells dried fish as her primary source of income. She has had this business for five years now. She is thankful that PMPC provided her the necessary capitalization for her business. 

Recently she applied a loan to buy more kilos of dried fish to sell. 

She doubles the amount of time she spends selling, as it is the start of a school year and she needs financial assistance for the school needs of her children. 

She hopes to own another market stall to display her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of dried fish.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing business for five years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 61 years old, married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur; she has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Monina has been in this business for 40 years.

Monina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring.

In the future, Monina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 48 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school.  Herminia is married.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Herminia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Herminia has been farming vegetables for 10 years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a making dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing.  Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her making dried fish business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 29 years old and has one children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Judith has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Fely works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Fely is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her food market business.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is 48 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Prudencia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from fishing and culturing seaweeds.

Prudencia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of goods to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Fulazia

texts.en: Fulazia, thirty years old, is married with five children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. As a mother who wishes her children well, she works hard to earn a living. She grows cocoa to sell and decided to start selling rice since cocoa is grown on a small scale and also seasonally. She is hindered by unpredictable weather changes. Fulazia intends to use the loan to buy and rent a cocoa garden to realize more profits.

loans.use: to buy and rent a cocoa garden.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en:
Maria Rosa is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Rosa is 36 years old.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maria Rosa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Maria Rosa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Maria Rosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Pamela works very hard to provide for them.

Pamela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Pamela has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Pamela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 49 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Alma has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.en:
Mavludakhon is young and hardworking woman. She is 26 years old. Mavludakhon is not married, and she lives with her parents. Mavludakhon is a sewer. She sews national women’s dresses. She has been busy with this business for more than six years. She learned sewing from a sewer living near her house. Now, she is successful sewer and has her regular customers. 

She is also a student. She always wanted to get a higher education. Mavludakhon must pay for her tuition, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 51 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Celia works very hard to provide for them.

Celia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Celia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Celia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy pigs in order to increase his sales and be able to provide quality education for his children.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed culturing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Maricel is borrowing 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings, rope, plastic containers, etc., for her seaweed culturing business.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, rope, plastic containers, etc.

loans.name: Geralhne

texts.en:
Geralhne is 33 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Geralhne works very hard to provide for them.

Geralhne runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Geralhne has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Geralhne would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 30 years old with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase sort drinks, coffee, sugar, salt, soap, etc., to sell.

Maribeth has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling cashew nuts.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sort drinks, coffee, sugar, salt, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan was born in 1960. He is married and a father of three sons. Adnan is the only provider for his family, and he seeks to provide them with the best life. He has been selling detergents at his shop for three months. Now he needs to raise his profit by purchasing a larger amount of detergents to sell, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more detergents to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 55 years old and married with 10 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marilyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

Marilyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 31-year-old married lady living with her husband and five sons and daughters in Salt, Jordan. She and her husband have been selling fruits and vegetables for one year, and this business is their only source of income that helps them cover their children's needs. 

Now, Taghreed seeks to improve their business by taking a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in order to raise their profit.

loans.use: To bring in more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ejay

texts.en:
Ejay is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more items like rice, soap, biscuits and other groceries for her general store business.

Ejay has been in this business for two years. Ejay earns more income from raising chickens.

Ejay has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, soap, biscuits and other groceries.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lulu is borrowing 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lulu has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy vicuna wool.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 39 años de edad y 14 años de experiencia en confecciones, inició su taller de costura pues desde muy joven,  le gustó está actividad y logró estudiar alta costura. Ella elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir y vende sus productos, entre amigos, familiares que son su principal mercado doméstico. Todos los días trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche, comprando las materias primas e insumos de contado, a la medida en que los necesitan sus clientes. Su meta mas adelante, es tener empleados y en un futuro comprar su vivienda, aunque su mayor desafío es conseguir nuevos clientes, que le generen mucho más utilidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara telas, hilos, correderas etc. Con ello tendrá material para producir y vender sus productos a todo costo, ganando aun mas dinero, para hacer mucho mas efectiva su iversión.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 39 years old and has fourteen years of experience running a sewing business which she began when she was a young woman. She enjoyed sewing and managed to take some advanced courses in it. She makes all kinds of clothing and sells it to friends and relatives who are her principal market. Every day she works from 8 in the morning to 8 at night buying supplies for cash whenever her customers need items. 

In the future Beatriz wants to employ staff and also buy a house. Her major challenge is finding new customers and generating more income. Right now she is applying for a loan through Kiva, the first one she has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the money she will buy fabric, thread, runners etc. Then she will have the material she needs to produce and sell items of clothing, thereby earning more money and capitalizing on her investment.

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, runners

loans.name: Dilia

texts.es: Dilia de 32 años de edad, habita en un municipio área metropolitana de Barranquilla; allí tiene una miscelánea donde ofrece artículos para el hogar, accesorios femeninos y de papelería especialmente. Desde el año 2012, cuando se mudó a otro barrio y observó la necesidad de sus habitantes en adquirir artículos variados, decidió emprender su actividad comercial,  contando con un pequeño ahorro que había logado. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, de lunes a domingos, desde las 8 dela  mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, comprando de contado a mayoristas. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y ubicarse  en un local, que le ofrezca mayor comodidad.  Aunque su mayor desafío es tener suficientes recursos, hoy se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que solicita mediante el cual comprará  productos de tocador para el hogar y de cacharrería. Con ello ampliará el surtido de su negocio, ayudando así a potencializar las ventas e impactar sus ingresos con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Dilia, 32, lives in a municipality in the Barranquilla Metropolitan Area. She has a corner shop where she sells household items, women’s accessories and stationary items, among other things.

She has been doing this since 2012, when she moved to a new neighborhood and observed the people there needed to buy this varied items, so she decided to undertake this commercial activity, using the few savings she had. She sells on credit and for cash, Monday through Sunday, from 8A.M. to 7P.M., and pays her providers in cash.

Her goal is to expand her business and move it to a more comfortable shop. Although her biggest challenge is to find enough resources, today she went to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to apply for a credikiva. This is the first loan she has requested, which she will use to buy toiletries and pottery. Thanks to this, she will expand her catalogue and contribute to increasing sales and improving her benefits with this investment.

loans.use: to  buy buy toiletries and pottery.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed cultured business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings for her seaweed cultured business.

Marivic has been in this business for two years, and she earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 17,500 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 33 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gandhy Vladimir

texts.es: Gandhy tiene 28 años de edad, el vive  con sus padres se encuentra estudiando y necesita el credito para comprar mercaderia y ofrecerla en el negocio que tiene amedias con su padre, comenta Gandhy que pagan arriendo para excivir sus productos y armar las cercas electricas, Gandhy aspira variar mas productos, y asi mejorar su negocio para cubrir los gastos de estudio que implica estar estudiando.
texts.en: Gandhy is 28 years old and lives with his parents. He is studying and he needs a loan to buy merchandise to offer in the business he has with his father. Gandhy comments that they have to pay rent to exhibit their product and assemble the electric fences. Gandhy hopes to increase the variety of products they have, thus improving the business to cover the costs of his studies.

loans.use: to buy electric fences.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed cultured business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her seaweeds cultured business.

Mercy has been in this business for three years; she earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба жительница северного города Худжанд. Худжанд прекрасный город с древней историей и богатой культурой. В Худжанде много талантливых людей. И одна из тех рукодельница Махбуба. Ей 30 лет. У нее двое детей, которым 4 и 1 год. Дети служат ей мотивацией продвижение вперед. 
Махбуба занимается шитьем штор и занавесок, как же она берет заказы. Махбуба надеется получить кредит и купить ткани для штор. Когда у нее будет много материалов, она сможет сшить больше штор и продавать больше товара. Она надеется таким образом увеличить доходность, чтобы обеспечить своих детей.
texts.en:
Mahbuba lives in the northern city of Khujand.  Khujand is a beautiful city with ancient history, a rich culture, and many talented people.  Mahbuba, a seamstress, is one of those talented people.  She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, ages 4 and 1.  Her children are her motivation to always move forward.

Mahbuba sews blinds and curtains and works from orders.  She is hoping to receive a loan in order to buy some fabrics to sew curtains.  Once she has a lot of fabric, she will be able to sew many curtains and sell a large quantity of merchandise.  Her goal is to increase her profitability in order to be able to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, so that she can sew curtains for resale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from Paniqui, Tarlac. She is 40 years old, and married with three children. She works as a housekeeper. And what she earns is not enough for the schooling of her children. 

That’s why she wants to avail a loan to be used for the tuition fee of her son, Mjayrich, who is pictured with her in the photo. 

Mjayrich is 17 years old, and studying Computer Programming at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. He chose this course because he thinks that he can easily get a job with it. 

He wants to finish his studies to help his parents, who are now struggling to send him to school.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fee for her son

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es: Liliana una mujer de 45 años, soñadora y luchadora que desde joven se unió en matrimonió con quien creyó ser el amor de su vida y le entrego sus aspiraciones y sueños de familia a esta persona, por problemas se vieron obligados a separarse y como mujer quedo sola, decidió comenzar una venta de comidas rápidas ha logrado mantenerse y poder ayudarle a su familia, por esto todos los días busca maneras de cómo mejorar su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito para mejorar su carrito de ventas, y surtido buscando siempre superarse y proyectando su negocio como un medio de sostenimiento monetario en el tiempo.
texts.en: Liliana is a 45- year old woman who had big dreams for the future. When she was young she married a man whom she thought would be the love of her life. She told him about her aspirations and dreams. However, there were problems and they had to separate. As a single woman she decided to start selling fast food and she managed to support herself and help her family. She is constantly searching for ways to improve her business and overcome problems so that in the future it will become a good source of income

loans.use: Improve her food stall by buying stock such as bread, serviettes, mortadelas etc.

loans.name: Yanira Lizeth

texts.es: Yanira tiene 29 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres hijos quienes viven con ella en casa propia. Yanira trabaja como empleada en una empresa cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea terminar de construir un cuarto que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y lámina.
texts.en: Yanira is 29 years old and is the single mother of 3 children who live with her in her own house. Yanira works as an employee in a business close to her home which allows her to earn the sustenance for her family. She has taken the decision to request a loan from FUSAI given that she wants to finish construction on a room that for want of financial resources she has not managed to complete. With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand, brick, re-bar and laminate.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, re-bar and laminate to finish building a room.

loans.name: Saney

texts.ru: Саней, 53 года, вдова,есть 5 взрослых и уже самостоятельных детей, один из сыновей живет с Саней и активно помогает по хозяйству. У Саней среднее образование, с 1984 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря целеустремленности, упорству и трудолюбию Саней, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка и 15 овец. Все условия для содержания скота есть, корма и сено заготовлены. Саней продает молочные продукты и фасоль, выращиваемую на собственном участке мерою 3,5 ГА. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саней обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота с целью дальнейшей реализации. Доходы от кредита Саней планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Saney is 53, widowed, and has five adult children who live independently. One of her sons lives with her and helps her with the farm. Saney has a high school education and has been raising livestock and planting crops since 1984. Thanks to her dedication, persistence, and hard work, she currently has a dairy cow, two calves, and 15 sheep. She has everything needed to take care of livestock, including feed and hay. Saney sells dairy products and beans that she grows on her 3.5 hectare plot of land. She earns 7,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Saney applied with the Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 17 Septembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son septième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit comme, accompagné d’activité de maraichage durant l’hivernage.

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons et 01 fille. Elle fait de la transformation de graine d’arachide en huile de production artisanale, qu’elle vend aux ménages du village. Elle a une maîtrise parfaite du travail pour l’avoir effectuer depuis son jeune âge.

Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter une dizaine de sacs d’arachide à 7 500 Fr CFA l’unité pour la transformation. 

Les bénéfices réalisés, lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de scolarisation et sanitaires de ses enfants et ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
[This group] has been created on September 17, 2011 at the launch of its banc villeageois. The group just finished its seventh loan cycle. It is composed of women who live  in the same village, maintain friendly relations among themselves and display a team spirit. They mainly work as vendors, and also grow vegetables during the rainy season.

Mrs. Fatou (the one standing on the far right raising her left hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of four: three boys and one girs. She makes peanut oil by hand for sale to households in the village. She knows this work perfectly as she has been doing it since a young age.Her new loan will allow her to buy a dozen bags of peanuts at 7,500 West African francs, to be  processed into peanut oil.
Her revenues will allow her to cover the school fees and healthcare expenses for her children as well as her own needs.

loans.use: to buy a dozen bags of peanuts at 7,500 West African francs, for making peanut oil.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio en el mercado y vende refrescos naturales y helados,  ambos son los responsable de la manutención de sus 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando.

Él es comerciante, vende productos desechables en las unidades de transporte colectivo de la zona, también vende agua, jugos, sodas. Desde los 20 años se dedica a esta actividad, la falta de oportunidades de trabajo lo llevó a tomar medidas inmediatas para poder aportar ingresos al hogar, anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura,  no tiene más actividades económicas a las que se dedique, el lugar donde vende está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y el recorrido lo hace a pie, trabaja de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar mercadería para su negocio, entre lo que comprará esta: fardos de agua, soda, jugos, y bolsas de dulces que también comercializa en su trabajo. La mejora que el préstamo hará es el la oportunidad de poder comprar mercadería al por mayor, y con esto ahorrase unos dólares.

Él sueña con seguir trabajando, ya que con esto mantiene sano su cuerpo y mente, que sus hijos puedan aprender de él y que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
52- year old Luis has a grade 5 education and is married. His wife runs a market stall selling natural juices and ice cream. They are raising three children who are students.

Luis has a business selling recyclable items from the public transport buses as well as water, juice, soft drinks etc. He's been doing this work since he was 20. There were no other work opportunities at the time and he had to take immediate measures to earn money for the household. Before that he worked in agriculture. He has no other source of income.

The place where Luis works is one kilometre from his house and he there on foot. He works from 7am to 4 pm. He plans to use the loan money to buy more goods for his business such as boxes of water, soft drinks, juices, and also bags of candy to sell. The best part about the loan is his ability to buy at wholesale prices and save money.

Luis's dream is to continue with his business so that he can maintain a healthy body and mind. He also wants his children to learn from his mistakes and carry on studying.

loans.use: Buy stock such as boxes of water, soft drinks, juices, and bags of candy

loans.name: Juana Elisia

texts.es:
Juana tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, sus hijos viven en casa y se encuentran estudiando. 


Ella es ama de casa, pero además se dedica a engordar cerdos para luego venderlos, también cuida pollos, es una mujer luchadora, que a pesar de las pocas oportunidades en la zona ella siempre se esfuerza para salir adelante y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.


Juana solicita este crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que solo hace falta que la repellen y que le pongan las puerta, además pagará la mano de obra.
	

Sus sueños a futuro son trabajar siempre para sostener a su familia, y espera que sus hijos crezcan siendo personas de bien.
texts.en:
Juana is 34 years old and studied up to Grade 3. She is married and her spouse works in agriculture. Her children live with her and are studying. She is a housewife but she also fattens pigs to sell them and raises chickens. She is a fighter. Despite the few opportunities in her area she always makes the effort to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses. Juana is requesting this loan to finish the construction of her house. All that needs to be done is the plastering and to hang the doors and to pay for labor. Her dreams for the future are to be able to continue working to support her family and hope that her children grow up to be good people.





Ella es ama de casa, pero además se dedica a engordar cerdos para luego venderlos, también cuida pollos, es una mujer luchadora, que a pesar de las pocas oportunidades en la zona ella siempre se esfuerza para salir adelante y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.





Juana solicita este crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que solo hace falta que la repellen y que le pongan las puerta, además pagará la mano de obra.





Sus sueños a futuro son trabajar siempre para sostener a su familia, y espera que sus hijos crezcan siendo personas de bien.

loans.use: to complete building her house.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su compañero de vid ay sus hijos. María tiene 5 años de trabajar en una empresa cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite apoyar con la economía del hogar. María solicita este crédito a FUSA para invertir en la construcción de cuarto dormitorio para el cual necesita materiales como ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, grava, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en: María is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion and her children. She has been working in a company for 5 years that is close to her home. This allows her to support the household economy. María is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bedroom. She needs materials like brick, cement, sand, re-bar, gravel, etc. She hopes to get this loan and be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, re-bar, gravel, etc to construct a bedroom.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador tiene 62 años de edad y es un hombre muy trabajador quien se dedica al cultivo y venta de hortalizas desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene la economía del hogar. Salvador ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un muro de contención para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacerlo.
texts.en: Salvador is 62 years old and is a hard-working man who has been growing and selling vegetables for a long time. This is how he earns his living and supports the household economy. Salvador has taken the decision to request a loan from FUSAI given that he wants to construct a retaining wall. So he needs to buy materials like cement, sand, bricks, re-bar, etc. He hopes to be able to count on this loan as he does not have the financial resources to do this.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, re-bar etc. to construct a retaining wall.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn, a 49-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a general store in the Philippines for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and poultry.

Emelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a new one for PHP 12000 to purchase more groceries to sell. 

Emelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josefina works hard to support her family. She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing. 

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She is requesting a new one for PHP 14000 in order to buy additional sugar, powdered milk and other ingredients for her cafeteria business.

Josefina hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional sugar, powdered milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Delia De Jesús

texts.es:
Delia tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, la falta de motivación y le necesidad en la que se vivía en ese entonces no le permitieron seguir la escuela, está casada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 20  años, tiene cuatro hijos, los tres más grandes van a la escuela y viven con ellos, y son los únicos que dependen de Delia.


Ella es ama de casa, pero también también se dedica a la agricultura, desde pequeña su padre la llevaba a los cultivos ya que no habían hermanos varones grandes para que le ayudaran, la parcela donde trabaja la tiene a un kilómetro de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, un hermano es el que mas se involucra ya que trabajan juntos en un horario de 6 am a 12 md. 


El préstamo será invertido para la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra.
  
Su sueño es tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Delia, age 38, went to school through the second grade.  The lack of motivation and the needs that she experienced at that time did not allow her to go to continue going to school.  She is married, and her life partner has been working in agriculture for 20 years.  She has four children.  The three oldest go to school and live with them.  They are the only ones who are dependent upon Delia.

She is a housewife.  She has also been working in agriculture since she was little and her father took her to the crops.  This is because they were no big brothers to help them.  The land where she works is one kilometer from her house.  She gets there by foot.  A brother is the one who is most involved, and they work together from six in the morning until twelve noon.

The loan will be invested in preparing the land for planting.  Her dream is to first have what the family most needs.  Therefore, she hopes to always work as long as God gifts her with good health and life.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia  tiene la edad de 49 años, está casada y vive con el esposo actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Virginia is 49 years old, is married and lives with her husband. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer and care for the coffee plantation she wishes to start. She wants to give the plants proper maintenance which would allow for a higher production and lead to greater financial return. She hopes in the future to provide her family with a higher standard of living and more economic stability. She wants to grow as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had a loan from the state banks and FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better conditions and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: María Nereida

texts.es:
