María tiene 43 años de edad, tiene séptimo grado de nivel académico, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de albañil, tiene 5 hijos en esta relación los cuales tres viven con ella y los otros dos están trabajando y viven en hogares aparte.


María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, tiene 9 años de poseer este negocio con el cual le ha dado el estudio a dos de sus hijos que ya son bachilleres, este oficio se lo enseñó su madre ya que ella se dedicaba a lo mismo, además vende tamales cuando le encargan para eventos. María trabaja en una jornada de 10 am a 3pm.


Ella necesita el crédito para invertir en la compra de dos sacos de maíz para seguir con la venta de tortillas.

Su sueño es tener una tortillería muy grande y muy reconocida, y lograr que su hija menor estudie en la universidad.
texts.en:
María, age 43, has a seventh grade education.  She is in a relationship, and her life partner works as a bricklayer.  They have five children.  Three of the children live with her, and the others two are working and live in separate households.

María makes and sells tortillas.  She has had this business for nine years.  Her mother taught her this trade because her mother did the same thing.  She also sells tamales when they are ordered for events.  María works a schedule of 10 a.m. until 3 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy two sacks of corn in order to continue with the tortilla sales.

Her dream is to have a large and very well-known tortilla business.  She also dreams of managing for her youngest daughter to go to the university.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn in order to continue with the tortilla sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his water-cleaning machines

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.ru: Норинисо жительница сельской местности, который находится далеко от города. Она имеет большой опыт в сфере животноводства. Ее отец занимался животноводством и Норинисо с детства помогала отцу ухаживать за скотом. В детстве отец подарил Норинисо одного барашка и она ухаживала за ним. Сейчас Норинисо выросла, у нее есть своя семья но любовь к животным у нее осталась и она продолжает разводить баранов. Как говорит сама Норинисо: "Я всегда мечтала пойти по стопам отца и заниматься животноводством". Благодаря  своему опыту и знанию этого бизнеса Норинисо увеличила поголовье своего скота от 2 голов до 35 голов. Вся семья Норинисо помогают ей в этом бизнесе и поддерживают ее в ее начинаниях. Муж Норинисо работает частным строителем на стройках по найму и по сезону ездит в Россию на заработки как и все мужчины с их села. Сама же Норинисо выходит на поле наемной рабочей и занимается поливными работами по сезону. Деньги которые они зарабатывают не хватают на то чтоб обеспечить их семью и основным источником дохода является животноводство. На данный момент в связи с сезонностью цены упали на скот и Норинисо не может продать своих баранов не нанося ущерб своему бизнесу. Норинисо обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за поддержкой ее бизнеса. На полученный кредит она планирует купить скот и корм для скота. Норинисо выражает огромную благодарность ООО МДО "Арванд" за содействие и огромную роль в ее жизни и бизнесе.
texts.en:
Noriniso lives in the countryside, far from any major city.  She has extensive experience in the field of animal husbandry.  Her father used to be involved in the same activity, and Noriniso learned to take care of livestock while helping her father, at a very young age.  When Noriniso was still a child, her father gave her a lamb to take care of.  Noriniso is now a woman with her own family, but her love of animals has remained the same and, to this day, she still raises sheep.  She says that "her dream has always been to follow in her father's footsteps and to raise her own livestock".  Thanks to her experience and good knowledge of the business, she has, over the years, increased her herd from 2 head of livestock to 35.  Her entire family helps her with the farming business and supports her in all her endeavors.

Like all the men in the village, Noriniso's husband works as a day laborer/builder on construction sites and often travels to Russia for a season to find employment.  Noriniso herself also works as a day laborer in agriculture and works on irrigation projects for a season.  Their combined incomes are not sufficient to provide for their family, and their main source of income actually comes from animal husbandry.   At the moment, given the fact that sheep prices are very low, Noriniso cannot sell any of her livestock without negative consequences for her business.  For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand and asked them to support their business.  She plans to use her loan to buy livestock and animal feed.  Noriniso wishes to expresses her gratitude towards MDO Arvand (LLC) and thanks them for their support and for the huge positive impact they are having on her family's life and business.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 26 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace algunos años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas cerdos, concentrados y vitaminas para seguir con la crianza y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The borrower, age 26, lives in her own home with her husband. She has worked raising pigs for a few years, and with what she earns she is able to meet some of the household expenses.  She requests a loan to buy more pigs, feed, and vitamins, to continue pig raising and be able to earn more money so she and her husband can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza, who lives with her family in  north Tajikistan, is married and bringing up a daughter. Shahnoza's  husband is a migrant in Russia, while she sews national women’s dresses, providing services to her clients in her house, where she has a workshop. Shahnoza uses her income to buy food items and clothes for herself and her daughter. 

Shanoza wants to repair her house, which is in bad condition. She is therefore requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. A repeat and very responsible client of IMON, she awaits your mercy

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc.

loans.name: Celestino Ferdinand

texts.en:
Celestino Ferdinand is 49 years of age, married, and blessed with four children. They are harmoniously residing in the village of Pulay. His wife manages a retail store, while he is working at the private hospital as a radiology technician. Being a father is not easy for him, but he wants to give a better and bright future to their children, that's why he's asking for a loan amounting to Php 20,000 to pay for the books and uniforms of Rochelle Anne. 

His daughter, Rochelle Anne, is taking up BS Accountancy at Our Lady of Pillar College in Cauayan City, Isabela. According to her, she choose the said course because accounting and financial matters is her forte. Rochelle Anne wants to achieve her dream to become a certified public accountant someday, thus she is hopeful that lenders will grant her father's request.

loans.use: to pay for the books and uniforms for Rochelle Anne.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 49  años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
José, age 49, is an enterprising man.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and two children.  He requested a loan because he wants to buy supplies like fertilizers and fumigants.  He wishes to provide care to his coffee crops.  He wants to keep them in good condition as they develop in order to get a good quality product.

The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of money to continue growing.  They depend upon this financial activity in order to be able to get ahead.  Therefore, he is making this request for a loan.  It is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He does not have other loans in state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the easiest terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Mercy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
Hermie is 40 years old and married with three children.

Hermie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Hermie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Hermie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. Merlita has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

Merlita has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris, una mujer emprendedora,  tiene la edad de 48 años, está casada y vive con el esposo. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y además  abono y fumigaciones y dar asistencia a una plantación de café. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Damaris, an entrepreneurial woman, is 48 years old and married. She lives with her husband. She would like this loan to buy coffee seeds, as well as fertilizer and crop spray for tending to her coffee plantation. She wants to take good care of her crop so that she can have greater production and then have more economic resources. In the future, she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and in her business. This is the first loan that Damaris has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with the most convenience and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es:
Al entrar a la pequeña pulpería de Elena, aparte de encontrar los productos necesarios para el hogar, te recibe un ambiente cálido y agradable, en el cual siempre te sentirás a gusto al realizar tus compras. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo. Desde hace diez años ha luchado por sacar adelante su pequeño negocio, su esposo ha sido un factor importante puesto que juntos han logrado superar varios obstáculos.  
Elena solicita un crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos tales como arroz y frijoles; asimismo, azúcar, aceite, condimentos, golosinas, productos lácteos, entre otros. Ella está muy agradecida con el prestamo, por lo tanto le deposita su confianza, ya que anhela brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, salud y educación de calidad. Por lo tanto espera cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo elevar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Upon entering Elena's small grocery store, apart from finding the necessary household items, you find a warm and friendly environment in which you are comfortable shopping. Elena is 36 years old and married, with one child. For the past ten years she has worked to succeed in her own small business; her husband has been an important factor since, together, they have been able to overcome many obstacles. 



Elena requests a loan to increase her production of capital. She needs to buy basic goods like rice and beans, as well as sugar, oil, condiments, sweets, and dairy products, among others. She is very appreciative of the loan, and she trusts in it, since she hopes to offer her family better living conditions, health, and quality education. That is why she hopes to meet the demand of her customers and, at the same time, increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy basic goods like rice and beans, as well as sugar, oil, condiments, sweets, and dairy products, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hija en casa propia, el posee una panadería en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años  en donde elabora pan francés, comercializa sus productos en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela establecida,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de harina de pan, levadura, etc. Para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This borrower is 26 years old and he lives with his wife and daughter in his own house. He has been running his own bakery for many years, and it is located in his house. He prepares French bread and sells his products to the different neighborhood  close to his house. He has many fixed customers, and he succeeds in paying for his household expenses thanks to his earnings. He is requesting a loan to buy flour, yeast and other ingredients, in order to offer his family a high quality standard of living with practically no restrictions.

loans.use: To buy flour and yeast.

loans.name: Ledi

texts.en:
Ledi is a 34-year-old married woman from the village of Tkviavi. She has a husband, daughter, son and a mother-in-law who gets a pension from the local government. The family generates income from only small agricultural land cultivation - particularly Ledi seeds beans seasonally and sells them to the local market. The income is insignificant for five family members and they live in poverty. That's why Ledi gets social assistance from the local government. 

Because of this, she requested a loan in order to create a source of significant income and improve the living conditions of her family. The family owns a special tractor for cultivation, which requires repair and some parts to buy. After this Ledi will rent it to nearby villagers for private orders. Seasonally, the family will get a very important source of income with the help of this new activity. 

Ledi and her family rely on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help as it will be a great support for the family's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase all needed parts for her tractor and rent it for private orders

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Нигина замужняя девушка в возрасте 27 лет. Ее муж иммигрант в Российской Федерации. Нигина живет в северном городке Худжанд вместе с трехлетним сыном и сестрой. 
   Нигина три года назад научилась шить и кроить женские платья. Такое умение дало ей источник дохода. Она начала брать заказы на шитье женской одежды на дому. Нигине нравиться проводить время за швейной машинкой, потому что любит свою работу и зарабатывает честным трудом. 
  На сегодняшний день швейная машинка Нигины не работает также хорошо как прежде и она решила купить новую машинку, чтобы не тормозить работу. Поддержите Нигину в совершении покупки, чтобы она не потеряла источник дохода.
texts.en: Nigina is a married, 27-year-old woman. Her husband is an immigrant in the Russian Federation. Nigina lives in a northern city of Khujand together with her three-year-old son and sister. Nigina learned how to cut and sew women's dresses three years ago. This ability provided her with a source of income. She started to accept orders for sewing women's clothing at home. Nigina likes to spend time at the sewing machine because she loves her work and earns an honest living. Today, Nigina's sewing machine is not working as well as it used to, and she decided to purchase a new machine in order not to slow down work. Support Nigina in making this purchase, so that she does not lose her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine in order to keep her source of income

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 56 years old and widowed with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of making nipa roofing in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase nipa leaves, bamboo, etc. for her business.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business of making nipa roofing for 34 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Milagros aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase nipa leaves, bamboo, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a grazing unit.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет в Павлограде, она замужем, у нее две взрослые дочери. Наталья торгует на местном центральном рынке спортивным трикотажем. У нее 2 собственные торговые точки, опыт работы — 17 лет. 
Наталье для закупки товара к реализации перед школьным сезоном нужна сумма в 10 000 гривен. Она планирует приобрести спортивные костюмы, футболки, толстовки, спортивные брюки. Опыт работы и налаженный бизнес свидетельствуют об ответственном отношении и преданности Натальи к ведению своего дела.
texts.en: Nataliya lives in Pavlograd. She is married and has two adult daughters. Nataliya sells athletic knitwear at the local central market. She owns two retail outlets and has 17 years of work experience. Nataliya needs a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase merchandise for sale prior to the upcoming school season. She plans to purchase athletic suits, t-shirts, sweatshirts and pants. Her work experience and stable business show Nataliya's level of responsibility and commitment to running her business.

loans.use: to purchase sportswear, t-shirts and sweatshirts

loans.name: Ozodamo

texts.ru:
Девушку на фотографии зовут Озодамо. Она очень милая, трудолюбивая, ответственная и аккуратная в работе девушка. Ей 21 год. Она живет на  районе Вахш, вместе с мамой и сестрой. Озодамо портниха и ее заработок важный источник дохода в семью. Она любит свою работу и старается научиться всем тонкостям своей профессии. В этой сфере деятельности она уже 2 года.
   Причина, по которой она обратилась за кредитом, является необходимый ремонт дома. Ей не хватает денег, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Их жилплощадь срочно нуждается в ремонте и Озодамо просит кредит, с надеждой на то, что ее поддержат.
texts.en: The name of the young woman on the photograph is Ozodamo. She is a very cute, hardworking, responsible and accurate in work young woman. She is 21 years old. She lives in the Vakhsh district with her mother and sister. Ozodamo is a seamstress, and her earnings provide an important source of income for the family. She loves her work and tries to learn all of the nuances of her trade. She has been in this business for 2 years. Necessary house repair is the reason why she requested this loan. She does not have enough money to repair her house. Her living space urgently needs repairs, and Ozodamo is requesting this loan with the hope that she would be supported.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Mayla

texts.en:
Mayla is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school.

Mayla grows sugarcane in the Philippines and requested 28,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mayla has been farming sugarcane for 25 years and has previously borrowed 26 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mayla would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 39 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Marife is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Marife has been raising chickens for four years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 50-year-old widow with four children. Marilou has managed a retail store in her village for two months. Being a single mother is a very challenging role for her and she works hard to earn income to pay for educating her children. She wants her children to finish their education, but due to insufficient funds, she requests 15,000 PHP to pay for her son's room and board.

Her son, Pedro Jr., wants to earn a BS degree at Isabela State University. He chose this course because he wants to start a business that is salable, and he wants to become involved in industry.

loans.use: to pay for room and board costs.

loans.name: Konul

texts.en:
Konul is a 48-year-old mother of a daughter and a son. Her husband is a driver. Konul has been earning money from farming for 20 years and has gained good skills. She raises crops and seasonal fruit trees (quince, persimmon, etc.), earning a  monthly income of 200AZN. Quince and persimmon are  delicious and useful fruits, especially when consumed fresh. People also use them in preparing jams and juice. Konul earns additional income raising hens and cocks. 

Konul has applied for a 1500AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers and garden tools. She plans to increase her income so as to be able to repair and enhance her house in the future. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and garden tools

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est l’un des plus expérimentés du système et groupe en son sein des femmes qui ont une grande maîtrise du programme. La cohabitation durant des années a pu souder les liens qui sont caractérisés. Ayant  un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois, elles ont su développer un esprit de solidarité de groupe leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Marème (assise  à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. C’est une des femmes socle du groupement de par son dynamisme, son bon sens et sa capacité à accompagner les nouvelles adhésions à maintenir viable  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elle est vendeuse de tissus et divers articles de mercerie. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 04 garçons et 02 filles. Elle maîtrise à merveille son activité pour l’avoir pratiquer pendant plus de 15 ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter diverses variétés de tissus par coupon de 06 yards pour la revente durant les fêtes.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte soutenir son mari  à la retraite dans la gestion quotidienne des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois is one of the most experienced in the lending scheme, bringing together women who have worked a long time within this framework. Years of co-habitation have solidified the bonds which characterise this group. Having accumulated a lot of time with the banc villageois programmes, they have learned to develop a spirit of group solidarity, which now allows them to face up to many situations. Their main businesses involve small-scale retail.

Mareme (the woman sat on the right with her hand raised) is the group's star lender. She is one of the group's core members thanks to her dynamic personality, her good sense and her capacity to guide new members into creating viable revenue-generating businesses. She sells fabrics and various dry goods. She is a married mother to six children: four boys and two girls. She has gained a certain mastery over her business through having practised it for over 15 years.

With this new loan, she is planning on purchasing several six-yard cuts of a variety of fabrics which will be resold during celebrations.

With the profits, she is planning on supporting her retired husband in paying for their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase several six-yard cuts of a variety of fabrics which will be resold during celebrations

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a 60-year-old married man who has been blessed with six children.  His wife adds additional income to support the well being of their family.   He has operated a farming business for the past twenty years and earns 10,000 KES every month.

Cleophas was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Neighbor and requests his first loan of 15,000 KES  to buy  farm supplies and fertilizer.

Cleophas plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and hopes to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy  farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dramane

texts.en:
Dramane is fifty years old, married, and the father of six children. He lives in Bananzole village, located in southern Mali. Dramane is a farmer and chicken breeder. He grows corn, sorghum, peanuts, and beans. His dream is to  ensure that his family has enough to eat and that all their needs are met. 
Dramane thinks he can realize this dream with a loan from Kiva. With a loan he will purchase a precision planter, which is a machine that plants seed and fertilizer at the correct depth and distance to increase farm yields. With a precision planter, Dramane can plant his land faster and ensure that he follows a modern agricultural method. By using the precision planter, he will no longer have to hire people to help him plant his fields by hand and will be able to increase his harvest, which means more food for his family. The precision planter will help him realize his dream of being able to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a precision planter machine

loans.name: Seydou

texts.en:
Seydou is forty-nine years old, married, and the father of five children. He lives in Dongorona village in southern Mali. He is a farmer and grows corn, sorghum, peanuts, and cotton.
With a Kiva loan, Seydou wants to buy a semoir, which is a piece of farming equipment that plants seed and fertilizer. Currently, Seydou plants his land by hand and has to hire people to help to help him plant. Hiring workers is a large cost for Seydou every year. With a semoir, Seydou will be able to dramatically reduce the amount of time it takes to plant his land. This means that he will no longer have to pay people to work in his field, saving him money.  He also believes the semoir will enable him to better fertilize his field, which will result in a larger harvest.

loans.use: To buy a semoir seeding machine

loans.name: Mabaye

texts.en:
Mabaye is fifty-one years old and is married with five children. Mabaye lives in Marako village in southern Mali. He is a farmer and grows corn, millet, okra, peanuts, beans, peppers, and cucumbers. 
With a loan from Kiva, Mabaye will be able to buy a semoir. A semoir is a piece of farm equipment, which plants seed and fertilizer following a micro-dosing method. Through using the semoir, which follows this modern agricultural method, Mabaye will be able to increase his harvest and decrease the amount of time it takes him to plant his field. He is hopeful that with the semoir, he will be able to increase his family’s food security.

loans.use: To purchase a semoir

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara is 40 years, and she knows everything about farming. She also knows that seasonal vegetables aren’t as profitable as she would like. But unfortunately, she cannot raise other kinds of vegetables because of the cold climate in her region. People have high demand for fresh vegetables, especially greens, because they are very useful for health reasons. People also use greens to prepare such national dishes as green qutab, dovgha, doghramaj, etc.

Dilara ’s income is not enough for her to cover her family’s demands. She decided to build a greenhouse for her vegetables, and buy additional vegetable seeds. That’s why she applied for a 1500 AZN loan from the credit union. 

She believes that this will help her to increase her income, and will enable her to escape money debts in the future

loans.use: to build a greenhouse for her vegetables and to buy additional vegetable seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, poultry and pigs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 38-year-old married woman who supports a family of four children.  Samson, her husband, adds an additional income to cater to their daily needs.  Florence has been operating a  cereals stall for a period of 14 years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Florence is now servicing her third loan of KES. 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya; she intends to use this amount to build a conducive permanent cereals stall.  

She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children, and hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to build a conducive permanent cereal stall to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet David. 

David is a smallholder farmer based in Molo, which is a small rural agricultural town in South Rift area of Kenya. He owns a small plot of land where he is based with his family of three children. He also keeps poultry and dairy cattle. For the last six years, David has been selling milk and eggs to make a decent living. 

David is particularly passionate about poultry! He has dreams of being a renowned poultry farmer. However, lack of capital for expansion and poor roads leading to market are the key challenges David has to deal with. 

David is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle. In the rural areas of Kenya with poor road networks, opportunistic farmers capitalize on Indian and Chinese motorcycles ("boda boda") to offer transportation. These shuttle services are the only way of getting around and transporting goods in the area.

Your lending towards this loan will help David cut down on transportation costs, which has been his highest expense for a very long time. Coming from a village where many roads are impassable by vehicles, the boda boda will provide a cheap, versatile, quick, and reliable form of transportation over short and medium distances.

Acquisition of this asset will enable him to increase his income, save more and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to cut down on his transportation costs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over five years she has operated a water selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season.

With the loan, she wants to purchase water pipes and to repair a leaking tap. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and to repair a leaking tap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Rex has engaged in a Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) retailing business in his community for almost two years now. He is 26 years of age, and blessed with children. His wife, Janice, helps him in their business and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

What he basically does is buy LPG tanks from wholesalers, and sells them by the tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business.  

Rex dreams that his business will be more profitable, and hopes that it will continue to flourish and help them in their everyday expenses. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and he also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Durdana

texts.en:
Durdana is 59 years old; she is a widow and has three daughters and two sons. 

Durdana raises and sells seasonal vegetables such as pumpkins, cucumbers, potatoes, and so on. She has been raising and selling them at the local bazaar for 24 years, and has good experience in this area. Her monthly income is 200 AZN.

Vegetables are in high demand in Azerbaijan because people like to use them for fresh salads and delicious national dishes. They go to local groceries and buy fresh and tasty vegetables. They know that vegetables raised in private gardens are always fresh and without pesticides.

Durdana needs money to cover family’s demands. She applied for 1300 AZN in order to buy quality fertilizer,  which will increase her harvest and income.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizer.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna was born in 1993. She is not married and she lives with her parents. 

Maftuna is a young and ambitious woman. She is going to organize a new business with sewing and, in this way, get ahead. She can sew women's and national women's dresses. 

She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ at a women's organization. She got a certificate and a lot of new information about organizing and managing a business. She will serve as a sewer in her house. 

Maftuna is asking for a loan of TJS 1,400 (somoni) to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, and other items needed to organize her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, and other items needed to organize her new business.

loans.name: Zahooran

texts.en: Forty-seven-year-old Zahooran runs a small general store in her town, along with her husband. Zahooran and her husband have been successfully running this small shop for the past three years. The income from this shop helps to support their family, consisting of four children. Due to the increasing demands of customers, Zahooran has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she is going to use to purchase juice, sweets, cakes, biscuits, chips, custard, shampoo, etc. Zahooran hopes to increase the capacity of her shop in the future. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase  juice, sweets, cakes, biscuits, chips, custard, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 26 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermano, ella es empleada de una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: arena, cemento, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra y hacer un muro perimetral para que ella y su familia puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
The borrower is 26 years old, she lives in her own home with her mother and brother and she works at a private company. Her earnings from work allow her to afford some household expenses. 

She wants to improve her home, but she does not make enough money to be able to achieve this goal. This is why she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral, to be able to buy the necessary materials such as: sand, cement, bricks, iron and to pay for labor costs in addition to building a perimeter wall so that she and her family can live comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, iron and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Estelle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est l’un des plus expérimentés du système et groupe en son sein des femmes qui ont une grande maîtrise du programme. La cohabitation durant des années a pu souder les liens qui sont caractérisés. Ayant  un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois, elles ont su développer un esprit de solidarité de groupe leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Estelle (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons et 02 filles. Son commerce  consiste à l’achat et à la revente d’huile de palme, de jus de citron et tiges de palmiste séchées pour servir de balaie. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine puisse que la pratiquant depuis plus de 6 ans. 

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 05 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme, deux lots de balaie et un bidon de 20 litres de jus de citron pour la revente. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de participer à la dépense quotidienne et de prendre en charge une partie de la scolarité de ses enfants pour la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
This banc villageois is one of the most experienced in the lending scheme, bringing together women who have worked for a long time within this framework. Years of co-habitation have solidified the bonds which characterise this group. Having accumulated a lot of time within the banc villageois programmes, they have learned to develop a spirit of group solidarity, which now allows them to face up to many situations. Their main businesses involve small-scale retail.

Estelle (the woman standing to the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group's star lender. She is a 39-year-old married mother to four children: two boys and two girls. Her business consists of buying and reselling palm oil, lemon juice and dried palm stalks which can be used as brooms. She has a lot of experience in this field through having practised it for over six years.

With this loan, she is planning on purchasing five 20-litre containers of palm oil, two bundles of brooms and one 20-litre container of lemon juice, which will be resold. The profits from this activity will allow her to contribute to her family's daily living expenses. Part of these earnings will also go towards her children's school fees for the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase five 20-litre containers of palm oil, two bundles of brooms and one 20-litre container of lemon juice, which will be resold

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. She graduated from the piano department of Kapan State Art College. For ten years she worked at the city art school as a musician and now she works at the kindergarten. Armine is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband works for the rescue service as a rescuer. 

After work, she and her husband are engaged in farming. On her farm Armine has three cows, two calves and two heifers. From her farm she sells a great range of dairy products and meat. She also has a plot of land on which she cultivates potatoes, beans and beets. 

Armine hopes to get this loan in order to buy meadow for her cattle and diesel fuel for land cultivation activities

loans.use: to buy meadow for her cattle and diesel fuel for land cultivation activities

loans.name: José Rosalvo

texts.es:
José tiene 68 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado y procrearon 10 hijos de los cuales ninguno vive con ellos porque ya todos tienes sus propios hogares, su esposa no trabaja solamente se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y en casa de José solo vive su esposa y 4 nietas.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 50 años, anteriormente trabajaba en las algodoneras pero después vio mas rentable cultivar maíz y frijol, esto lo aprendió de su padre, algunos  de sus hijos le ayudan cuando pueden, el terreno donde él cultiva le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos de su casa por lo que se traslada caminando.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar 2 sacos de abono, insecticidas, y otro tipo de abonos que necesita para poder darle mantenimiento a la siembra. Con el préstamo él se verá beneficiado de gran manera ya que sus ilusiones son poder seguir cultivando para que a su familia no le falte nada.


Sus sueños son que Dios le permita gozar de buena salud para poder trabajar siempre y así darle a su familia el alimento diario, y que en un futuro puedan sus nietas defenderse en la vida sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Jose is 68 years old and didn’t have the opportunity to go to school.  He is married and has 10 children, none of whom live with him because the all have their own homes now.  His wife doesn’t work and only cares for the home because only she and Jose live there with their four granddaughters.

Jose is a farmer and has been for 50 years.  He used to work in the cotton industry but he saw that raising corn and beans was more profitable.  He learned this trade from his father and some of his children help him when they can.  The land he raises on is located 10km from his house and he travels there on foot.

He needs this loan to buy two sacks of compost, insecticide, and other types of fertilizer that he needs to maintain his crops.  This loan will be of great help to him because he wants to be able to continue raising crops so that his family wants for nothing.

His dreams are for God to allow him to be healthy so he can work and always provide daily food for his family and for his granddaughters to be able to care for themselves in life with no inconveniences.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mahtab

texts.en:
Mahtab is 50 years old and married, with five children. She has been using her skills in embroidery work to provide for her family for the past 30 years. In the initial years she struggled to make enough profit to cover her expenses. However, today she is very popular around her town for her excellent designs. 

Mahtab is in her fourth loan cycle with good credibility. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase the latest embroidery machine. She says that to meet the increasing demand for her embroidered cloth, she requires a machine with greater capacity and better technology. She hopes that her business prospers in the coming years and she is able to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase the latest embroidery machine.

loans.name: Velma

texts.en:
Velma is 33 years old and married to Jacob, who is a businessman, and they are blessed with two children, aged nine and three years. Velma has run a local money transfer business known as MPESA for the last three years and earns an income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).
	
Velma is now requesting her third loan of 40,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and she intends to use this loan amount to increase her float for the MPESA. She repaid her previous loans successfully.

The profit she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and own another MPESA location.

loans.use: to increase her float for her money transfer business

loans.name: Zerqa

texts.en:
Zerqa is a happily married woman. Six years ago, she decided to support her family by starting to stitch clothes at her home. Her husband, who is a driver, has an income that was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Zerqa is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 40,000. She is in her fourth loan cycle. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth. 

Zerqa hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth.

loans.name: Jose Sacarias

texts.es:
El señor José un hombre luchador de 54 años el mantiene una sólida relación de casado de la misma tienen 6 hijos el mayor de ellos tiene 27 años y el ultimo 11 años la esposa no trabaja ella le ayuda en el negocio, el como muchos agricultores de la zona se dedican a la producción de cerdos gracias a este negocio y a otros que se realiza en la finca pudo salir adelante y ayudar a la preparación de sus hijos en la finca diariamente trabajan unas 8 horas, aprendió de este negocio en su niñez junto con los padres 
El señor José vive y tiene el negocio en el recinto 10 de agosto un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora este recinto es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de gran variedad de flora y fauna silvestre 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en una plantación de naranjilla, con esta inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y mejorara su nivel de vida, el señor José agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Sr. José, age 54, is a determined man who maintains a solid marriage. He has six children who range in age from 27 to 11. His wife does not work, but helps out with the business. Like many farmers in the area, they raise pigs. Thanks to this business and others that they manage on their farm, they have been able to move forward and help their children become prepared. They work around eight hours a day on the farm. José learned about this business from his parents when he was a child.

José lives and manages his business in the August 10th precinct, a place that experiences a warm and humid climate. It is full of friendly and hardworking people. This area is frequented by both domestic and foreign tourists so that they can enjoy the wide variety of native plants and animals.

José is requesting this loan so that he can invest in a naranjilla plantation. With this investment, he will be able to improve his finances and his standard of living. He is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support they have given.

loans.use: to extend his farm for planting naranjilla.

loans.name: Zaharan

texts.en:
Fifty-nine-year-old Zaharan is happily married with six children. She has been involved in the business of purchasing and selling cattle for many years. She and her husband purchase cattle from their town and sell it in the market in other areas. This business has provided a decent living for her family. 

Zaharan has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more cattle to resell in other markets. She believes that this loan will help her to further expand her business and generate more income. She dreams of providing a beautiful life, with good health, food and clothing, to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee en su lugar de residencia una tienda, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  la clienta quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar hierro, cemento, ladrillos, arena y pago de mano de obra para construir unos cuartos y asi poder vivir junto con su familia mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: This borrower is 27 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and two children. She has a store in her home. With the money she earns from her sales, she manages to cover her household expenses. She would like to improve her home, but her earnings are not enough to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy iron, cement, bricks, and sand as well as to pay workers to construct some rooms. She will then be able to live more comfortably and safely with her family.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, bricks, and sand, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat has been stitching clothes at her home for the last 12 years. She has great skill at sewing clothes and is approached by a large number of customers from nearby areas. Most of the income she generates from her work is utilized to meet the expenses of her house and children. Due to a lack of funds for business expenditures, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to buy spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons. She believes that this loan will provide her with a means of increasing revenue.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors, laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en: Hajiran is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a business trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has good credibility. Hajiran requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to stock cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through higher sales. She hopes to grow her business with this loan. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her efforts in her business.

loans.use: to stock cloth for the summer season

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, tiene la edad de 42  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y un  hijo actualmente. El quiere comprar  almacigo para la resiembra de su cafetal y también algunos insumos. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es resembrar las zonas más dañadas para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como un caficultor de la zona. El pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roberto is 42 years old, married and is currently living with his wife and one son. He wants to buy some supplies as well as copperwood trees to be replanted in his coffee plantation. 

He relies on his land, so he would like to replant the most damaged areas, which will increase the next harvest and he can grow as a coffee farmer in the area. He hopes that these improvements will generate a better production of coffee beans and will also help him earn more money to continue on with his project and improve his well-being. 

It is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously had loans from government-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with greater ease and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer and fumigants.

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 55 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos pero solo dos viven en casa con Blanca.


Ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche y queso, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante muchos años, el trabajo lo aprendió sola ya que no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia. Ella vende en los municipios mas cercanos y lo hace en un horario aproximado de 5 horas al día.


El préstamo será invertido para comprar los insumos para mejorar la venta de  queso. Es decir que comprara leche por mayor para poder hacer  más quesos y tener una mejor venta e ingresos y así mejorar su negocio. 

Sus sueños son poner un puesto de venta fijo, de manera que ya no lo distribuya de casa en casa como lo hace hasta hoy, ya que por su edad se cansa demasiado rápido.
texts.en:
Blanca, 55, studied up to the third grade of primary school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has three children, but only two of them live at home with her.

She has a business selling milk and cheese. She has had this business activity for many years. She learned about this work by herself, because she did not find another way to help her family. She sells to the nearby areas for about five hours per day.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients to improve her cheese sales. She will buy wholesale milk to make more cheese and have better sales and earnings, thereby improving her business.

Her dream is to set up a fixed sales point so that she does not have to sell door-to-door, as she has been doing up until now. At her age, she gets tired too quickly.

loans.use: to buy supplies and wholesale milk to improve her cheese sales.

loans.name: Naveedan

texts.en: Naveedan is 26 years old and has two children. Two years ago she decided to help her husband support her family for a better future. She started a business selling cosmetics in her locality. She earns good income through her business. She is on her fourth loan, requesting 40,000 PKR to purchase cosmetics supplies such as fairness creams, nails polishes, lipsticks, and facial kits. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics supplies such as fairness creams, nails polishes, lipsticks, and facial kits.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started her business selling animals. She has been doing it for many years and earns good income to meet her household expenses. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is on her sixth loan and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 29-year-old single man who has one child aged six years old whom he supports and whose well being he takes care of. Christopher has been operating a business planting and selling Napier grass for the last three years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Christopher is servicing his second loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to rent additional land to plant Napier grass.

Christopher plans to use the anticipated income to educate his child and purchase his own land. He hopes to improve the living standard of his family and become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to rent additional land to plant more Napier grass.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 43 years old, married, and has run a small general store at the corner of her house in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy rice, sugar, juices, tea and flour. She would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, juices, tea and flour.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira, 42, is a married woman who has five children. She runs a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is on her sixth loan and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 23 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace algunos años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, jabones, sopas, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y así continuar con sus ventas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This borrower is 23 years old and lives in a relative's house with her life partner and their two children. She has had a small store in her home for several years. With the money she earns from her sales, she manages to cover her household expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy basic grains, detergent, soap, soup, candy, soda, etc. She will then be able to continue with her sales and give her family greater financial stability without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergent, soap, soup, candy, soda, etc.

loans.name: Elian

texts.es: Elian, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 21  años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Elian, an enterprising man, is 21 years old, is single, and currently lives with his parents. He requested a loan because he wants to buy supplies like manure and fumigants. He wants to help the coffee crops, in order to keep them in good condition during their development, in order to have a high-quality product. 

The only limitation that this gentleman has is a lack of money to keep growing, because they depend on this economic activity to get ahead. That is why he is applying for a loan, and this is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He does not have other loans through government banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate...

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Arzullah

texts.en: Arzullah was born in 1966, has been married for 26 years and has two children. His eldest child is studying in college and the other graduated from school and learned car repair as a master profession. Arzullah lives in the Baku region. He has been in the repair and construction business for 17 years and loves his job. Previously, Arzullah took out a loan from Kiva and successfully repaid it. He again has applied to Kiva field partner Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN to repair his necessary apparatus and to buy more materials for his work. Arzullah says “Dear Kiva organization and dear lender, you helped me a lot”

loans.use: to repair his necessary apparatus and to buy more materials

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
María tiene 61 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, ella deseaba ser profesional pero en aquellos tiempos los padres solo querían que sus hijos aprendieran a trabajar, es viuda pero ha encontrado a alguien con quien rehacer su vida, tiene 6 hijos pero en casa solo viven 4.


María se dedica a la agricultura con su actual compañero de vida, pero también hace charamuscas y otras ventas por las que ella requiere tener una refrigeradora, ya tiene dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, una de sus hijas le colabora a ella, y realiza la venta de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar una refrigeradora, y comprará un saco de abono que le hace falta para abonar la milpa.


Sus sueños son que Dios le preste larga vida y que le dé salud a sus hijos y a su actual compañero de vida, ella sueña con tener algún día una tienda surtida de todo para generar mas ingresos a su hogar y tener siempre el sustento.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old. She went to school up until third grade. She wanted to be a professional, but in those days parents only wanted their children to learn how to work. She is a widow but has found someone to rebuild her life with. She has 6 children but only 4 live at home.

Maria makes a living in agriculture with her current life partner, but she also makes frozen juice drinks and sells other things for which she needs to have a refrigerator. She has been making a living doing this for two years now. One of her daughters works with her, and she sells from 6am to 7pm. 

She needs the loan to buy a refrigerator, and she will buy a bag of manure which she needs to fertilize the crop.

Her dreams are for God to grant her a long life and for him to keep her children and her current life partner healthy. She dreams of one day having a general store to generate more income for her home and always have a means of support.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to buy a bag of manure that she needs to fertilize the crop.

loans.name: Santibala

texts.en:
Santibala is a 50-year-old housewife who lives with her husband Pabendranath and their only son in the village of West Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Both Santibala and her husband are illiterate and could not get the opportunity to go to school due to the poor economic resources of their family. With lots of efforts and dedication, she was able to keep her son in school until primary level.  Now he is grown up and works as a mason.

Santibala's husband has been engaged in agricultural activities for the last 15 years. He is hardworking, honest and a very simple man.  He has been continuing his agribusiness successfully to date.  Santibala works as a homemaker and in her free time helps her husband do agricultural work. Now her husband is 65 years old and has become feeble. So he can't give much effort in his work.  Their son has no consistent income.  So, it is now difficult to cover all the household expenses of the family.  So, Santibala has decided to grow paddy on their farmland.  She has earned a good experience through the work during the last several years.  Since rice is the staple food of the people in this region, she expects a good result from this new cultivation.

She applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use the requested loan to purchase necessary supplies to plant paddy such as seeds, manure, and insecticides. She dreams of improving the quality of life for her husband and son through this business. She wants to purchase more agricultural lands with the profit.

She is highly grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate paddy rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Memoona

texts.en: Memoona is a 39-year-old married woman. She has a business selling cloth. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Shg Group

texts.en:
Premasila (shown in the photo standing second from left) is a 52-year-old woman who is married and has two children who are in school. She lives in a small village in Odisha, India. Premasila produces and sells flowers in the community where she lives. She learned this line of work from her parents who dedicated themselves to this trade for many years. Premasila’s work enables her to generate the necessary income for sustaining her family. She says that she enjoys her work because it is honest labor and it helps her feel useful in her community. Premasila has more than 12 years of experience in this trade. 

She decided to organize a group so that she and her fellow group members could help one another and improve their standard of living. Premasila will use her loan to buy supplies (such as fertilizer) and to pay for labor so that can maintain her flower plants. She dreams of increasing her flower plantings so that she can improve her income.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio   tiene la edad de 48 años, está casado y vive con su esposa un hijo y el nieto. El quiere comprar almacigo para la resiembra de su propiedad y algunos insumos para su mantenimiento. El cuenta con la experiencia y el terreno, pero el café ya está en unas condiciones regulares por lo cual él quiere  resembrar las partes más dañadas y seguir con el proyecto. El pretende con esto generar ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y también mejorar sus cosechas este próximo año. Es el segundo   préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Julio, 48, is married and lives with his wife, his son, and his grandson. He wants to buy seedbeds to replant his land, as well as some supplies to maintain it. He has experience and land, but his coffee is just in fair condition. He would like to replant the most damaged areas and continue with his project. His goal is to generate earnings for his family's well-being, as well as to improve his harvest for next year. 

This is his second loan with FUDECOSUR. He had not had any other loans with state-run banks previously, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedbeds and supplies.

loans.name: Olga  Maria

texts.es:
Un olor exquisito a tortilla recién hecha se desprende todas las mañanas de la humilde casa de Olga, señora que con sus manos prepara el acompañante principal de la comida tradicional nicaragüense, todos sus clientes aseguran que brinda atención y producto de calidad, razón por la que siempre regresan a comprar. Es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, ella tiene 38 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Hace diez años inició con su negocio, en el que poco a poco, con la ayuda de su familia ha salido adelante.
Olga solicita el segundo crédito para incrementar la producción de su negocio, ella requiere comprar maíz, materia prima con la que prepara las tortillas. Expresa estar muy agradecida con el primer financiamiento de KIVA a través de MiCrédito, puesto que logró incrementar su clientela y al mismo tiempo sus ganancias. Ahora deposita su confianza en el segundo préstamo ya que desea mantener el ritmo de su oficio, cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y así poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The exquisite scent of freshly made tortillas wafts from Olga's humble house every morning. With her own hands, she prepares this main side dish to traditional Nicaraguan food. All of her clients guarantee that she gives them attention and good-quality products, which is why they always come back. She is a dynamic, hardworking woman. She is 38 years old and is married with two children. She started her business ten years ago. Little by little, with her family's help, she has been moving forward.

Olga is applying for her second loan to increase the productivity of her business. She needs to buy corn, the main ingredient she uses to prepare tortillas. She is very grateful for her first loan through Kiva and MiCrédito, because she was able to increase her clientele and her earnings at the same time. Now she is putting her trust in this second loan to maintain the rhythm of her work and fulfill her customers' demand. She will then be able to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn, the main ingredient she uses to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a donkey and an animal-drawn cart

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is 36 years old, married, and a mother of three.  She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past six years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena, a 40-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews and then sells clothing to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Sakeena has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Sakeena's fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es: Carmen como objetivo principal de vida, es darle una calidad de vida digna a sus hijos, a través de los años ha solicitado crédito para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, en el crédito anterior solicitó para construir parte del muro perimetral de su vivienda, el crédito que ahora solicita es para terminar la construcción del muro de la parte este de su vivienda. Aun se encuentra trabajando como operadora en una zona franca. Su esposo es guarda de seguridad y sus hijos se encuentran estudiando la primaria y secundaria.
texts.en:
Carmen’s main goal in life is to provide a decent life for her children. Over the years, she has requested loans in order to make home improvements. The previous loan she requested was used to build part of a security wall around her home.

The loan she is requesting now will be used to finish the construction of the wall that is part of her home. Carmen works at an operator in the free trade zone. Her husband is a security guard and her children attend either primary or secondary school.

loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel in order to finish construction of a security wall.

loans.name: Shubana

texts.en:
Shubana is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling and purchasing animals for many years. She buys animals like baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha, a religious event in Muslim countries. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Shubana requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living through all of her hard work with her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Taliha

texts.en:
Taliha is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past five years. 

At present, she has two cows which she uses for selling milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Taliha has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 17 Septembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son septième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit comme, accompagné d’activité de maraichage durant l’hivernage.

Madame Adama (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 24 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 garçon et 02 filles. Elle tient une table au village où elle vend des condiments et divers produits alimentaires (sucre, thé vert). Elle achète sa marchandise au marché hebdomadaire de la localité pour la revente au village. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter un sac d’ognon et de pomme de terre pour la revente pour le ramadan.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle compte accompagner son mari dans les charges de la famille, développer ses activités génératrices de revenu et consolider son épargne.
texts.en:
[This group] has been created on September 17, 2011 at the launch of its banc villageois. The group just finished its seventh loan cycle. It is composed of women living in the same village, who maintain friendly relations and a team spirit. They mainly work as vendors and also grow vegetables during the rainy season.

Mrs. Adama (the one standing on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has three children: one boy and two girls. She has a stand at the village where she sells condiments and various food products (such as sugar and green tea). She stocks up at the regional weekly market and then resells in her village. She has been in this business for over five years.
With this new loan, she plans to buy a bag of onions and potatoes to resell for the Ramadan holiday.

With her revenues, she plans to help her husband provide for family needs as well as expand her business and bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy a bag of onions and potatoes to resell for the Ramadan.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of the household expenses, so she began a business selling milk. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk to her locality. 

With the support of the Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help to generate more income for her. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 41-year-old married woman. Ten years ago, she started a business selling animals with the support of her husband.  Through this business, she is supporting her family of four members. She purchases small animals at low prices, brings them up, and her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her sixth loan cycle and applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase more goats and sheep. 

She expects boost in her earnings through her larger sales and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old married woman.  She has a business selling animals. She buys animals like baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. 

With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her eighth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a 26-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.
