He depended on cocoa farming, but later after collecting a small savings, he bought an old motorcycle for a transportation business to improve his household income. 

Though challenged by poor roads and high competition in the industry, he is determined to buy new motorcycle tires from the loan he requested. He also wishes to buy another new motorcycle for income generation.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tires.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba tiene 69 años de edad, ella deseaba mucho ir a la escuela pero sus padres no pudieron mandarla a estudiar, su compañero de vida le ayuda con la agricultura pero muy poco ya que el está enfermo y bastante avanzado de edad, nadie mas depende de ella pues solo vive con su pareja.


Alba se dedica a la agricultura con el apoyo de su pareja, ella realiza la siembra de maíz y un poquito de frijol, ya tiene mas de 35 años realizando esta actividad, 2 de sus hijos le ayudan cuando pueden, Alba cultiva en lo propio y le queda cerca de su casa, trabaja en un horario de  6:00 a 11:00 am.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar sacos de abono que le hacen falta para abonar el cultivo por segunda vez, y además pagará mozo.

Ella sueña con que Dios le de vida y salud junto a su pareja, y que la producción de su cultivo sea muy buena.
texts.en:
Alba is 69 years old. She wanted very much to attend school but her parents could not send her to study. Her life's companion helps her in agriculture but very little since he is now ill and quite advanced in age. Noone else depends on her since she lives with her husband only.

Alba is dedicated to agriculture, with her husband's help. She sows corn and some beans. For more than 35 years, she has been involved in this activity. Two of her children help her when they can. Alba cultivates her own land which is located near her house. Her work schedule is between 6:00 and 11:00 am.

Alba needs this loan to purchase sacks of manure which she lacks to fertilize her crops for a 2nd time, and also to pay a worker. She dreams that God may give her life and health, along with her husband, and that her crops may be very good.

loans.use: buy sacks of manure which she lacks to fertilize her crop for a 2nd time, and also to pay a laborer.

loans.name: Freddy Roland

texts.es:
Freddy es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 39 años de edad, y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Desde hace 2 años trabaja brindando servicio de seguridad en una empresa. También cuenta con experiencia como albañil ya que antes trabajaba en las diversas construcciones que se realizaban en la zona. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajador, honesto y con muchos deseos de superación.
Freddy está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá arreglar el piso de su casa para mayor seguridad, de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Freddy is an entrepreneurial man. He is 39 years old and he lives in Nazca along with his family.

For over two years he has worked providing security services at a company. He also has experience as a construction worker, as he used to work in diverse construction projects that were being developed in the area. He has been doing very well because he is very responsible, hard working, honest and very eager to excel. 

Fredy is thankful to Kiva lenders because with the support that they have provided to him, he will be able to fix the flooring of his house for greater safety, thus improving his quality of life and he will continue striving to provide a better future for them.

loans.use: to improve the flooring of his household

loans.name: Asaba

texts.en:
Asaba is a 25-year-old ambitious and hardworking young married father of three living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He provides a motorcycle transportation service and has a small retail shop, both enabling him to maintain his family.

Even though competition is stiff, Asaba dreams of buying another motorcycle. He is requesting this loan to  process his riding permit.

loans.use: to process his riding permit.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rose is a 51-year-old female Ugandan. She is married and has five children. Three children attend school.

She lives in Kagadi where she sells a variety of foods like fried cassava, pancakes, yellow bananas, and chapattis, among others. She has been in business since 2001 and supplements the business with farming to generate more income for educating her children.

Through her hard work, she hopes to build a commercial house despite the challenge of inadequate capital that limits the growth of her business. Rose is asking for a loan to buy more food like yellow bananas and cassava for selling.

loans.use: to buy more food like yellow bananas and cassava for selling.

loans.name: Ndeye Keme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est l’un des plus expérimentés du système et groupe en son sein des femmes qui ont une grande maîtrise du programme. La cohabitation durant des années a pu souder les liens qui sont caractérisés. Ayant  un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois, elles ont su développer un esprit de solidarité de groupe leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ndèye (debout à  droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 04 garçons et 1 fille. Elle est vendeuse d’encens et divers articles de beauté traditionnels. Pour préparer ses produits elle achète les graines d’encens et divers parfums et eau de cologne, fait les mélanges les stockent pendant une période avant de commencer la vente par pot de 500 gr ou plus.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter au moins 5 kg de grains d’encens du nom  de « Gohé » et divers parfums et eau de cologne pour préparer ses encens.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte accroître son épargne et mieux apporter son soutien concernant les dépenses journalières.
texts.en:
This ’banc villageois’ is one of the most experienced in the system. It is composed of women who have a good mastery of the program. Living together for years, the women were able to solidify the ties characterizing them. Having extended experience in ’banc villageois’ programs, they found out how to develop a spirit of group solidarity enabling them today to cope with many situations. The group members’ main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Ndèye (standing at the right with her left hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is 46 years old and a married mother of five children (five boys and a girl). She is a vendor of incense and a variety of traditional beauty products. To make her products, she purchases incense seeds and various perfumes and eau de cologne. She mixes and stores them for a while before selling them in containers of [500 francs] or more. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase at least 5 kg of incense seeds called “gohé” and various perfumes and eau de cologne to make incense. 

With the profits, she plans on growing her savings and doing better at covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase at least 5 kg of incense seeds called “gohé” and various perfumes and eau de cologne to make incense

loans.name: Chemail

texts.en:
Chemail is a 55-year-old, married woman and she has been running a small business of cloth-selling. She sells embroidered cloth with beautiful patterns and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this business for the past six years and there is a healthy demand for her cloth among her customers. 

Chemail has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 with which she wants to purchase a variety of cloth for her customers. With this loan amount, she will be able to increase both her sales and profits. Her dream is to earn enough money to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth from the market.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es: María Salome es propietaria de una tienda de consumo diario la cual está ubicada en caserío Buena Esperanza y está cerca de una escuela de educación primaria y esto ha sido una ventaja que doña María ha sabido aprovechar porque ha surtido muy bien su tienda  y los niños le llegan a comprar todos los días. Ella está muy agradecida con Fape y Kiva ya que han sido varios créditos que ha obtenido y está logrando su sueño de que todos sus hijos estudien y salgan adelante. Solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, jabón, gaseosas y golosinas para la venta.
texts.en:
María Salome is the owner of a staple goods store. The store is located in a small village called Buena Esperanza, close to a primary school. This has been advantageous to María since she has known how to stock up her store and the children arrive every day to buy. 

She is thankful to Fape and Kiva since she has obtained several loans and is accomplishing her dream of having all of her children studying and moving forward. She is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, soap, sodas and sweets for retail.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, sodas and sweets for retail

loans.name: Nene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est l’un des plus expérimentés du système et groupe en son sein des femmes qui ont une grande maîtrise du programme. La cohabitation durant des années a pu souder les liens qui sont caractérisés. Ayant  un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois, elles ont su développer un esprit de solidarité de groupe leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Néné (assise  à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est  âgée de 43 ans,  elle est mariée, mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles et un garçon. Elle fait de la transformation de céréales locales (fonio, couscous à base de mil, farine de bouillions de mil et poudre de pain de singe). Elle achète la matière première dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la plus part du temps, par  exception au marché central de la commune pour la transformation et la vente par sachet de 500 gr et 01 kg.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter pour renforcer son stock de production.
-	Pour le fonio 05 sacs de 50 kg pour transformation et conditionnement dans des sachets de 500 gr et 01 kg.
-	Une dizaine de sacs de mil pour la préparation de couscous et bouillions.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux assoir son commerce et d’apporter son aide à son mari pour une meilleure prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois is one of the most experienced in the system and brings together women who have mastered the program. Living together for years has solidified the connections that are characteristic [of these women's relationships]. Through their long experience with bancs villageois, these women have been able to foster a spirit of group solidarity that now allows them to cope with many situations. Their primary activity is small business.

Mrs. Néné (seated at right [in the photo]) is the featured borrower of this group. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four children, three girls and a boy. She processes local grains (fonio [a type of millet], millet-based couscous, flour from millet bouillon and powdered baobab fruit). She purchases the raw materials in the weekly markets most of the time, with the exception of the commune's central market for the processing and sale of 500g and 1kg bags.

With this loan, Mrs. Néné plans to strengthen her inventory [with the purchase of:]
-       Five 50kg sacks of fonio for processing and packaging into 500g and 1kg bags.
-       10 sacks of millet to make couscous and bouillon.

The profits from her business will allow Mrs. Néné to better situate her business and to assist her husband in better managing the family's needs.

loans.use: To strengthen her inventory [with the purchase of:] five 50kg sacks of fonio [a type of millet] for processing and packaging into 500g and 1kg bags; 10 sacks of millet to make couscous and bouillon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer  and other home appliances.

loans.name: Necton

texts.en:
Necton is a 32-year-old married man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a civil servant who practices dental services in his area. 

From the savings of his government salary, he started a clinic in his area to increase his income and help the community, but inadequate capital, power failures, and facilities let him down. 

He wishes to buy powerful machines and establish new branches across the district. Necton requested a loan to renovate his clinic and buy reception chairs.

loans.use: to renovate his clinic and buy reception chairs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a self-employed woman from Zovasar village. She lives with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters). Another son of Nora's has moved to the Russian Federation to earn money and financially help his family. Furthermore, her two children are still very little. 

Since Nora's husband is a teacher at the local school, only two family members are fully-engaged in agricultural activities. They are specialized in animal husbandry. In particular, they keep cattle, hens, and sheep. 

In order to sustain her family's agribusiness and expand it, Nora has applied for a loan of USD 1,500. The requested amount will be used to purchase animal feed. Specifically, she wants to buy corn (100 kg), barley (600 kg), and lucerne (400 hectares). 

Nora will be extremely grateful to all the lenders for their support. Let's help this large family improve their financial situation since they really try hard to make ends meet.​

loans.use: to pay for animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Todos los días, tras haber tomado su cafecito caliente doña María Luisa con mucha energía  abre su pequeña tienda de ropa variada, ubicada en su casa de habitación, todos sus clientes aseguran salir satisfechos por la amabilidad y calidad de atención que ella les ofrece. Tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, todos mayores e independientes. Inicio en el negocio de venta hace cinco años, el cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Su esposo y una de sus hijas, le han brindado el apoyo necesario para salir adelante.
María solicita el segundo crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, anhela comercializar otros productos así como la compra de joyas de plata y luego venderlas, de manera que pueda alcanzar un público más grande y así poder incrementar sus ganancias. Ella está muy agradecida con el primer financiamiento de KIVA a través de MiCrédito, por lo tanto deposita su confianza en el segundo préstamo, ya que aspira tener un futuro tranquilo y estable, en el que no acumule deudas y pueda descansar tranquila. Sin duda alguna, es una mujer carismática y luchadora, quién con perseverancia y disciplina ha logrado educar a sus hijos y cumplir todos su objetivos.
texts.en:
Every day, after having drunk her hot coffee, Doña María Luisa, which much energy, opens her small clothing shop, located in her home. All her clients are sure to leave satisfied, thanks to the kindness and quality of attention that she offers. She is 61 years old, married, and has three children, all adults and independent.

She began the business five years ago, and it has become her main source of income. Her husband and one of her daughters have provided the necessary help to ensure its progress.

Maria requests a second loan to increase the production of capital; she longs to sell other products, such as purchasing jewelry to sell; with this, she can reach a wider public and increase her earnings. She is very thankful for the first Kiva financing through MiCrédito, and so she has faith in the second loan; she now aspires to have a calm and stable future, in which she does not accumulate debt and where she can rest with ease. Without a doubt, she is a charismatic and hardworking woman, who – with perseverance and discipline – has been able to educate her children and to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry.

loans.name: Félix Osmín

texts.es:
Félix tiene 65 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela ya que en ese tiempo sus padres solamente los ponían a trabajar, está casado y su esposa solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos y cuando tiene tiempo se va con él a ayudarle en el campo.



Félix se dedica a la agricultura desde hace aproximadamente 20 años, esto lo aprendió de su padre que siempre quiso que ellos aprendieran el trabajo de campo, también en sus tiempos libres él va a rajar leña a otras personas cuando lo buscan, el lugar donde el cultiva maíz le queda cerca de la casa, a unos 15 minutos y se va caminando, ya que cultiva en lo propio, sus nietos le ayudan cuando pueden, y Félix trabaja en un horario de 5:30 a 11.30 de la mañana.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar 2 sacos de abono, un litro de gramoson y un herbicida para la plaga, con este préstamo el podrá tener asegurado el alimento de la familia durante el año.


Sus sueños son lograr su objetivo de que sus nietos estudien para que se puedan defender en la vida y no les toque como a él que tiene que trabajar solo en la agricultura para darles el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Felix is 65 years old. He lacked opportunity to attend school since at that time, his parents simply put him to work. He is married and his wife usually performs only domestic chores. When she has time, she goes with him to help in the fields.

Felix has been dedicated to agriculture for approximately the last 20 years. He learned this from his father who always expected them to learn the work of the countryside. Also, in his free time Felix goes with other people to search for firewood. The place where they cultivate corn is close to his house, some 15 minutes walking distance. He cultivates his own land. His grandchildren help him when they can, and Felix working schedule is from 5:30  to 11:30 in the morning.

The loan he needs is for purchasing 2 sacks of manure, a liter of Gramoson, and a herbicide to prevent plant illnesses. With this loan, Felix will be able to assure food for his family during the year.

His dreams are to achieve his objective, that his grandchildren study so that they can defend themselves in life and not, like him, be only able to work in agriculture to earn their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of manure, a litre of gramoson, and a herbicide to be used against plant desease.

loans.name: Dúo El Rosario De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Duo el Rosario de Sumpango
Este dúo esta conformado por Irma de 40 años de edad es madre de familia y es originaria de Sumpango, este es el tercer crédito que solicita con kiva, ya que tiene que invertir en su negocio, pues gracias  a Dios sus ventas han mejorado por el crédito que se le ha otorgado, Irma se dedica a la venta de Mariscos en el mercado de Sumpango gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien en su negocio ella necesita este crédito para poder agrandar mas su negocio ya que sus hijos están estudiando y el sueño que tiene ella es de poder ayudarlos a desenvolverse en sus estudios, ademas agradece la oportunidad que kiva le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Duo el Rosario de Sumpango

This duo includes Irma, a 40-year-old mother originally from Sumpango. Irma makes a living selling seafood in the market in Sumpango. She thanks God that her business is going really well. 

This is the third loan she is requesting from Kiva because she has to invest in her business. Her sales have increased because of the loans she has already been granted, for which she is thankful to God.

Irma needs this loan so she can further expand her business because her children are now studying and her dream is to be able to help them progress in their studies. Also, she is thankful to Kiva for giving her this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es: Edwin tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 4 años de edad. Edwin trabaja como jornalero desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Edwin desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera, además desea comprar una cocina de gas dado que no cuenta con una. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así mejorar sus condiciones y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 26 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their daughter of 4 years. Edwin has worked as a laborer for a long time which is how he manages to support his household. 

Edwin wants to improve their living conditions which is why he has taken the decision to apply for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of galvanised sheets of metal and wood. He also wants to buy a gas cooker because he doesn't have one. He hopes to be able to rely on this loan and therefore improve his conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets of metal and wood, as well as a gas cooker.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Paul. He is a hard-working, mixed-farmer from Eldoret, which is a rural town in Kenya, home to many renowned, world-class marathon runners. Paul has 15 years’ experience in growing maize and keeping dairy cows and poultry. He sells milk, eggs, and maize on a local farm, which is a bit far from where his farm is situated. 

Keeping livestock has always been the most enjoyable farm activity for Paul. He named his cows, Kerich (after a person) and Maridadi (meaning, 'the cow decorates his life'). However, the major challenge for Paul and other farmers in the village has been transportation of the farm produce to the market. The roads are unpaved and in very poor condition. 

For this reason, Paul is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a motorcycle. However, not just any motorcycle, but a “Boda Boda.” Boda Boda is an Indian or Chinese standard roadster bicycle, used with locally made carriers and a cushion to transport passengers and goods. This will be customized to transport passengers and farm produce to the market. 

Your lending towards this loan will greatly save Paul the trouble he has been going through for more than a decade, transporting produce to the market. With the motorcycle, he will be able to ferry his produce and that of other farmers, for a small fee, to the market. 

The additional income he will make from acquiring a motorcycle will go to the education of his three children. He plans to purchase a chaff-cutter with any extra amount of money.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Yakobo

texts.en: Yakobo who has managed to continue with his retailing since 2000, has also spent most of his time in cocoa farming to complement it with a retail business to acquire a reasonable income to run his obligations as a family man. Though constrained with inadequate capital, he has persisted in the business. He dreams of seeing his children attain higher levels of education and needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and crates of sodas.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and crates of sodas to sell.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, Victor vive en casa de sus padres junto con su esposa e hija.

El ya tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, esta es la única actividad a la cual se dedica, pero también trabaja halando agua cuando alguien lo solicita. El lugar donde el cultiva le queda a unos 2 minutos de su casa y se traslada caminando, el no tiene terreno propio, por lo cual tiene que alquilar para cultivar, su horario de trabajo es de 5:30 hasta las 11:40 am.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar 4 sacos de abono, pagara el alquiler de la hectárea de tierra y comprara otros herbicidas que aun le hacen falta. 


Sus sueños son que Dios le permita tener una buena cosecha para poder para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Victor is 28 years old and has a ninth-grade education. He is married and has one three-year-old daughter. His wife takes care of the household duties. Victor, his wife, and their child live in his parents' house.

He has worked in agriculture for five years. This is his only job, but he also works hauling water when someone requests it. The place where he farms is about two minutes from his house, and he travels there on foot. He does not have his own land, so he has to rent in order to farm. His work schedule is from 5:30 to 11:40 a.m.

He needs the loan to buy four sacks of manure, to pay rent for the hectare of land, and to buy herbicides that he still lacks.

His dream is that God will allow him to have a good harvest so that he can pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure, to pay rent for the hectare of land, and to buy other herbicides that he still needs.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur lives with his wife and two children in the Baku region. But he has been an Internally Displaced Person From Fuzuli city over 20 years. Elnur is 31 years old. His elder son is going to his first class of school this year and his little son goes to kindergarten. Elnur has a store and he has been selling women's clothes for five years. A while ago, he applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 800 AZN – Azerbaijan New Manat to buy more clothes for selling. He says thanks for the loan to Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария — пенсионерка. Она занимается домашним хозяйством, торгует на базаре своей продукцией. Дети у нее взрослые, живут отдельно. Несмотря на проблемы со здоровьем и финансами Мария продолжает трудиться и благоустраивать свой быт, не жалея сил. 
Сумма в 20 000 гривен нужна Марии для того, чтобы перекрыть крышу металлочерепицей. Ремонт нужно делать срочно, так как кровля совсем прогнила и к тому же дни сейчас теплые, а, значит, самые благоприятные для подобного ремонта. Мария мечтает со временем полностью окончить ремонт в доме и возле дома.
texts.en:
Mariya is retired. She takes care of the household and sells her [garden] produce at the market. Her children are grown and live separately. In spite of health and financial issues, Mariya keeps working hard to improve her living conditions.

Mariya needs the sum of 20,000 UAH in order to install new metal roofing. She needs to have this work done immediately because her roof is rotted all over. Also the weather is warm now, and so the conditions are ideal for carrying out such work. Mariya’s dream is to complete all renovations in her house and backyard one day.

loans.use: to roof her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 20-year-old single young man from Jabalia. He lives alone in a very simple house. Yaser is an employee in the public sector with a very low income. He also works selling accessories in a stall. It is a good business and helps him in part of the expenses. He would like to improve his business and expand it.
Yaser took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. By taking this loan, Yaser will be able to buy more products with lower prices to resell and also to distribute it to the local traders. 
Yaser appears in the photo next to his stall.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single young man from Jabalia. he works in giving private lessons for the school student. He is also a university student specializing in Islamic studies. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job as a teacher in local schools. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to read articles and research online. This will help him to get very high marks.
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 37-year-old woman, as she has a happy marriage and one son who inspired her to focus on a business idea. This is how, for seven years, she has made a living selling foodstuffs to her customers with the aim of being able to offer her child an excellent quality of life with a good education, diet and home and converting her son into her source of inspiration and strength.

Being her son, Charity worries about him, as she always wants him to have the best education possible. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and foodstuffs (plantain and snail) with the aim of increasing her earnings so that she can pay for her son to have a good education.

She and her husband have also set the goal of buying their own home, so as to leave their son a legacy, and, should he ever need it, a home in which to live.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and foodstuffs (plantain and snail) with the aim of increasing her earnings.

loans.name: Orupa

texts.en:
Orupa is a fifty-two-year-old married woman with six children, of which two go to school living Bundibugyo Uganda. She deals in the secondhand clothes business. After realizing that cocoa selling would not do much for her income generation, she joined the above business. Though competition and changes in fashion are a threat to her business, she dreams of constructing a good residential home for her family.
Orupa will use the loan to buy secondhand clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es:
Rosa de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, de sus 4 hijos solamente 2 estudian y los otros trabajan.

Rosa desde la edad de los 15 años trabaja ayudándole a su madre a vender tamales, ademas trabajaba como jornalera en las algodoneras, hoy en día cuida los tres animales que posee los cuales son su fuente de ingresos.


Rosa utilizará el crédito para comprar ganado.

El sueño de Rosa es tener mucho ganado de repasto, ya que la mayoría que tenía se le murieron, además desea que sus hijos se preparen económicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35, studied until the 3rd grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. Of her four children, only two attend school and the other two work. Rosa has been working with her mother since she was 15 years old, helping her to sell tamales. Additionally she used to work as a labourer in the cotton fields. Today, she owns and looks after three animals which provide her with a source of income. 

Rosa will use the loan to buy cattle. Rosa's dream is to have a lot of cattle for grazing, as the majority of the ones she had died. She also wants her children to be financially secure.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 56 años de edad, no estudió y está acompañado, tiene 1 hijo y su esposa realiza los oficios domésticos.


Ramón ha sido agricultor desde los 14 años, hoy solo siembra 1 hectárea de cultivo de maíz la cual junto a su hijo producen.- También tiene una tienda la cual atiende todos los días.


El crédito será utilizado para invertir en la tienda.

El sueño de Ramón es arreglar su casa, invertir aún mas en el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ramón is 56 years old. He did not attend school. He is married, and has a son. His wife is a homemaker. Ramón has been a farmer since he was 14 years old. Today he only cultivates one hectare of corn, with the help of his son. He also has a shop which he attends to every day. 

He will use the loan to invest in his shop. Ramón's dream is to fix up his house, and to invest even more in his business to improve his income.

loans.use: to invest in his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
A diario suena un palmeo constante en la casa de María del Socorro, quién desde tempranas horas está dándole forma a la masa para convertirla ya sea en una deliciosa tortilla o en un exquisito nacatamal, ambos platos tradicionales nicaragüenses. Tiene 39 años de edad, está en unión libre y tiene tres hijos. Hace 14 años inició su negocio, en que poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante, expresa estar agradecida con su esposo y dos de sus hijas, quienes le brindan el apoyo necesario.
María solicita el préstamo para aumentar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar maíz, carne de res, pollo y cerdo; asimismo frijoles, leña, gas, entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que de esta manera logrará ganar más clientela y al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ganancias. Es una señora humilde y trabajadora, con muchos objetivos, uno de ellos mejorar las condiciones de su hogar para brindarle a su familia un entorno seguro y agradable, de manera que puedan desarrollarse con éxito en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Every day you can hear the constant sound of kneading in María del Socorro's house, where she turns dough into delicious tortillas or exquisite nacatamals, both traditional Nicaraguan foods, from the early hours of the morning. She is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. 

She started her own business 14 years ago, and is gradually getting ahead. She is grateful to her husband and her two daughters who give her the support she needs. 

María is requesting this loan to increase her business' production. She needs to buy corn, beef, chicken, pork, beans, firewood, and propane, among other items. She has confidence in this financing as it will allow her to gain more customers and increase her profits at the same time. 

María is a modest and hard-working woman, with many goals. One of them is to improve her living conditions to provide her family with a safe and pleasant environment, so that they can develop into successful members of society.

loans.use: to buy corn, beef, chicken and pork, as well as beans, firewood, and propane, among other items.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en: Nader is a 22-year-old, single man from Jabalia. His father works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Nader is a university student specializes in English literature. He would like to earn the BA degree and find a job as a teacher in local schools. Nader took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Nader will be able to read articles and researches online. This will help him to get very high marks. Nader appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her clothing store

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 50-year-old married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 31 years old, and the youngest one is 13. Fatima lives with her family in Mokala, Yemen. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Fatima wants to help him to improve the condition of the family. She says that her house lacks many home appliances, and she can't afford to buy them. Mokala city has a hot climate year round, particularly in the summer season. Unfortunately, the air-conditioner of Fatima's house is very old. They need to a new one. She is requesting a loan of 98,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new air-conditioner.

Fatima looks forward to taking another loan from Kiva in order to purchase other home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase a new air-conditioner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flagstone and cement to renovate his house from the inside.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 28-year-old single man.  He lives with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. He studied until the secondary school level. Unfortunately, he couldn't complete his studies. 

Husam  accumulate a good amount of money from his work and purchased a bus  to improve his family's standard of living.  He has been in this business for more than three years. He works as a driver on the bus. Unfortunately, most of what he earns from this business goes bus repairs. His bus needs to be repaired, but Husam doesn't have enough money to do that. 

For this reason, he applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for the bus. The new spare parts will help him in save a lot of money.

Husam's vision is to purchase another bus to provide his family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the bus.

loans.name: Türkan

texts.en:
Türkan is married with two children. For generations her family has worked meerschaum, a stone which comes from her city. She buys the raw stone and processes it in a workshop. She makes pipes and jewelry to sell. As tourism in her city has increased over recent years, her business has been slowly improving. She is contributing to the economy of her family and her country. "Women can be meerschaum artisans, too," she says. 
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff.  This Field Partner is allowed to choose to leave the local language description below the English one:  
Türkan,evli iki çocuk annesi, lületası beyaz altın yaşadığı şehirde çıkıyor ve işleniyor. Türkan aileden gelen yedi göbektir bu isi yapıyor ham olorak çıkan lületaşını atölyede işleyerek takı , pipo haline getiriyor ve satışını yapıyor. Yaşadığı şehir son yıllarda turizmde gelişme sagladığı icin işleri de yavaş yavas iyi gitmeye başlamış. Aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı saglıyor. lületaşında kadın ustalarında var olduğunu söylüyor.

loans.use: to buy meerschaum, to make pipes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Solyman

texts.en:
Solyman is a 51-year-old married man with five children. His oldest child is 25-years-old and the youngest one is 13-years-old. He lives with his family in their own house in Mokala, Yemen. Solyman studied until elementary education, but he could not complete his studies.  Solyman wants to improve the condition of his family by purchasing furniture for his house, but he does not have enough money to that. As a result, he applied for a loan of 98,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for his house.

Solyman looks forward to improving the condition of his house.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Najlaa

texts.en: Najlaa is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children who are still attending school. She started her own job by opening a beauty salon in her house in 2008. She works so hard to earn extra income in order to develop her life. Her customers are so glad with the results they obtained from her. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to purchase equipment for her beauty salon to better serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Maheshwori

texts.en:
Maheshwori is 35 years-old .  She is Married and has one child, aged 12.   Many Years ago, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Maheshwori plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 
 In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stocks for resale.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a thirty-three-year-old married mother of two, one of whom is enrolled in a private school. She opened her own cellular phone store four years ago, when she took over the profession from her brother. She started as his business partner in his shop and through her acquired income, she started her own business to earn an additional income. At first Salwa faced some obstacles in the business due to the amount of competition around her shop but her fourteen years of working have taught her to be patient, and now her sales are good.

Salwa is an ambitious woman who pursues every opportunity in life. Her five previous loan cycles with Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua are a proof of her determination to succeed. She is asking for a new loan to expand her shop's area through adding more space, and shelves in order to improve her sales by increasing her business capital with more mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cards. In the future she dreams of opening a wholesale store to start supplying small shops like hers with merchandise.

loans.use: To expand her shop's area through adding more space, and shelves in order to improve her sales by increasing her business capital with more mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cards

loans.name: Juhayna

texts.en:
Juhayna is a 33-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband in a small house in the city. Her husband is a construction worker with an unstable income due to demand. Juhayna also works to help her husband with the family expenses. She started her own project ten years ago where she makes traditional foods and pastries to sell at events and weddings.

Juhayna took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a bigger oven for her business. By taking this loan, Juhayna will be able to increase her productivity and sell more food.

Juhayna appears in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy a bigger oven for her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 20-year-old, single man from Gaza city. His father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mahmoud is a university student specializing in English literature. He would like to earn the BA degree and find a job in the future to help his family with part of their expenses. Mahmoud took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to read articles and write the reports easily. This will help him to get very high marks.  Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam was born in 1973. She is married and a mother of six. Her husband is a government official. Ibtisam has been selling gifts and accessories by the past three years to help her husband in paying their house hold fees. 

Ibtisam is planning to expand her project in the future. She is now seeks to buy new merchandise for which she doesn't have enough money. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more souvenirs and accessories to raise her sales.

loans.use: To buy more souvenirs and accessories

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad, estudió sexto grado y está acompañada, se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres que ya fallecieron 

María se levanta junto a su esposo a las 4:30 a.m  para realizar sus actividades diarias que se centran en la agricultura y el cuido del ganado.

En el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y vender la leche entre sus vecinos


		El crédito lo necesita para comprar la semilla, abono,veneno, etc. que necesita para sembrar y llegar a obtener una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia

María planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de la leche  y  de la siembra, comprar mas ganado.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and married. She went to school until the sixth grade. She works in agriculture, which she learned from her parents, who have passed away.

María gets up every morning with her husband at 4:30 a.m. to do her agricultural work, which includes caring for livestock.

During the afternoon she milks the cows and sells milk to her neighbors.

She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure, pesticide, etc. she needs to plant her crops. She hopes to obtain a better harvest to support her family.

María would like to use the income she earns from selling milk and her crops to buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, pesticide, etc. she needs to plant her crops.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Ssg Group

texts.en:
Maa Thakurani Self Help Group was formed with 11 members in 2013 in a small village in Odisha. The members all came together to help each other,  solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They selected Kakya as the leader of their group. The lady siting second from the left side in the photograph is Kakya. 

Kakya is a 26-year-old woman living with her husband and her three children. For the past seven years, Kakya’s husband has been working as a farmer and earning 3,000 INR per month but it is not sufficient to manage the small family. So Kakya is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the milk business. She has three years of experience in this business. She has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can support her family’s income. Kakya says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her children to a good school. Through that, she can provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder and to build a cow shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy generator and air cooler.

loans.name: Dipa Shg Group

texts.en:
Dipa Self Help Group has 11 members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing third from left wearing a white-blue sari in the photo is Jahnabi, an active member of the group. Jahnabi is a 44-year-old widow from a small village in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. Jahnabi has three children who are schooling. Jahnabi lives with her children and takes care of all the household expenses. 

For past 10 years, she has been involved in growing and selling vegetables. Her children help her in this activity. All other members of this group are engaged in other kinds of activities like agriculture, cattle farming, etc. In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demands, Jahnabi, together with her group Dipa Self Help Group, has requested a loan of 165,000 INR. Jahnabi will use her portion for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their common goal is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for cultivating vegetables.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Shehnaz, started a cloth trading business nine years ago to help her husband in earning income for the family. She purchases a variety of sorts of cloth from the wholesale market according to the taste of her customers and sells the cloth in her area. The income she generates from this business has helped to give her family a decent living. She has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR with which she wants to expand her small business by purchasing different varieties of cloth from a wider range of markets. She hopes to play a vital role in providing her children with good education.

loans.use: to purchase different varieties of cloth from a wider range of markets

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food such as sweet potatoes to sell, and will help Winnie to generate greater profits and improve more on her savings and her basic needs. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food such as sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 18 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sandra has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Sandra has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Sandra to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Sandra hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Sandra is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past year, Deborah has been working hard to manage her fish business, where she sells fresh fish. 

To help expand her business, Deborah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh fish and cooking oil to fry the fish so she can sell them. This will help Deborah to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Deborah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Deborah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with five children, of whom three go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on retail basis. She works seven days a week .She has been in this business for the last eight years. She earns additional income from selling charcoal. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal, pineapples, onions, tomatoes and cabbages. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a  delivery van to reduce transport costs. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy passionfruit, pineapples, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en: Damalie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. Damalie gets additional income from rearing poultry. She has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes . Her major challenges include transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old, single man from Jabalia city. His father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Mohammad is a university student specializing in business administration. He would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future to help his family with part of their expenses.  Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to read articles and write the reports easily. This will help him to get very high marks. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 24-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He is a father for one son and one daughter. Ahmad works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Ahmad is also a university student specializing in Arabic literature. He would like to earn a BA degree and find a better job in the future to help improve his family’s living conditions.  Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to read articles and write the reports easily. This will help him to get very high marks. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is 33 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.He is married and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past four years, Jolly has been working hard to manage his retail business, selling hardware items. 

To help expand his business, Jolly has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware items to sell, and will help Jolly to generate greater profits and complete his residential house. 

Jolly hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Jolly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jolly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items to sell

loans.name: Nyina Kigwengwe Chapel Group

texts.en: Jane who is 28 years old lives a single life with her 3 children aged between 8 and 4: fortunately,all of them are in school. She owns a nursery school along with selling bed covers where she gets income which has sustained her and her children. She needs a loan to buy materials for making school sweaters to sell. She dreams of expanding her school with a strong foundation although she is being challenged by cunning parent defaulters who never pay tuition at all thus dragging her into big losses.

loans.use: to buy materials for making school sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 35-year-old married lady with three children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She has worked in retail and farming for 10 years and is facing the challenge of bad debtors. However, she hopes to educate all of her children to higher levels of learning.

Sarah needs a loan to add stock of sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Butangwa Abembabazi Women Group

texts.en:
Grace, a member of Butangwa Abembabazi Women's Group, is a 49-year-old widowed lady with 10 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She deals in selling craft and produce in order to boost her income. She faces challenges of lack of enough capital, however she hopes to build a permanent house and educate her children like any loving mother. Grace needs a loan to buy craft materials to sell.
The extra person in the photo is a group member but did not take the loan.

loans.use: to buy craft materials to sell

loans.name: Edgar Benjamin

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 37 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades, su familia está formada por cuatro hijos y su esposa quienes le ayudan en las actividades diarias

Edgar se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ordeñar y luego irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen, mientras que los pequeños se dedican a ir a la escuela.


 
El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. Que necesita para la siembra.

Sus planes a un futuro son tener más ganado de ordeño, tener un corral más grande donde tenerlos ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Edgar is 37 years old. He makes a living in agriculture and livestock. He grew up with his parents, who taught him this work. His family is made up of four children and his wife, who help him with the daily work.

Edgar gets up at 4:30 a.m. to do the milking and then go to the plots of land where he works mornings with his children. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the cows that they own, while the little ones go to school.

He needs the loan to buy the agricultural supplies like poison, seeds, manure, etc. that he needs for sowing. His plans are to at some point have more livestock for milking and have a bigger corral to keep them in because he currently rents.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural supplies like poison, seeds, manure, etc. that he needs for sowing.

loans.name: José Oscar

texts.es:
José tiene 70 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, el creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad, él vive con su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos. 

José se levanta a las 6:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día se dedica a cuidar sus animales.
 
El crédito solicitado es para comprar los insumos agrícolas como semilla, veneno, abono, etc. para sembrar una parcela que espera le produzca una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia.
.

Él planea en un futuro sembrar algodón.
texts.en:
José is 70 years old and works in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. He lives with his wife, who looks after the household work.

José gets up at 6:30 a.m. to spend the morning working the plot of land he rents. During the rest of the day, he works caring for his animals.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, pesticide, manure, etc. to plant a plot of land. He hopes to obtain a good harvest to support his family.

In the future he would like to grow cotton.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, pesticide, manure, etc. to plant a plot of land.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man aged twenty-nine, with two children both going to school. He is a businessman who deals in the produce trade and has a retail shop. He supplements his income with agriculture, specifically in banana and coffee growing. He has a banana plantation and other gardens that can fetch him a good income at the end of a month. He also grows coffee and trades in it. His main clients are fellow coffee traders and small scale companies involved in coffee transportation, as well as schools around him who buy maize and beans. He says he works seven days a week, though he has labourers who help him on Sundays under his supervision. 

Joseph started this business of agricultural produce in 2008 and he says he has been able to meet his daily demands through the business. He says the need to take care of his family instigated him to start this business and he has reaped big rewards from it. 

Joseph will use this loan to buy coffee to sell. He describes himself as a hardworking man and appreciates the work of UGAFODE and Kiva lenders of providing affordable financial services to the active poor.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 40 years married.He supports 10 members.His children are four ranging between 15 years and five years.He has been in the carpentry business for 12 years whereby he makes different types of furniture for sale with a monthly income of KES. 24,000.He has applied for his first loan of KES. 30,000 to expand the current business by buying more timber for making furnitures.

The profits he gets he will use to cater for basic and secondary wants.This is his first loan with VisionfundKenya and he intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more wood for sale.


He hopes and dreams in future is to boost his business and buy assets for family.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a new client aged 66 years. She is widowed with six children and only one attends school at the moment. 

She does farming as her business. She is very shrewd in her business and works for eight hours a day and six days a week. She started her business in the year 2006 to have an income to sustain her and the family. The business is being carried on in a rural area in Kyabugimbi, Igara, Bushenyi. Her clients are cattle traders who have helped her to grow from one level to another.

Joy is faced with the challenge of competition from other business people. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy cows for her business. 

She hopes to grow her business and become financially stable with continued financial support. She is thankful to Kiva for the great work.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He is a father of one son and two daughters. He is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mohammad is also a university student, specializing in social services. He would like to take the BA degree and find a better job in the future. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to easily read articles and write reports. This will help him to get very high marks.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is married man who is blessed with four children. He is in the transport business and offers such services using his motorcycle,the wife is also a business woman who runs a retail shop and contributes to additional income to the family. He has been in this business for the last seven years and earns a monthly income of KES.8,000 

He has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to buy enough fuel for his motorcycle and add more stock of retail items like sugar,sweets,cooking oil to help expand his wife's business.

In future he desires to grow his business and give his children the best education.

loans.use: to buy enough fuel for his motorcycle and add more stock of retail items like sugar,sweets,cooking oil to help expand his wife's business.

loans.name: Faith Kijura Group

texts.en:
Abdalla  deals in selling used clothes. He is a hardworking married Ugandan man. He has two children and both attend school. He desires to grow his business but he is challenged by competition. However, he wants a loan to buy used clothes.

Abdalla  is a member of Faith Kijura group where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 42-year-old married woman who supports a family of three children; her husband adds an additional income to support their family's welfare.  Violet has been operating a timber yard and a furniture business for the past twenty years earning an income of KES. 10,000.

Violet is now servicing her second loan of KES.24,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to purchase more trees for timber and expand her current business.

She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to buy a plot of land to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more trees for timber

loans.name: January

texts.en: January is a 32-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Four of January's children attend school. He used his previous loan to buy clothes to sell in preparation for the Christmas season and received good returns. January also supplements his income with farming. Despite his progress, all of January's businesses are seasonal and dependent on the changing preferences of customers. January needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, a 23-year-old single man from Rafah city, lives with his family in a small house. His father, the family's sole support. is an employee in a local firm but earns a low income.  

Mohammad is a university student studying business administration. Working toward his BA degree, he  hopes to find a job in the future to help improve his family's living conditions.

Mohammad requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him buy a new laptop for his studies.  This will enable him to read articles and write reports easily, thereby assisting him in the pursuit of high marks.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 48 years and married to Caren. Together they are blessed with five children aged between 21 years and nine years.

Benson does welding and this will be his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He has done this business for the past 20 years, earning an income of KES. 45,000.

He has requested a loan of KES. 20,000 to use in buying steel casting materials for reproductions.Benson desires to prosper in his business and his family.

loans.use: to purchase steel casting materials

loans.name: Marvin Moises

texts.es:
Cada domingo, con mucho ánimo y energía se levanta Marvin para presentarse a las últimas clases de su quinto año de Psicología Clínica, carrera profesional en la que se quiere desarrollar desde que era un adolescente, puesto que le gustaba analizar su entorno y brindar consejos a los que lo necesitaban. Tiene 22 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo. Expresa estar agradecido con sus padres y su esposa, quienes día a día lo apoyan y motivan a seguir adelante para cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños, ser un profesional.
Marvin solicita el crédito para lograr pagar su curso de titulación. Él deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que podrá obtener un título profesional que refuerce su desempeño laboral. Es un joven disciplinado e inteligente, cuya meta principal es lograr culminar sus estudios con excelente notas, al mismo tiempo seguir profesionalizándose, de manera que pueda ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, brindarle a su hijo salud y educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Every Sunday, Marvin gets up full of high spirits and energy to go to the last classes of his fifth year of clinical psychology, a professional career track that he has wanted to be in since he was a teenager, because he liked to analyze his surroundings and give advice to those who needed it.

He is 22 years old, is married, and has one child. He says he is grateful to his parents and his wife, who, day after day, support and motivate him to keep moving forward to achieve one of his biggest dreams: to be a professional. 

Marvin requests the loan to be able to pay for his course to graduate. He puts his trust in the financing because he will be able to obtain a professional degree that strengthens his performance on the job. He is a disciplined and intelligent young man, whose main goal is to finish his studies with excellent grades, while also continuing to become a professional, so that he can offer his family better living conditions and give his child health and a quality education.

loans.use: to be able to pay for his course to graduate.

loans.name: Leili Jeaneth

texts.es:
Leili tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.


Leili se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que le  enseñaron sus padres, su esposo le ayuda a trabajar en la parcela que alquila y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y preparar quesos para venderlos entre sus vecinos.



		El crédito que Leili solicita es para comprar una novilla, la cual en un futuro le ayudará a obtener más leche e incrementar sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia

sus planes son seguir trabajando muy duro para comprar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Leili is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She went to school until the ninth grade.

She works in agriculture, which she learned from her parents. Her husband helps her work the plot of land she rents. During the afternoon, she milks the cows and makes cheese to sell to neighbors.

She is requesting this loan to buy a heifer, which in the future will help her produce more milk and increase her income to support her family.

Her plans are to continue working very hard to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer for his children.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 38-year-old lady who is single with children. She separated from her husband eight years ago. She is a resident of Mmunyonyo–Butiga, a developed suburb just 3 km from Kampala City. She has been operating a ladies’ salon for the last six years with limited working capital. She faces the challenges of seasonality of the business because her peak season is during wedding seasons and student holidays, and high rent costs. She has also been borrowing money from another bank but was referred to UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd for a loan facility by one of our clients who recommended UGAFODE’s rates as friendly and good customer service. She applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy hair dryers for her salon so that she will be able to provide quick service to her customers, especially on days when she is working on brides. She is very grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Jemeo

texts.en: Jemeo is a 31-year-old mother of twins, married and a resident of Kagoma. She operates a number of mobile money outlets within her area and in town. In total, she operates three outlets. However, her challenge is that she has little float (money put on phone lines to use) and to earn more profits, she needs a higher amount of float. Thus, she applied for a loan of UGX.1,500,000 from UGAFODE. She will repay this loan using the proceeds from her mobile money business.

loans.use: to obtain mobile money float

loans.name: Reem

texts.en: Reem is a 19-year-old, single lady from a small village near Nablus city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father is an employee in a local firm with a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Reem is a university student where she studies finance. She would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future to help improve her family’s living conditions. Reem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Reem will be able to read articles and write the reports easily. This will help her to get very high marks. Reem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Evaket

texts.en: Evaket is a 29-year-old woman who operates a motorcycle spare parts business. She is married with four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Evaket has seen her business progress time after time as she has worked hard to realize enough income to establish her new business. She dreams of having a big wholesale business and to build a residential house for her family. Although, with a devoted determination, limited capital hinders her business. Evaket is requesting another loan to buy more spare parts like tires, tubes, and oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts like tires, tubes  and oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand a business employing 300 women weavers and 1,000 farmers in rural Cambodia.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 58 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades, su familia está formada por dos nietos y su esposa quienes le ayudan en las actividades diarias.

Jorge se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para ordeñar y luego irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus nietos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. Que necesita para la siembra.

Sus planes a futuro son tener más ganado de ordeño.
texts.en:
Jorge is 58 years old. He makes a living in agriculture and livestock. He grew up with his parents, who taught him this work. His family is made up of two grandchildren and his wife, who help him with the daily work.

Jorge gets up at 5:30 a.m. to do the milking and then go to the plots of land where he works mornings with his grandchildren. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the cows that they own.

He needs the requested loan to buy the agricultural supplies, like pesticide, seed, manure, etc., that he needs for sowing. His plans for the future are to have more livestock for milking.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, like pesticide, seed, and manure, for sowing.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador tiene 53 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 20 años de edad.

Salvador  se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a su hijo y su esposa que le apoyan en las actividades agrícolas.


	El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. 

Él planea en un futuro comprar ganado y generar producción de leche con ayuda de otro crédito y con la ayuda de su hijo.
texts.en:
Salvador is 53 years old. He has a partner and a 20-year-old son. 

Salvador gets up at 5 a.m. to go to the plots of land where he works mornings with his son and his wife, who help him with the agricultural work.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies like poison, seeds, manure, etc. In the future he plans to buy livestock and produce milk with the help of another loan and his son.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like poison, seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his work.

loans.name: Azganush

texts.en:
Azganush is a widow from Kaqavadzor village, of the Aragatsotn region. She lives with her 25-year-old daughter. 

Azganush has been engaged in animal husbandry for many years. She keeps cattle, including two cows, two pigs, and 35 hens. Azganush's daughter helps her a lot and is also fully engaged in agricultural activities. 

Azganush has previously taken several loans to finance her agribusiness. She has a very good credit history, so far, with no overdue days. She has now applied for another loan of USD 2,500 to buy animal feed. In particular, she wants to buy grass (400 packs), barley (1000 kg), and sawdust (20 bags). 

Azganush's agribusiness really needs these investments to grow further. Let's help this hard-working woman and her daughter prove that they are able to overcome difficulties and implement their goals.

loans.use: to pay for animal feed.

loans.name: Shyama

texts.en:
Shyama is a 24-year-old housewife.  She is married to a farmer named Sambhu, aged 33 years. Shyama studied until grade six, whereas her husband attended school up to eighth standard. The couple has two school-going children (one son and one daughter); both are in grade one. They live in West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district. Shyamaa, being a homemaker, lives with her children and husband and takes care of all household work.

Shyama's husband has been involved in doing agribusiness on his ancestral lands.  He grows vegetables, such as beans, ladies’ fingers (okra), eggplants, gourds, etc., and sells these to the distributors. 

Shyama, who is young and energetic, helps her husband by sowing and harvesting the produce. Together they carry the produce to the market for sale.  

In spite of their tireless work, the income from this business is not at all sufficient to cover the household expenses. They thought it over, and have decided to cultivate jute on their farmland. This crop has a good potential and is profitable, too. That's why they have chosen this crop for cultivation.

With this aim, Shyama has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase agricultural inputs to cultivate jute. She hopes this loan will help her to respond to her customer demand and at the same time, earn revenue to increase their business activity; thus give better living standards to their family.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating jute on their farmland.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is 46 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells lace, cloth and sewing accessories in Ghana-Accra and has requested a 1,200 GHS loan through ID-Ghana to buy items to sell like lace, cloth and sewing accessories. Ruby has borrowed and repaid two loans from ID-Ghana before this loan. She has been running her business for 10 years. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lace, cloth and sewing accessories.

loans.name: José Morán

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, dejó sus estudios ya que tuvo que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la atención en una pequeña tienda que tiene en el hogar, tiene 3 hijos y solo dos de ellos asisten a la escuela.

José se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, y a trabajar de jornal, también él es diácono de una iglesia evangélica,  donde es responsable de la administración, y tienen en construcción la casa de la iglesia.

El crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar el hierro, lámina y pagar la mano de obra, pues es época de lluvia, y necesitan terminar la casa de la iglesia que están construyendo.

 Planea continuar mejorando la iglesia para que sus hijos sigan su ejemplo, trabajará duro para que ellos estudien ya que él no pudo hacerlo, y le gustaría hacer mas grande su casa para mejorar la comodidad de toda su familia.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and studied through the third grade.  He left school since he had to work to help his parents.  His wife is in charge of the household duties and is also responsible for a small store that they have in their home.  They have two children, and only two of them go to school.

José grows corn and beans, and he also works as a day laborer.  Additionally, he is a deacon in an evangelical church, where he is responsible for the administration, and he is building a house for the church.  

He is seeking a loan in order to purchase steel and laminated sheeting, as well as to pay for labor.  It is the rainy season, and they need to finish the church house that they are building.
