He plans to continue making improvements to the church so that his children will follow his example.  He will work hard so that they can complete school since he was not able to do so.  He would also like to expand his home so that his family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase steel and laminated sheeting, as well as to pay for labor.  It is the rainy season, and they need to finish the church house that they are building.

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is a very young housewife of 25 years of age. She is a mother of three little children (one son and two daughters) at this tender age. She is from Dhupguri. She stays with her husband and their children in a rural region of Jalpaiguri in their own small kachha house (a house made of straw, mud and bamboo). Their son goes to school and is in grade one. Kanika has a primary education, and her husband studied up to grade nine.

Kanika's husband has been engaged in agricultural activities for a long time. He got the idea of growing vegetables from his father, who was also a farmer. He initially started with growing a few vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes and onions, but later on he grew gourds, beans, etc. He has a very good relationship with his customers, as he sells fresh vegetables.  

Now he has a new idea to grow cucumbers on his farmland to satisfy his customers.  The fruit is in much demand in the region, but he does not have the capital. So, Kanika wants to help her husband.

She has heard about BJS and that they give business loans to rural women. She applied for a loan from them to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural supplies to start cultivation. 

She is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who will give her full efforts to have a successful and profitable business with which she can fulfill her dreams. She aspires to construct a better and decent house for them to live in.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate cucumbers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a hardworking housewife and mother of three children (one son and two daughters). She lives in West Magurmari in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district with her family. She is 41 years old, active and energetic and wants to see her husband and children happy.  Her husband Basudeb is a small carpenter.  Both have a primary education.  Two of her children are students at the secondary level, one is doing graduation in Arts.

Sabita's husband has been doing the work as a carpenter, making small wooden furniture and selling it locally.  For the last few years, his business has not been going well, as he could not invest in this business.  So, Sabita started breeding livestock to help her husband to run the family and meet the educational expenses of her children.  She has a cow and a few goats.  She sells milk to her neighborhood.  She wants to improve her milk business and wants to supply milk to more clients.  Generating income for the family is her greatest motivator.

With this aim, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase one more cow.  She wants to improve the state of her dairy farm.  This only serves to generate more money that will go to improving her family's livelihood. In the future, she wants to purchase more cows to make a cattle herd.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kallumeettumarriamman Shg Group

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year old Chandhra is a member of the Kallumeettumarriamman Self Help Group started by an NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Veppathur village.

Chandhra lives in her own house with her two children and husband, Rajmanikam. He is small marginal farmer. They have taken loans from PAT before and repaid them on time.

Chandhra needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which reduces cooking time and saves money for the betterment of the family, society and environment. This stove costs INR 1,400. It comes with a single burner and is highly efficient for daily use. She can use any type of biomass and fuel. It produces 70% less smoke and is 65% more fuel-efficient than traditional stoves.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Srimahasakthi Shg Group

texts.en:
Sundhari belongs to “Srimahasakthi” Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). She has been receiving PAT’s support for the last five years. 

Sundhari is married and living in Nagamangalam, a small village in Tamil Nadu. She is married to Mr. Selvakumar and has two children. The family is living in their own house

If scattered women’s strength is united, big things can be achieved. Uniting women and mobilizing their strength is the basic organizing process done through Self Help Group (SHG) promotion work. The SHG system has proven to be very relevant and effective in offering women the possibility to break gradually the gender inequality, exploitation and isolation. 

Sundhari, after seeing the demonstration of how the smokeless stove works, wants to have one in her kitchen. She along with the other 12 members’ is requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove.
 
The Greenway Smart Stove reduces smoke emissions by up to 80%. In the long term, it also positively impacts their health. 

Sundhari and her group members are excited about this stove as they can save on fuel and have less smoke in the house.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction equipment.  He needs to buy a good polishing machine,

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 37-year-old, married man, with three children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa and he has so many cocoa plantations. He supplies cocoa agents and wishes to complete his residential house. He is faced with unfavorable weather changes. 

Edward intends to use the loan to buy raw materials, like sand and bricks, to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, like sand and bricks, to complete his house.

loans.name: Kanchana

texts.en:
Kanchana is a young woman of 23 years who has completed her secondary education.  She is married to Amit who is 30 years old and passed grade 12. She is a mother of one young son.  Together they live in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud) in West Magurmari, which is a remote region in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband is a farmer by profession who has a plot of land. He works hard to come out ahead in vegetable cultivation.  He mainly grows potatoes, eggplant, bitter gourd etc.  He has seven years experience working on his farm.  His products are in much demand in the markets.  Kanchana is an energetic and hardworking woman.  Although she is a housewife who looks after her husband and son and does the household jobs, she helps her husband in his work a lot, especially at the time of harvesting and carrying the products to the market for sale. The income for her family greatly depends on this agribusiness, so she and her partner want to develop it by growing another vegetable. They have chosen to grow yams (a large root vegetable that looks like a tube and is widely used by the underprivileged people in rural West Bengal).

Kanchana is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to be able to support the purchase of agricultural inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.  Her dreams are to support her son in his studies, improve their quality of life and continue strengthening the family assets.

She dreams of constructing a concrete-made house for them in the future and she is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow yams

loans.name: Ilda Maira

texts.es:
Ilda tiene 43 años de edad, no tiene mucha preparación académica, es una mujer soltera y vive con 2 hijos.
 
Ella es empleada en una venta de comida en una ciudad, tiene que viajar todos los días en bus por 20 minutos, cuenta con  8 años dedicándose a esta actividad y de esta manera ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante, además le gusta engordar cerdos para luego venderlos.

Ilda necesita el préstamo para comprar 3 cerdos y de esta manera obtener un poco de dinero que contribuir en los gastos de la casa.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales y gocen de una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ilda is 43 years old, single, and lives with two children. She does not have much academic training. 

She is an employee in a food sale business in the city. Every day she has to travel for 20 minutes by bus. She has eight years dedicating herself to this activity, and in this way has managed to bring her children out ahead. She also likes to fatten pigs to later sell them. 

Ilda needs the loan to buy three pigs and in this way get a little bit of money that contributes to the home costs. 

She dreams that her children will become professionals and enjoy an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Thamarai Shg Group

texts.en:
People's Action for Transformation (PAT) has formed Self-Help Groups (SHG) since the year 1998. SHGs play a major role in poverty alleviation and women’s empowerment in rural India. PAT actively engaged the members of SHGs in savings and internal credit, as well as in other activities such as income generation, natural resources management, literacy, child care and nutrition, etc. In this way, it provides a chance for women to have control over capital, though it is small in size. 

Revathi (the lady who is standing with her hand raised in the middle) is the featured borrower of  “Thamarai” SHG, which PAT has been supporting by giving loans for the last five years. With the loans, the borrowers have improved their livelihoods.   


Revathi lives in a small hamlet in a rural area, Thiruvidaimaruthur, in Trichy District. She is married to Ravi, and they have three children who are all going to a local school. Her husband is a farmer by profession.   
        
Revathi and four other diligent women want to buy a smokeless stove for their kitchens, for which they are requesting a loan. This will help them to have a good environment with fresh air in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 21 years old and lives with his parents and four siblings in Madaba, Jordan. His father works in a hotel and his mother is retired. Mohammad is a third-year university student majoring in gymnastics. He is facing a problem in paying fees for the upcoming semester and is seeking a loan to pay help him make the payment.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming college fees

loans.name: Dúo Chimaltecas Group

texts.es:
DUO CHIMALTENCAS
La señorita Nora del Carmen de 35 años, soltera,  desde hace 5 años posee una venta de ropa ambulante en Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señorita Nora es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE KIVA; con el préstamo quiere comprar más ropa de hombre y mujer, para  seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
DUO CHIMALTENCAS [Chimaltenangan Duo]

Nora del Carmen is 35 years old and single. She has had a clothing business as a street vendor for 5 years in Chimaltenango. Due to her efforts, she has succeeded in establishing and improving her home. By way of her business she has supported her family and they have come out ahead. 

Nora's dream is to be able to improve the quality of life for her and her family through the loan she is requesting from FAPE and Kiva. She wants to buy more women's and men's clothing with the loan to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 44 years old, married and the mother of seven children who range in age from 24 to 6 years old. She has made a living by selling soft drinks for the last four years. She is requesting her second loan for 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use it to buy more soft drinks to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and will use the profits she earns from this one to pay her children's school fees. Her goal for the future is to grow her business and open another location.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es: Vilma de 44 años de edad ella es muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace varios años y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que obtiene no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar cemento, hierro, ladrillos, arena y pago de mano de obra, para terminar de construir las paredes y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Vilma, 44 years old, is very hard working and responsible. She lives in her own home with her two children. She has earned a living through agriculture for many years and sells her products in different markets that are found near her place of residency. 

She wants to improve her home but she is unable to with what she makes. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy cement, iron, bricks, sand and to pay for labor to finish construction on the walls. This way she and her family can live comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, bricks, sand and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es:
Ana tiene 41 años de edad, es una mujer soltera y muy trabajadora, vive con tres de sus hijos, 2 niñas y un niño, la hija mayor se acompañó y no vive con ellos.

Ana se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, y también tiene una tienda de productos varios para el hogar, como gaseosas, carnes, queso, aceite, etc.  El negocio lo inició hace 10 años, empezó con poco, pero con esfuerzo y dedicación fue creciendo. Anteriormente Ana era empleada, siendo cajera en una distribuidora, pero siempre soñaba con tener su negocio propio y fue cuando se decidió a empezar con la venta de frutas y verduras.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería y también para terminar de arreglar un cuarto de la casa que lo van a utilizar para un salón de belleza para una de sus hijas, la cual es cosmetóloga. 

Sueña con poder remodelar su puesto de venta y también con que su hija se estabilice con su salón de belleza, y de esta manera gozar de una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a very hardworking 41-year-old single mother.  She lives with three of her four children - two daughters and a son.  Her eldest daughter is married and does not live with them.

Ana sells fruits and vegetables, and she also has a small store in her home in which she sells various products, such as soft drinks, meats, cheese and oil.  She started the business 10 years ago, starting out with very little.  However, with effort and dedication the business has grown.  Previously she was employed as a cashier for a distributor, but she always dreamed of having her own business, and she decided to start by selling fruits and vegetables.

She needs this loan in order to purchase more merchandise and also to finish repairing a room in her home so that one of her daughters, who is a beautician, can use it as a salon.

She dreams of being able to remodel her store and also that her daughter will be able to establish her beauty salon, so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and also to finish repairing a room in her home so that one of her daughters, who is a beautician, can use it as a salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maintain his corn crop

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa, a 21-year-old lady living in Irbid, Jordan with her family, consisting of six members, is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems. Now in her third year and seeking to finish her studies so that she can support her family in the future, Randa is requesting this loan to help pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to sell as well as a special printing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, iron and steel to build his house.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir is 33 years old and lives in the Baku region with his large and lovely family. His family consists of four people: Zakir’s wife, who is a housewife, and his two daughters, who are five and six. For the past seven years, Zakir has been a taxi driver. His car needs repair and he wants to also repair his engine.

Zakir is requesting a 700 AZN loan to repair his car engine. He is thankful to Kiva and all lenders for their help.

loans.use: to pay for engine repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 42-year-old married woman who lives with her family in Southern Ghour, Jordan. She is a mother with a daughter and four sons. For the past four years, Sabah has been selling clothes from her house. Her business is profitable and has helped her to cover her children’s needs. 

Sabah is requesting a loan to help her buy more clothing to sell. She will use her loan to raise her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 28 years old. She is married to Jared, who is a businessman, and they are blessed with two children ages six and two. For the past three years, Hellen has been selling second-hand clothing and she earns 6,000 KES each month.
	
Hellen is requesting a 22,500 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to add more stock of second-hand clothing to sell. This will be her second loan. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Hellen will use the profit from her loan to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 42 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta el bachillerato, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja es ama de casa, tienen un hijo de 4 años que aún no está en la escuela y solamente ellos viven en casa. 

Jorge se dedica a la recolección de leche con una empresa, trabaja de lunes a sábado, él viaja a diversos lugares y se transporta en un camión pequeño, el horario es de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm. 

El crédito lo necesita para reparar el vehículo y para comprar algunos muebles.

Los sueños para su familia es que logren tener una casa con los muebles necesarios y que su hijo logre convertirse en una gran persona.
texts.en:
Jorge is 42 years old. He accomplished studying through his bachelors. He is currently in a relationship, and his partner is a house cleaner. They have a four year old child who still is not in school, and they live alone.

Jorge is dedicated to the collection of milk with a business. He works from Monday to Saturday, traveling to different places and is transported in a small truck. The schedule is 6:00 am to 6:00 pm. 

He needs the loan to repair the vehicle and to buy some furniture. 

His dreams for his family are to accomplish having a house with the necessary furniture and that his son becomes a great person.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and to buy some furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for the semester

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 25-year-old lady living with her five-member family in Mafraq, Jordan. She is a 2nd-year diploma student majoring in medical records.  Hanan is seeking to finish her study journey so that she will support her family in the future. She has applied for this loan because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 28-year-old single woman without children. She works hard to provide for herself by selling beads and underwear in Ghana-Accra. Elizabeth has requested a GHS 1,300 loan through ID-Ghana to buy items to sell, such as beads and underwear.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid five loans from ID-Ghana before this loan. She has been running the business for six years. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for herself.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beads and underwear.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is a self-employed woman from Shaghap village, of the Ararat region, where she lives with her husband (in photo). They have been engaged in animal husbandry and farming for nine years. They keep cows and hens, and also have an orchard where they grow potatoes, apples, and garlic.

Lena has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Lena has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International.

The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. The requested loan of USD 2,600 will be a big support for this family. Lena and her husband plan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, buy fuel, and also invest some amount of money into plowing soil. They will appreciate any kind of support from the lenders. Please help this hardworking woman and her husband make their goals come true.

loans.use: to finance soil plowing activities, pay for fertilizers and pesticides, and purchase fuel.

loans.name: Braulio Emilio

texts.es: Braulio: Es un hombre luchador, tiene 36 años de edad, está casado, tiene un  hijo. Desde hace más de una década habitaba en una casa de tambo de madera, con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para construir poco a poco,  comprar materiales de construcción: láminas de zinc, cementos, bloques y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas, cercar su patio por mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Braulio is a striving man who is 36 years old and married with a son. For more than a decade, he's lived in a wooden stilt house.

His intent is to live in a secure and dignified manner. He's seeking financing to build little by little, to buy construction materials: zinc sheets, cement, blocks and to pay for labor.

His dream is to give his family a home with adequate conditions and to fence their yard for better security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like zinc sheets, cement and blocks; and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: María Sofía

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 5° grado, actualmente está casada y su pareja trabaja como vendedor de dulces sorpresas, tiene dos hijos que estudian y solamente ellos viven en casa. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace unos 7 años, se decidió por esto ya que es algo rentable, lo aprendió por medio de una amiga y es el único trabajo que realiza, la venta la realiza en todo el cantón donde ella vive en un horario de 7:00 am a 12:00 md. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más ropa para la venta.

Los sueños para su negocio es que logre tener un local para no hacer ventas ambulantes, y espera que sus hijos logren salir adelante
texts.en:
María is 46 years old.  She was able to reach the fifth grade.  She is married and her spouse works selling sweets.  She has two children who are in school and live in their home.  She has worked selling clothing for the past seven years.  She decided to enter this business because it is profitable.  She learned the trade from a friend, and it is the only job she has.  She makes her sales throughout the whole canton where she lives from 7am to noon.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase more clothing to sell.  Her dreams for her business are to have a retail location so she can stop making door-to-door sales, and for her children to get ahead.

loans.use: purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jonny

texts.es: Jonny: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, casado, tiene 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace 9 años vive en una casa de tambo de madera, la cual es compartida por 4 parientes. Trabaja en el gobierno municipal. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda solicita su segundo financiamiento, para cambiar la madera de la vivienda, comprar: Clavos, postes de madera, madera de pino. Su sueño es terminar de acondicionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jonny is a hardworking man and a native of Puerto Cabezas. He's married and has three school-age children.

For nine years, he's lived in a wooden stilt house with four relatives. He works for the local government.

He's asking for a second loan to improve his home. To change the house's wood, he will buy nails, wood posts and pine wood. 

His dream is to finish putting up his house.

loans.use: to change the wood on his stilt house.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio: Es originario de Puerto Cabezas, casado, tiene 4 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el objetivo de tener una fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su hogar desde hace aproximadamente 20 años trabaja en alta mar, capturando langosta, para su comercialización en el mercado del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Solicita su primer financiamiento para reparar las nasas, y herramientas de captura de mariscos. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Sergio was born in Puerto Cabezas, and is married with four school-age children.  To provide his family with a source of income he has worked for 20 years on the high seas, catching  lobsters to sell in the city market of Puerto Cabezas.  Sergio is asking for his first loan to repair the lobster pots and his tools for catching shellfish.  His dream is to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to repair lobster pots and tools for capturing shellfish

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is a very young woman of only 23 years from Dhupguri.  She is married and blessed with three young children. She is married to Naresh who is 35 years old.  They live in their own Kaccha house (a house made of bamboo, mud and straw) in Shalbari in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Shefali and her husband both are uneducated and can only sign their names. Two of her children are receiving an education in different grades of the primary and secondary level.  The third one is too young for school.

Shefali is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Her husband decided to farm as they have their own land and he has experience in this field. He grows paddy rice on his farmland with the help of his spouse.  As rice is the staple food for the people of her locality and in West Bengal, it is a very profitable business.  He has earned a good many customers with his simple and polite behavior and he sells quality products at a reasonable rate. Now in order to satisfy his customers and to cope up with the growing increase in essential commodities, he needs to grow more paddies.  He needs financial help as he lacks the capital.

To help her husband to continue his agribusiness, Shefali has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use the loan to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to start cultivation during this monsoon, which is the suitable time to cultivate this crop.  After the harvest, they will sell their products to their customers.

She hopes she will develop her business and with the profit, improve her family's financial condition and save money for the future to purchase a tractor to help in their business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a young woman of 31 years.  She is married to Bidyut. She is a housewife but energetic, hardworking and optimistic.  They have a young son. They live in a small simple house in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

For the past few years, Ratna's husband has been working in his store where he sells and repairs mobile phones and their accessories. He established his business five years back by using money he had saved and renting a small store with a few mobile devices. It's a good business. He has gained good experience and become well known in his area for not only selling mobile devices, but also providing maintenance for his customers. He spends part of his profits on his family and the rest on expanding his business. Ratna and her husband now want to improve their business.

Ratna wants to help her husband.  She is an intelligent and active woman.  She learned about BJS and has taken a loan from them. This loan will help her husband to buy more mobile phones and accessories to sell in his store. She hopes for a good profit from this business to further expand the business for the secure future of her family.

She and her husband highly appreciate their lenders for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To help her husband to buy more mobiles and accessories to sell

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita, 33 years old, is a married woman and a mother of two loveable daughters. She is from the rural village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She and her husband Paresh both received a primary education and due to the lack of economic resources, they could not continue further education.  Their daughters attend school. They are in grade 10 and grade 7. They have their own kachha house (made of bamboo and mud).

Sabita's husband, 44 years old, is a carpenter.  He makes small wooden furniture like chairs, tables, desks etc., which he sells to his neighbors, who are his main clients.  He has no consistent income.  So, it was very tough for Sabita to manage her household with her husband's small earnings.  Therefore, she decided to help her husband with her own income. For this reason, she started a business selling saris (a traditional Indian dress for women).  She has a small shop adjacent to her house.  She buys different varieties of saris from the wholesale market and sells in her area.  Now she is playing an important role by giving financial support to her family.

With the growing needs of her family and the increasing educational expenses of her daughters, she wants to expand her business.  She applied for a loan from BJS to stock a variety of saris in different colours and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

She is a successful entrepreneur.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and her plans are to provide her daughters with good food, health and education.  She dreams of constructing a better house for them with the profit generated from her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for their help.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of saris (a traditional Indian dress for women) to sell.

loans.name: Karla Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karla de 23 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 9° grado, no pudo continuar debido a la situación económica, está soltera y tiene una niña de 3 años por lo cual no tiene ayuda de nadie para sacar adelante a su hija.

Actualmente trabaja en un negocio de venta de helados, tiene 2 años de trabajar en ese lugar, logró encontrar el trabajo ya que una amiga le ayudó, para llegar debe hacerlo en microbús el cual tarda 40 minutos en llegar, ella labora en un horario de 7:00 am a 4:30 pm. 

El préstamo lo necesita para llevar a su hija a pasar unas consultas médicas en un hospital.

Su sueño es ver a su hija crecer y que se convierta en una gran mujer.
texts.en:
Karla is 23 years old.  She was able to reach the ninth grade, but she could not continue because of her financial situation.  She is single and has a three year old daughter.  She does not have help from anyone to get her daughter ahead.  Currently, she works in a business selling ice cream.  She has worked in this place for two years.  She found the job with the help of a friend.  In order to get to work, she rides a bus that takes about 40 minutes to get there.  She works from 7am to 4:30pm.  

The loan she is seeking will be used to take her daughter for medical visits in a hospital.  Her dream is to see her daughter grow up and become a great woman.

loans.use: to take her daughter for medical visits in a hospital.

loans.name: José Herberth

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 4° grado, actualmente esta acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos que viven en casa, y nadie más depende de José.

Él se dedica al cultivo de pipianes, el trabajo lo aprendió por su abuelo ya que él no se crió con su papá, para llegar al lugar donde trabaja tarda aproximadamente unos 35 minutos y se va en bicicleta, el horario es de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm. 

El préstamo lo necesita para darle mantenimiento a la pipianera, comprará herbicidas y pagará la mano de obra.

Sus sueños son tener más parcelas de pipianes, espera que sus hijos crezcan y logren tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old.  He was able to reach the fourth grade.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have two children who live with them and no one else is dependent of José.  He works growing squash.  He learned this trade from his grandfather since he did not grow up with his father.  It takes him 35 minute to get to where he works and he rides his bicycle there.  He works from 6am to 1pm.

The loan that he is seeking will be used to care for his squash crops, purchase herbicides and pay for labor.  His dreams are to have more squash crops and for his children to grow up and have a better future.

loans.use: to care for his squash crops, purchase herbicides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Renu

texts.en:
Renu is a hardworking lady who is 49 years old from Dhupguri. She is married and a homemaker.  Her family consists of her husband and two adorable sons. She completed secondary education, whereas her husband studied in college.  Their sons are in college. They live in their own house in Baroghoria, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Renu's husband Nazrul is a building contractor.  He takes contracts for constructing buildings and earns money for his family through this work. But he has no permanent income.  As a result, it is quite difficult for him to bear all the expenses of his family, which includes household expenses and the educational expenses of his sons. Renu has decided to start a poultry farm business.  She wants to start the business from her house, by buying broilers (chickens raised for their meat).  The eggs and the broilers are the most demanded food items for the whole year.  So, for this purpose, she wants to buy chicks.

With this aim, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  To cope with the demand and to get maximum profit, she wants to use the loan for purchasing chicks.  She hopes this will generate more income for her family to reach her goals, which are to provide higher education to her sons and to increase her business.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy chicks to start a poultry farming business.

loans.name: Inocente Antonila

texts.es:
Una jornada laboral para Inocente empieza desde muy temprano, con el sonido de los primeros buses que salen a los demás departamentos del país, cuando los gallos y los pájaros empiezan a cantar, puesto que para ella el trabajo es algo que la apasiona. Para esta comerciante de 55 años, el colegio fue su guía hasta sexto grado debido a problemas económicos. Sin embargo, desde hace tres años tiene su propia pulpería con el apoyo de sus tres hijos mayores.  
Para Inocente su pulpería es su orgullo, porque ha visto que con todo su esfuerzo ha hecho que crezca de poco en poco. Anteriormente había hecho un préstamo KIVA, el cual sirvió con su crecimiento para comprar arroz y azúcar, pues sus clientes a diario lo solicitan. No obstante, su espíritu trabajador desea seguir cumpliendo, por esta razón, necesita de un nuevo préstamo para comprar: pastas de dientes, consomé, gaseosas, pan, arroz, azúcar, entre otros productos y así poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Su sueño es seguir invirtiendo en ella y su negocio.
texts.en:
The working day for Inocente begins very early with the sound of the first buses going off to the other departments in the country, when the birds and roosters start to crow. Work is something that fascinates her. For this 55 year old business woman school was her guide until Grade 6 when she had to quit due to economic problems. Nevertheless for the last 3 years she has run her own small store with the help of her 3 oldest children.

For Inocente her store is her pride as she knows all the effort she has made to see it grow little by little. She has had a loan from Kiva before, which helped her grow buying rice and sugar as her clients ask for these daily. However her working spirit wants to continue to satisfy and for this reason she needs a new loan to buy toothpaste, soup broth, soft drinks, bread, rice, sugar amongst other products. Then she can offer more variety to her clients. Her dream is to continue to invest in herself and her business.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soup broth, soft drinks, bread, rice, sugar, amongst others.

loans.name: Ana Ester

texts.es:
Ana tiene 61 años de edad, solamente estudió 6° grado, está casada y tiene 3 hijas, todas mayores y empleadas.

Ella trabaja como costurera en su casa, además cuida a un nieto que padece una enfermedad muy delicada. 

Ella necesita el crédito para poner en tratamiento a su nieto nuevamente ya que en otras ocasiones ha utilizado otros medios y ahora necesita de un apoyo para poder seguir con el tratamiento. 

Ella sueña con que su nieto se mejore y algún día verlo feliz.
texts.en: Ana is 61 years old.  She only reached the sixth grade.  She is married and has three daughters who are all adults and employed.  She works as a seamstress from her home.  She also cares for a grandson who has a very serious illness.  She is in need of a loan to put her grandson in treatment again because on other occasions she has used other means but she now needs some support to continue with the treatment.  She dreams of her grandson getting better and someday seeing him happy.

loans.use: put her grandson in treatment.

loans.name: José Martir

texts.es:
José tiene 69 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 4 hijos,  y solamente una hija vive con ellos la cual es madre soltera.


José desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado a comprar ganado, a la misma vez siembra maíz y frijol, su esposa se involucra y es su mano derecha en este trabajo,
Es lugar donde tiene las vacas está a unos 20 minutos de su casa y todos los días le toca llevarlas al potrero.


El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar 2 chivos y un saco de abono para no descuidar la milpa.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y es la agricultura, además, trabajar siempre con el ganado.
texts.en:
José is 69 years, he is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have four children and only one of their daughters, who is a single mother, lives with them.  For many years, José has worked buying livestock.  He also plants corn and beans.  His wife is also involved and is his right hand in this work.  The place where their cows are is 20 minutes away from their home and he takes them to the pasture everyday.  

The loan he is seeking will be used to purchase two goats and a bag of manure to care for his corn.  His dreams are to continue working in what he enjoys, which is agriculture, and to always work with livestock.

loans.use: purchase two goats and a bag of manure to care for his corn.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Memuna. She is married and has two children, aged ten years and one month old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her, assisting her in business and also in domestic work.  

In 2012, Memuna established her medicinal drugs business. Memuna sells mainly blood syrup, novalgin, paracetamol, pain relief, glucose, and pampers. She began her business in a group-lending stage. She took a small amount of money from the Association for Rural Development (ARD) and started a drinks business. Later, she changed the business to medicines, after she has got some experience in nursing.  

Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Memuna requires a loan in order to buy cartons of panadol, surgical spirits, blood tonic, pain tablets, and tetracycline injections. 

In the future, Memuna plans to further her nursing course, educate her children, and expand the business. This loan will help to improve her business. She is a family person and a hard-working woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of panadol, surgical spirits, blood tonic, pain tablets, and tetracycline injections for her business.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es:
Al escuchar el adjetivo “trabajador” en los primeros lugares de la lista está Rodolfo, un joven con título universitario como electricista de 37 años, quien a diario lucha consigo mismo para seguir creciendo personal y profesionalmente, para entregarles lo mejor a su hijo de 10 años y a su esposa. Hace un año, este joven inició en el mundo de las pulperías con la liquidación de un anterior trabajo como vendedor local. Poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo en el negocio, hasta llegar hasta donde está con el apoyo de su esposa y ningún otro ingreso más que este. 
Por esta razón, Rodolfo solicita de un préstamo para poder ampliar su negocio, comprar más jugos, papel higiénico, caramelos, sopas, galletas, entre otros productos que ofrece. Además de hacer mejoras en el local para hacer más visibles los productos que quiere aumentar, para obtener mayores ingresos y así poder sustentar a las tres personas que tiene a cargo. Entre sus planes está tener un negocio de reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras, de manera que pueda ejercer en la carrera que estudio. No obstante, por el momento quiere centrarse en su pulpería
texts.en:
When you hear of someone being "hard-working", Rodolfo has to be among those who are first on the list.  This young man, 37 years old, has an electrician degree, and struggles daily to continue growing personally and professionally, to provide the best to his 10 year old son and his wife.  A year ago Rodolfo got his beginning in the world of local stores, ending a previous job as a local vendor.  He has been investing in the business little by little,  getting this far with the help of his wife and with no other income besides this.

For this reason, Rodolfo is asking for a loan to enlarge his business, to buy more  juices, toilet paper, candy, soups, crackers and other products to offer for sale.  This is in addition to making  improvements in the place so that the products he wants to promote are more easily seen, so he can get a better income and thus support the three people in his family.   Among Rodolfo's plans is to have a business repairing and maintaining computers, so that he could be active in his field of study.  Nevertheless, for now he wants to concentrate on the general store.

loans.use: to buy more juices, toilet paper, candy, soups, crackers and other products

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es:
A sus 74 años, Augusto sigue siendo un hombre fuerte y trabajador, a pesar de usar un andarivel para caminar. Este comerciante y agropecuario, con una pequeña sonrisa, cuenta sobre sus nueve hijos independientes, quienes sirvieron de inspiración para iniciar su negocio, acerca de su esposa y de su vulcanización de hace 30 años, quien la sostiene con la ayuda de una de sus hijas.
Augusto posee otros ingresos que lo ayudan a su día a día en el trabajo, no obstante, considera que no es suficiente para cumplir con su sueño de extender su negocio, brindar mejor servicio y tener mayores ingresos. Por esta razón, necesita de un préstamo para comprar un motor que le permitirá brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes. En sus metas está seguir emprendiendo y trabajando, pues su pasión por el trabajo es infinita y sabe que ningún obstáculo podrá quitársela.
texts.en: At 74 years old, Augusto still feels like a strong man and a worker despite having to use a walker to get around. This salesman and farmer tells, with a little smile, of his 9 independent children who were the inspiration for starting his business, about his wife and his vulcanization service that has supported him for 30 years with the help of one of his daughters. Augusto has other sources of income which help him day to day with his work. But he considers it important to fulfill his dream of expanding his business, offering better service and generating more income. For this reason he needs a loan to buy a motor which will permit him to offer better service to his clients. His goals are to continue to undertake new things and work as his passion for work is infinite and he knows no obstacle can take that away from him.

loans.use: to buy a motor.

loans.name: Sheka

texts.en: This is 25 year-old Sheka.  He is married and has one child aged one year old. He has three additional dependents who live with him to be fostered and assist in business. In 2012, Sheka established his men's slippers business. He began his business because he dropped out of school for lack of sponsorship. He became a shop attendant for some years and his boss gave him some amount of money to start a business. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 890,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000.  Sheka requires a loan in order to buy bales of assorted slippers. In the future, Sheka plans to complete his house, expand his business and also educate his wife. This loan will help to increase his stock. Inadequate capital is his main challenge. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of assorted slippers.

loans.name: Rafaela Maria

texts.es:
La comida de Rafaela, de 47 años, es la mejor conocida en su comunidad desde hace ocho años, pues siempre ha ofrecido un excelente servicio como comerciante de comida y bebidas. El tren de la educación formal que tomó esta madre soltera de tres hijos, de los cuales solo está a cargo de una hija quien la apoya todo el tiempo en el negocio, llegó hasta la secundaria, debido a problemas económicos. Sin embargo, eso nunca la detuvo a ser una mujer luchadora. 
En estos momentos Rafaela necesita de un préstamo para comprar pollo, carne y arroz al por mayor, para ahorrar dinero y tener siempre producto que ofrecer. No obstante, este no es el primer préstamo de esta multifacética mujer. Con un ahorro que poseía pudo comprar verduras, carnes y frutas para su negocio. Los resultados, fueron positivos, pues ha ido mejorando su nivel de vida. El sueño de Rafaela es seguir desarrollándose en su negocio, pues sabe que al final se convertirá en una mujer autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Rafaela is 47 years old and her cooking has been well known in her community for eight years, as she has always offered an excellent service as a provider of food and drinks. This single mother of three children pursued her formal education only until secondary school, due to financial problems. That, however, never stopped her from being a persistent woman. She is only in charge of one daughter, who always supports her with her business. 

At this moment, Rafaela needs a loan to buy chicken, meat and rice in bulk, to save money and always have products to offer. This is not this multifaceted woman's first loan. With some savings she had, she was able to buy vegetables, meat and fruits for her business. The results were positive, as she has been improving her quality of life. Rafaela's dream is to continue developing her business, as she knows that she will become a self sufficient woman in the end.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and rice.

loans.name: María Berta

texts.es:
María de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado por razones de no haber más grados no pudo continuar aprendiendo, ella es madre soltera de 4 hijos, donde ella ha tomado  toda la responsabilidad de criar y enseñar a trabajar a sus hijos. En la actualidad vive con sus hijos los que aún no se han acompañado y dos nietas los demás de sus hijos ya están a parte. 

Ella es agricultora en pequeño, una mujer muy emprendedora capaz de sobre pasar lo que se propone, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol ya tiene más de 8 años de dedicarse a esto, ella también tiene sus ventas en la casa de charamuscas y chocobananos. El lugar donde ella siembra el maíz le queda a unos 10 minutos de su casa y se traslada caminando, ya que queda cerca de su casa y es propio el horario de trabajo que ella dedica para la milpa es de 6 de la mañana  a 11.30 de la mañana.


El préstamo será invertido en la compra de 3 sacos de abono, para abonar la milpa ya que con lo que ella compro de sus ahorros no le alcanzo y otra parte la necesita para pagarle a los mosos que le ayuda a ella, ya que  es madre soltera y necesita trabajar para llevar el alimento a su casa. 

Desea tener primero lo más necesario para ella, sus hijos y sus nietos , por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad de generar más ventas en su casa y tener más clientela, las ganancias serán destinadas una parte al gasto de la casa y al pago de la cuota y en seguir invirtiendo.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old and only attended school through the first grade because her school didn't offer classes beyond that level. María is a single mother of four children, whom she has raised entirely on her own and taught to work. She now lives with her unmarried children and two granddaughters. The other children live on their own. 

María is a small farmer, and a very industrious woman who can rise to meet any challenge. She has grown corn and beans for over eight years on a plot of land that is a 10-minute walk from her house. María usually works in the fields from 6 to 11:30 a.m., and also sells frozen juice and coconut milk treats and chocolate-covered bananas from her home.  

María will use some of the loan funds to purchase three bags of manure to fertilize her corn crop, as the amount of manure she was able to purchase with her savings was insufficient. María will use the rest of the loan funds to pay the laborers who help her, as she's a single mother and needs to work to put food on the table.  

María's primary goal is to meet her own basic needs as well as those of her children and grandchildren. She hopes to keep working as long as God grants her health and life, and this loan will help her generate higher sales at home and grow her customer base. She will dedicate this income to meeting her family's needs, but also to making her loan payments and continue investing in her farm.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of manure to fertilize her corn crop. The amount of manure she was able to purchase with her savings was insufficient and she'll need a loan to pay the laborers who help her.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 37 years old. He is married and, together with his spouse, they have been blessed with three children, who are 12, 10, and 6 years old, respectively.

Samson grows and sells Napier grass, a business he has done for the last six years, earning an income of  KES 15,000 per month.

Samson has applied for a loan of KES 15,000 which he will use to plant Napier grass. This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully repaying his previous loan.

Samson's desire is to have a stabilized business and to effectively provide for his family.

loans.use: to plant Napier grass.

loans.name: Ibrahim S

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Ibrahim S. He is married, and has four children aged 13, 10, 8 and an eight-month-old baby. He has two additional dependents who live with him to be fostered. Ibrahim S. owns a business selling travelling bags, suitcases and school bags.  Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,900,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ibrahim S. has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase traveling bags, suitcases and school bags. Although Ibrahim S. was unable to achieve his future plans yet, in the future he is still planning to have a shop and acquire a piece of land to build a house. This loan will help to improve the business. Sometimes there are low sales after the end of the month. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase traveling bags, suitcases and school bags.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona trabajadora y con deseos de sacar adelante a sus hijas.  Estudio hasta 6° grado, está soltero, tienen cuatro hijas, de los cuales dos asisten a la escuela.

Desde la edad de trece años, su padre lo llevaba a trabajar en la agricultura, y sembraban 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol. Carlos es un hombre trabajador, por lo cual, no le gusta depender solo de una actividad, es por eso que todavía trabaja en la agricultura y siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, además tiene un pick up en el cual realiza viajes, el objetivo de Carlos es no poner en riesgos los ingresos, para que sus hijas tenga lo básico para su subsistencia. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una novilla, así se le estará brindando a Carlos una nueva ayuda, para que pueda invertirlo en una actividad productiva muy buena, así tendrá otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.

 Carlos tiene planificado ayudar a sus 2 hijas para que continúen estudiando, y lo que más le gustaría es que se puedan graduar en educación superior, para lo cual trabajara muy duro para ayudarles a cumplir este sueño a sus hijas, además le gustaría comprar más ganado el siguiente año. También le gustaría mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, para que no pasen ninguna necesidad.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hard working person with the desire to help his daughters get ahead in life. He studied until the 6th grade, is single, and has four daughters, two of whom are in school.

He worked in agriculture with his father since he was thirteen years old. They sowed 10,500 square meters of corn and beans. Carlos is a hard working man, and therefore does not like to depend on one activity only. He still works in agriculture and sows 7,000 square meters of corn. He also has a pick up truck with which he transports people. Carlos' goal is not to put his income at risk so that his daughters have all of their basic needs met. 

This loan will be used to buy a heifer, which will provide a new source of income to Carlos. He will invest it in a very good and productive activity, and will have another source of income for his family. 

Carlos plans on helping his two daughters continue studying. What he would most like is for them to graduate from higher education. He will work very hard to help his daughters fulfil this dream. He would also like to buy more cattle next year. He would further like to improve his family's quality of life, so that they do not struggle.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Edwin Rolando

texts.es:
Edwin de 27 años de edad, esta estudiando bachillerato está acompañado,  él trabaja en un car wash, tiene tres hijos y viven en la casa con él y el primero asiste  a la escuela. 

 El cliente no tiene negocio pero trabaja en un car wash y se dedica a este oficio desde hace tres años, lo aprendió con la persona donde él trabaja también se dedica a la agricultura y en la agricultura trabaja con el padre.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono para el cultivo de maíz, un quintal de formula y dos sacos de sulfato y será satisfecha la necesidad de abonar el cultivo para tener una buena cosecha.

Pues su sueño para un futuro es que sus hijos estudien y crezcan con buena educación. El préstamo le ayudara para tener los granos básicos, que es el pan de cada día para su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old.  He is studying for his high school diploma and he is married.  He works at a car wash.  He has three children who live with him.  The oldest attends school.

He does not have a business, but he works at a car wash and has done that work for three years.  He learned the work from the person he works with.  He also works as a farmer together with his father.

He is requesting this loan to purchase manure for his corn crop, a quintal of fertilizer, and two sacks of sulfates to fertilize his crops in order to have a good harvest.  

His dream for the future is that his children study and grow up with a good education.  The loan will help him have basic grains, which are his family's daily bread.

loans.use: to purchase manure for his corn crop, a quintal of fertilizer, and two bags of sulfates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic home products (beans, rice, corn, etc.), as there is no grocery store close to where he lives and his business will therefore have high demand.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 46, is a smallholder farmer residing in Kitale, an agricultural town in the North Rift region of Kenya. He is arguably the most successful client of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. Tomatoes are David’s flagship produce. He sells more than 150 Kgs of tomatoes every day.

Back in 1991, David practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was doing only half an acre of maize crop per season. The returns were so meager that he could barely fend for survival. He kept doing maize farming for years without turning a profit until 2008, when he switched to tomato farming and there was light at the end of the tunnel for David.

Today, David is a fully-fledged entrepreneur. He has been provided with technical guidance, training programs and exposure visits. He has already serviced eight asset-based loans fully from Juhudi Kilimo! Through the loans, he has acquired high quality dairy cows, irrigation kits, water pumps, farm supplies, a grain mill, a dairy unit, horticultural input, a greenhouse and a tractor. He has employed four permanent staff from the village to help run his agribusiness.

To capitalize more on returns from the booming tomato farming, David is seeking a loan of KES 450,000 to build another greenhouse. Unlike his competition, David conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, he has created a name for himself and a demand for his produce.

Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of David’s goal, which is to expand the greenhouse zero. In the future, he is also planning to introduce zero grazing method, intensify his maize farming, and start value addition.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years, married to Anthony and together they are blessed with two children who are 10 and 1 years old.  Anthony helps to contribute additional income for the family.

Ruth sells groceries and operates a retail shop, a business she has done for four years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000 per month.

Ruth has requested a loan of KES 12,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she intends to use to buy supplies of groceries for resale. With the profits from the loan, Ruth intends to educate her child and expand her business further.

Ruth looks forward to having a sustained business.

loans.use: to buy supplies of groceries to sell

loans.name: Mzam

texts.en:
Mzam is 42 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married, and has six children. For the past eight years, Mzam has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells different types of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Mzam has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more second hand clothes to sell, and will help Mzam to generate greater profits and manage the family's cost of living. 

Mzam hopes that in the future she will be able to have the most attractive clothes that will attract more customers. 

Mzam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mzam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Cesar Enmanuel

texts.es:
Cesar de 22 años de edad, ha estudiado bachillerato automotriz, esta soltero,vive junto a con sus padres en casa familiar.


Cesar después de estudiar bachillerato comenzó a trabajar en un taller de mecánica automotriz y  debido a que en otros lados no se encuentra trabajo opto por mecánica el horario de trabajo de el es de 7:00 AM a 3:00 PM.

 
El préstamo lo utilizara para solventar una deuda en otra institución y para gastos personales.

El sueño de Cesar es siempre mantener siempre su trabajo y ayudarle a su madre a con un poco en lo económico y poder cancelar las cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en:
Cesar is 22 years old and has an automotive high school diploma.  He is single and lives with his parents in their home.

Cesar started working at an auto shop after finishing high school.  Since he did not find work in other areas, he chose to be a mechanic.  He works from 7:00am to 3:00pm.  

He will use this loan to settle a debt with another institution and for personal expenses.  

Cesar's dream is to keep working, help his mother a little with the household expenses, and make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to settle a debt with another institution and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Esther, a mother of three. She is based in Kerugoya, which is a rural town in central Kenya popular for coffee farming. Esther is a smallholder farmer who grows tea crops and keeps poultry for a commercial end. She sells the produce at a local market near her home. 

Esther has been a farmer for only four years. She finds poultry farming to be very enjoyable and fulfilling! However, her biggest challenge is marketing and selling her farm produce. 

Esther is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. 

With your loan, Esther is bound to increase her income by selling more eggs. The prices are sustainable as the demand for poultry products in Kenya continues to be high. 

The additional income from this expansion will relieve the high farm-related expense burden on Esther’s shoulders. Her family will also get to enjoy other benefits that come along with increased income, such as improved diet.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past six years, Christine has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells second hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shirts and skirts to sell and will help Christine to generate greater profits and improve the family's standard of living. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more shirts and skirts to sell

loans.name: Qoboko

texts.en:
Qoboko is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2014 at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU). He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“My studies have been less stressful. I’ve managed to cope well academically and improved on my grades due to KIVA. Not having to worry about groceries, transport, toiletries, etc., has made my life easier. Now I can say “Yes” I can graduate and make a difference to the world due to KIVA support. Thanks.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has four children; two of them are currently in school. For the past four years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his small hotel, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items to be used in his business, like sugar, fresh raw bananas, and Irish potatoes. 

This will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits, and pay school fees for his children in better schools. Emmanuel hopes that in the future, he will be able to provide better services in his business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items to be used in his business, like sugar, fresh raw bananas, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Zakaria, a small-scale farmer based in Muranga, Kenya. The Muranga region is known for production of coffee for export. He and his wife have been blessed with a child. For 14 years, Zakaria has been doing mixed farming. He makes a regular income selling milk, eggs, tea and vegetables at the local market.

One of the major challenges Zakaria has had to deal with is lack of cheap affordable labour. He has been forced to do most of the work on the farm by himself. One of the most hectic tasks that other farmers shy away from doing is fodder preparation. For this reason, they just set the cow free to graze on its own. However, Zakaria takes grazing management a bit too seriously to do this. He would rather purchase a machine that will make his work easier and more effective.

Zakaria is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter. This tool will greatly reduce the time and energy he spends chopping animal fodder by machete. The electric chaff cutter can also work over long periods and handle much greater volumes of fodder.

This will in a way reduce his highest monthly farm-related expenses. Your loan will benefit Zakaria’s family by enabling them to purchase a machine that will make their life easier and increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Cristino Ramos

texts.es:
Cristino de 50 años de edad,es empleado en gobernación, es casado su esposa se dedica a vender pupusas por las tardes en su casa,de su matrimonio tienen dos hijos.

Cristino por años se ha dedicado a trabajar como empleado de el gobierno una semana trabaja de día y la otra de noche, el trabajo le queda cerca a unos diez minutos.

 
Cristino solicita un préstamo para gastos personales,el cual quiere solventar una dificultad que se le ha presentado a su familia urgente.

El sueño de Cristino es que sus hijos finalicen sus estudien, ya que poco les falta y ellos trabajen y le ayuden a él y su esposa y seguir trabajando con CREDICAMPO.
texts.en: Cristino is 50 years old and works for the government. He is married and his wife works selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) in the afternoon at home. He has two children. He has worked for years as a government employee. He works during the day one week and at night the next. His work is about 10 minutes from his house. Cristino is requesting a loan for personal expenses. He wants to resolve a difficult and urgent situation that his family is dealing with. Cristino's dream is for his children to finish their studies, as they do not have a lot left. He wants them to work, so that they can help him and his wife. He also wishes to continue working with CREDICAMPO.

loans.use: to resolve a difficult and urgent situation that his family is facing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Ayanda

texts.en:
Ayanda is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2014 at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“The loan has been really helpful as I’ve been able to afford transport from where I stay to school everyday. I’m now a punctual learner compared to before. Thank you so much for assisting me with my education.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Fawe Pri Sch.koidu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 10,000,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Solomon is the featured leader of this team of teachers. Born in Nimikoro, in eastern Sierra Leone 43 years, Solomon is married to a housewife and the couple has four children. Solomon has served in the teaching profession for 16 years now. 

He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Alpha, posing with the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Cada mañana tras haber alistado a sus hijos para ir a clases, Esmeralda inicia a freír las tajadas de plátano y las papas, para luego venderlas en las afueras de su humilde casa, no hay persona que se resista a las exquisitas frituras que ella vende. Tiene 44 años de edad, está en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos. Antes de dedicarse a la venta de frituras comercializaba artículos de belleza pero quería pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, por lo que decidió iniciar otro negocio desde el hogar. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar plátanos, papas, condimentos, entre otros y al mismo tiempo iniciar las mejoras de la infraestructura de su cocina. Esmeralda deposita la confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela obtener más clientes y así poder incrementar sus ingresos. Es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, quién tiene grandes metas, una de ellas, establecer venta de verduras en uno de los mercados populares. Su compañero de vida ha sido su principal apoyo, juntos luchan por brindarles a sus hijos un futuro prospero.
texts.en:
Every morning after getting her children ready for school, Esmeralda begins to fry plantain slices and potatoes that she later sells outside her humble home. Nobody can resist the delicious snacks that she sells. She is 44 years old, has a common law partner and has four children. Before starting to sell snacks, she sold beauty products, but she wanted to spend more time with her children and decided to start another business at home. 

She is requesting this loan to increase her production. She needs to buy plantains, potatoes, and condiments, among other things. At the same time, she wants to begin improving her kitchen. Esmeralda puts her hopes in this loan, as she wishes to gain more customers to increase her income. She is a charismatic and hard working woman who has great goals. One of them is having a vegetable stand in one of the popular markets. Her life partner has been her main supporter -- they strive together to be able to provide a prosperous future to their children.

loans.use: to buy plantains, potatoes and condiments, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a dwelling for his family

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan:

“My studies have been going very well and the loan has helped a lot in reducing my past financial stress. I have been passing all the courses that have been paid for by Kiva and I appreciate all that you have done for me. Thank you very much!”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Julio César

texts.en:
Julio César is a small entrepreneur and Kubo financiero’s client, and this is his story:

Julio is 27 years old and is single. He studied chemical engineering at Mexico’s National University, where he graduated six years ago; time he has working in the chemical industry. Two years ago he decided to open his business of developing, fabricating, and selling home and personal use products, emphasizing green and environment friendly products.

Until this point Julio has financed his business with his credit cards, which has proved expensive and inefficient. 

He asks for this loan to invest it fully in the development of his company: buying a filling bomb, constructing a sanitary PVC system and a stainless steel outing for the filling system.

He aspires to continue growing his business, and in a near future study, a chemical master’s degree in order to be able to focus on the development of the business and delegate the operative tasks.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his chemical products business
